descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
Join Shield AI in shaping the future of autonomous aircraft! We’re looking for an Aircraft Structures Engineer to push the boundaries of UAV performance through cutting-edge structural design, analysis, and testing. In this role, you’ll collaborate with top-tier Mechanical, Systems, Propulsion, and Aerospace Engineers to ensure our lightweight, high-performance aircraft are built for speed, endurance, and reliability.

You’ll play a key role in designing, analyzing, testing, and optimizing airframe structures and components, ensuring they meet the highest standards for performance, weight, and safety. This is a unique opportunity to deepen your expertise in design, finite element analysis (FEA), composite materials, mechanical testing, and aircraft loads analysis—all within a fast-paced, high-tech aerospace environment where innovation takes flight.

If you have a passion for cutting-edge aircraft design, come help us build the future of intelligent aviation!

Job Description:
Join Shield AI in shaping the future of autonomous aircraft! We’re looking for an Aircraft Structures Engineer to push the boundaries of UAV performance through cutting-edge structural design, analysis, and testing. In this role, you’ll collaborate with top-tier Mechanical, Systems, Propulsion, and Aerospace Engineers to ensure our lightweight, high-performance aircraft are built for speed, endurance, and reliability.

You’ll play a key role in designing, analyzing, testing, and optimizing airframe structures and components, ensuring they meet the highest standards for performance, weight, and safety. This is a unique opportunity to deepen your expertise in design, finite element analysis (FEA), composite materials, mechanical testing, and aircraft loads analysis—all within a fast-paced, high-tech aerospace environment where innovation takes flight.

If you have a passion for cutting-edge aircraft design, come help us build the future of intelligent aviation!

lists.content:
• Lead the conceptualization and structural development of clean-sheet aircraft designs, ensuring innovative and mission-driven engineering solutions.
  • Integrate aerodynamics, propulsion, and structural requirements from the ground up to create next-generation UAV platforms that push performance boundaries.
  • Develop and refine cutting-edge finite element models (FEM) to push the limits of UAV structural performance.
  • Execute high-impact static, modal, fatigue, and vibration analyses to ensure our aircraft can withstand extreme conditions.
  • Perform critical hand calculations to validate FEA results, guaranteeing precision, accuracy, and structural reliability.
  • Design to optimize airframe structures, striking the perfect balance between weight, strength, and manufacturability.
  • Drive the development of innovative test plans for structural validation, including quasi-static, vibration, and shock testing.
  • Analyze real-world flight telemetry and structural test data to refine models and enhance predictive accuracy.
  • Define essential load cases, material properties, and design margins to fortify UAV airframe and mechanical components.
  • Deliver impactful structural analysis reports and technical recommendations that shape engineering decisions.
  • Collaborate across disciplines to align structural integrity with overall system performance, ensuring mission success.
  • Advance the future of UAV design by continuously improving structural analysis methodologies, tools, and best practices.

• B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field with a passion for structural innovation.
  • 5-10 years of hands-on experience in aircraft design, structural analysis, finite element modeling, or aircraft loads analysis.
  • Proficiency in industry-leading FEA tools such as ANSYS, NASTRAN, HyperWorks, or similar.
  • Exceptional ability to perform hand calculations for structural strength, stability, and fatigue analysis with precision.
  • Deep understanding of composite materials and lightweight aerospace structures for high-performance UAVs.
  • Experience with advanced mechanical testing methods, including static, vibration, and fatigue testing.
  • Strong command of data analysis tools such as Excel, MATLAB, Python, or similar for data-driven engineering.
  • Proven problem-solving skills, meticulous attention to detail, and a collaborative mindset to thrive in a dynamic team environment.

• Master’s degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering.
  • Experience in aircraft structural design, UAV airframe development, or aerospace testing.
  • Hands-on experience with structural testing, modal analysis, or composite modeling.
  • Exposure to CAD software (NX, SolidWorks) and PLM tools (Teamcenter or similar).
  • Understanding of aerospace industry standards, structural certification processes, and material selection.

Job Description:
The Wire Harness Manufacturing Technician Shield AI is responsible for the precision assembly, inspection, and testing of complex wire harnesses used in aircraft and aerospace systems. This role requires adherence to stringent quality standards, detailed technical specifications, and industry regulations (such as IPC/WHMA-A-620 and AS9100). The technician will contribute to building high-reliability products that meet the safety and performance requirements of aerospace applications.

Job Description:
The Wire Harness Manufacturing Technician Shield AI is responsible for the precision assembly, inspection, and testing of complex wire harnesses used in aircraft and aerospace systems. This role requires adherence to stringent quality standards, detailed technical specifications, and industry regulations (such as IPC/WHMA-A-620 and AS9100). The technician will contribute to building high-reliability products that meet the safety and performance requirements of aerospace applications.

lists.content:
• Wire Harness Assembly
  • Read and interpret aerospace schematics, technical drawings, and detailed work instructions.
  • Measure, cut, strip, crimp, and terminate wires and cables to precise tolerances using specialized tools and equipment.
  • Assemble wire harnesses, connectors, backshells, and shielding components per aerospace industry standards.
  • Route wires carefully to meet form board layouts, bend radii, and environmental specifications.
    • Quality and Compliance
  • Perform visual inspections, continuity testing, and high-voltage insulation resistance testing to verify conformance to aerospace standards.
  • Ensure all work adheres to IPC/WHMA-A-620 Class 3, AS9100, and other aerospace quality requirements.
  • Identify and repair defects, ensuring zero tolerance for errors that could impact safety or reliability.
  • Maintain traceability of all components, wires, and work performed.
    • Documentation and Reporting
  • Accurately complete production records, test logs, and quality assurance reports.
  • Maintain detailed documentation for traceability and compliance with aerospace industry standards.
    • Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
  • Work closely with engineers, quality control, and production teams to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
  • Provide feedback for process improvements and ensure compliance with lean manufacturing principles.
    • Adherence to Safety Protocols
  • Follow all safety regulations, including ESD (Electrostatic Discharge) prevention, PPE requirements, and cleanroom protocols where applicable.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace in line with aerospace safety standards.

• Technical Skills:
  • Strong proficiency in reading and interpreting aerospace schematics, blueprints, and work instructions.
  • Experience in wire harness assembly, including crimping, soldering, and connector assembly.
  • Familiarity with aerospace-specific components such as MIL-SPEC connectors, backshells, braiding, and shielding.
  • Experience with quality standards like IPC/WHMA-A-620 Class 3, AS9100, and MIL-STD requirements.
    • Attention to Detail and Precision:
  • Ability to work with tight tolerances and ensure 100% quality in all wire harness assemblies.
  • Strong problem-solving skills for identifying and addressing manufacturing defects.
    • Certifications:
  • IPC/WHMA-A-620 Certification (Class 3) required or willingness to obtain.
  • Certification in soldering to J-STD-001 standards preferred.
    • Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to work with small components, perform repetitive tasks, and sit or stand for extended periods.
  • Good manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination.
    • Education and Experience:
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • 2+ years of experience in wire harness assembly, preferably in aerospace, aviation, or defense industries.

• Certifications:
  • Certification in soldering to J-STD-001 standards preferred.

As a Visual Designer, you will help showcase the Shield AI story by devoting your design talent to the creation of assets for our website, collateral, papers and presentations. You will work alongside a team devoted to excellence, committed to collaboration, and focused on helping customers and talent understand the power of AI and Shield AI’s power to protect service members, first responders and civilians.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Visual Designer, you will help showcase the Shield AI story by devoting your design talent to the creation of assets for our website, collateral, papers and presentations. You will work alongside a team devoted to excellence, committed to collaboration, and focused on helping customers and talent understand the power of AI and Shield AI’s power to protect service members, first responders and civilians.

lists.content:
• As a Visual Designer, you will work with our Design and Marketing teams to produce critical marketing assets to help tell the Shield AI story and showcase our cutting-edge AI and robotics technology. Job responsibilities will include: 
  • Provide design support across Shield AI products and marketing touchpoints. 
  • Design and produce print materials (presentation materials, manuals, product collateral, marketing assets). 
  • Design and edit graphics for online use (website, email campaigns, social media, etc). 
  • Create infographics, product collateral and other marketing assets. 
  • Collaborate with designers and marketers to ensure all visual materials adhere to the Shield AI brand and reflect the company’s values. 
  • Maintain digital assets organized and enhance library of components.

• You have delivered as part of a design team -- whether freelance or in-house -- and are skilled in creating collateral and other creative marketing assets. 
  • 2+ years professional design experience. 
  • Strong typography, layout and print design skills. 
  • Experience designing for web and online media outlets. 
  • Strong knowledge and passion for visual design best practices.  
  • Experience with photography shooting and editing
  • You understand how to tell a story through visual and creative assets. 
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others. 
  • You are patient, you are kind, you have poise and you don’t shy away from delivering excellent work even while facing tight deadlines for a dedicated team which values your effort. 
  • You are creative and excited about working across teams to further the Shield AI mission by sharing it across media. 
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with ease.

• Experience with motion design (Adobe After Effects)
  • Experience working in web and UI design is a plus but not required.

lists.content:
• As a member of the Hivemind Systems Integration Team, you will:
  • Deliver compelling, reliable, and well-tested autonomy capabilities through the Hivemind Enterprise Product
  • Streamline the process of developing autonomy with the Hivemind Enterprise Product
  • Support the use of the Hivemind Enterprise Product on new systems and for novel applications.

• Members of the Hivemind Systems Integration team will: 
  • Lead the design, development, and execution of cross-functional or system-wide capabilities that deliver impact to users of the Hivemind Enterprise Product.  Work with several functional teams to implement solutions and integrate them into the product
  • Identify functional gaps in the product backlog and quickly deliver prototypes that still align with the broader vision and architecture.
  • Ensure that Hivemind Enterprise capabilities can be measured against system requirements. Ensure that each capability has testable acceptance criteria and that Hivemind has the analyzers and test infrastructure to measure those criteria. 
  • Identify root causes for reported issues and, if capable, address them. Otherwise, work with functional teams to address bugs in the stack.

• Minimum of 2 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 0 years and a Master’s degree or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.
  • Deep experience with C++14 and beyond
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with git or other modern version control systems (e.g. mercurial)
  • Experience with modern package managers (i.e. Conan)
  • Experience working in large, complex, distributed systems
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.
  • You have a willingness to jump out of your comfort zone to help out other teammates as needed.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.

• Experience with C++17 or greater
  • Comfortable analyzing data to improve design and performance of a system
  • Experience with hands-on debugging of complex software and autonomy systems
  • Experience with robotics frameworks, such as ROS, and simulators (e.g. AirSim)
  • Experience with cloud-based systems and infrastructure, containerisation technologies, Kubernetes, etc.
  • Familiarity with CUDA, streaming video, hardware integration, networking, communications
  • Understanding about a wide range of autonomy products

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.

additionalPlain: Our international team members are employed through our PEO partner and receive a comprehensive international benefits package on top of base salary. For full details on compensation and benefits, please consult your talent acquisition partner.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


The Business Development Manager - UK will play a pivotal role in driving the growth of Shield AI’s V-BAT business across Europe, with a primary focus on strategy development, execution, and market expansion in the UK. This individual will be responsible for engaging with customers and end users to enhance awareness of Shield AI’s cutting-edge solutions while strengthening the company’s brand presence. Operating within a dynamic, high-performing team, this role demands a high level of responsibility, accountability, and a results-driven approach to achieving strategic business objectives.

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Business Development Manager - UK will play a pivotal role in driving the growth of Shield AI’s V-BAT business across Europe, with a primary focus on strategy development, execution, and market expansion in the UK. This individual will be responsible for engaging with customers and end users to enhance awareness of Shield AI’s cutting-edge solutions while strengthening the company’s brand presence. Operating within a dynamic, high-performing team, this role demands a high level of responsibility, accountability, and a results-driven approach to achieving strategic business objectives.

lists.content:
• Engage with customers regularly to present and discuss Shield AI products
  • Attend trade shows, exhibitions, or other industry events to espouse Shield AI products
  • Devise and coordinate marketing and government relations opportunities
  • Build and devise the structure of industry partnerships
  • Plan and execute product demonstrations
  • Work cross-functionally to provide responses to or address customers needs
  • Lead proposal response
  • Develop industrial participation strategies
  • Manage team budget

• Willing to reside in or relocate to the UK, with >10 years of military, defense industry, or international business experience.
  • Deep understanding of UK military operations, acquisition processes, and defense systems, with strong government (civil and military) relationships.
  • Exceptional communicator with strong written, verbal, and presentation skills, adept at engaging all levels of business and government.
  • Charismatic leader who inspires others and drives excitement for Shield AI’s mission, technology, and products.
  • Strong technical knowledge in UAVs and AI (or the ability to learn quickly) and proficiency in MS Office.
  • Self-motivated, results-driven, and highly analytical, with a track record of exceeding critical goals.
  • Team-oriented, collaborative, and willing to travel frequently without restrictions.
  • Bachelor's degree required.

• Specific defense strategy or business development experience in Europe
  • Prior UAV or AI business development experience in a defense-related context
  • MBA or related Master’s degree in a related field, and 6+ years of leadership and/or operational experience within the UK MoD

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Shield AI has assembled a world class team of scientists, engineers and business leaders driven to make a difference. We come to work each day ready to support one another as together we create a company built to lead in the AI era.   

The Europe and Africa Business Team
Based out of Oslo, Norway, Shield AI’s International Team focused on Europe and Africa handles all strategy and business development activity in the these regions. This team works closely with US based Growth, Product, Operations and other internal functions as well as a variety of international partners and entities. It is our responsibility to build Shield AI’s business in these key markets, source opportunities, win deals, and execute international programs.   

The Role   
Think of this role as the Defense Tech equivalent to an Investment Banking/Management Consulting Associate program or Chief of Staff role. You will work side by side with, be trained by/support experienced defense professionals allowing you to quickly climb the steep learning curve of the industry, company, and international business. Through your work owning a wide variety of critical projects you will have direct impact on nearly all facets of the international business and develop a deep understanding of the company and industry. By the end of your first year you will be uniquely equipped to source new business opportunities and help close international defense contracts.

The Europe and Africa Business Team
Based out of Oslo, Norway, Shield AI’s International Team focused on Europe and Africa handles all strategy and business development activity in the these regions. This team works closely with US based Growth, Product, Operations and other internal functions as well as a variety of international partners and entities. It is our responsibility to build Shield AI’s business in these key markets, source opportunities, win deals, and execute international programs.   

The Role   
Think of this role as the Defense Tech equivalent to an Investment Banking/Management Consulting Associate program or Chief of Staff role. You will work side by side with, be trained by/support experienced defense professionals allowing you to quickly climb the steep learning curve of the industry, company, and international business. Through your work owning a wide variety of critical projects you will have direct impact on nearly all facets of the international business and develop a deep understanding of the company and industry. By the end of your first year you will be uniquely equipped to source new business opportunities and help close international defense contracts.

lists.content:
• Operate as a Chief of Staff for International BD Senior Director for the first year, learning the requisite skills to become a producing member of the team.   
  • Be our one point of contact/liaison to all US offices and cross functional teams.   
  • Own special projects across the Europe and Africa international team.   
  • Acquire the tools, skills, knowledge, and internal / external relationships required to develop and close international business opportunities.   
  • Engage with customers regularly to present and discuss Shield AI products (attend trade shows, exhibitions, or other industry events)   
  • Plan and execute product demonstrations, lead proposal responses, manage budget

• Living and working abroad excites you (must expatriate to Norway for 2+ years).   
  • Desire to help build the defining defense technology company of this century   
  • >5 years experience in management consulting, investment banking, public service, defense, or growth/operations at a startup.   
  • Excellent communicator - written, spoken, and interpersonal - with a knack for tone. You will be working across continents and cultures and must be able to succinctly get your point across in a meeting, email, or proposal. Keep in mind you’ll be communicating with colleagues, executives, Generals and more.   
  • Systematically organized - you should be slightly embarrassed of how well you manage your inbox, calendar, and desktop files - but proud of how natural and efficient the process is.   
  • Depth of technical skill in standard tools (90%tile user of Excel, PPT, Outlook, etc.) and a breadth of understanding in modern work tools (Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, SmartSheets, Adobe, Canva, Canto, etc.)   
  • No task is beneath you, no responsibility intimidates you. You will develop a high degree of autonomy and responsibility, but we all roll up our sleeves and never say “that’s not my job”.   
  • Bias towards action. You solve problems before others know they existed.   
  • You are a student of the world and are meticulously aware of current events and cultural sensitivities.

• United States Citizen
  • Demonstrated record of entrepreneurial achievement and/or leadership   
  • Specific strategy or business development experience outside of the Americas   
  • Understanding and knowledge of the military operations and the acquisition process    
  • Technical knowledge within the UAV and/or AI disciplines    
  • Willing and able to travel domestically and internationally, frequently and without restriction, including customer sites     
  • Relevant Foreign Language Skills   
  • MBA or advanced degree in a related field, and 6+ years of leadership and/or operational experience within the DoD or international equivalents (e.g., MoD)   
  • You have built a resilient life/schedule and enjoy working at a place where no one minds if you leave early for an appointment or use all your vacation days, but you are also happy to respond to an email while sitting at home after hours

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Buyer to help manage key suppliers, execute complex buying arrangements, and negotiate better terms and pricing. This Buyer ideally brings a mix of experience in aerospace as well as entrepreneurial drive and rigor to excel in this fast-paced environment.

lists.content:
• Plan, coordinate, execute and manage vendor interactions (including submitted purchase orders and aligning strategic objectives)
  • Support procurements of a wide variety of requirements, ranging from raw material, services, fixed assets, and tooling. Opportunities to support new product introduction, production, repairs and sustainment
  • Negotiate better pricing and terms across high-dollar and volume spend areas
  • Identify, evaluate, and onboard potential new supplier to improve quality, throughput, or pricing
  • Drive strategic initiatives for supply chain as a whole (e.g., compliance)

• Demonstrated knowledge of purchasing and supply chain management of 3+ years (ideally in the aerospace or automotive fields)
  • Analytical and problem-solving expertise
  • Strong organizational skills with an ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment 
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint 
  • Experience with ERP systems (Deltek/Costpoint a plus)
• Experience with FAR and DFARs

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Cloud SRE/DevOps Engineer on the Forge team, you will be responsible for optimizing Forge’s cloud deployments and owning the processes that enable customers to deploy their own Forge instances. You will manage Shield AI’s internal Hivemind instances, working closely with the software operations and engineering teams to ensure Forge can scale for simulation, testing, and bursts of use. You will also enable seamless upgrades, canary deployments, and system robustness. Additionally, you’ll serve as the primary point of contact for the customer engagement team, providing expert guidance on deploying Forge in customer environments.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Cloud SRE/DevOps Engineer on the Forge team, you will be responsible for optimizing Forge’s cloud deployments and owning the processes that enable customers to deploy their own Forge instances. You will manage Shield AI’s internal Hivemind instances, working closely with the software operations and engineering teams to ensure Forge can scale for simulation, testing, and bursts of use. You will also enable seamless upgrades, canary deployments, and system robustness. Additionally, you’ll serve as the primary point of contact for the customer engagement team, providing expert guidance on deploying Forge in customer environments.

lists.content:
• Optimize cloud deployments of Forge to ensure scalability, reliability, and cost efficiency. 
  • Design and document processes for external customers to deploy Forge instances using the SDK in on-premises or hybrid environments. 
  • Manage and maintain internal Hivemind instances, ensuring their ability to handle large-scale simulation and testing workloads. 
  • Collaborate with the software operations team to enhance Forge’s ability to scale dynamically, accommodate bursts of use, and support continuous upgrades with minimal disruption. 
  • Develop tools and processes for canary deployments, ensuring smooth rollouts of new features and updates. 
  • Serve as the primary technical consultant for the customer engagement team, providing expertise on deploying and managing Forge in external environments. 
  • Create and maintain detailed, user-friendly documentation and tutorials for deployment processes, catering to both internal teams and external customers. 
  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to Forge deployments, ensuring high availability and performance.

• Typically requires a minimum of 5 - 15 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree
  • 2 - 10+ years of experience in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering, or cloud infrastructure roles. 
  • Expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, including deploying and managing scalable, distributed systems. 
  • Strong experience with Kubernetes and containerization. 
  • Experience creating Helm charts. 
  • Solid understanding of infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar. 
  • Proficiency in scripting and programming languages such as Python, Golang, or Bash. 
  • Demonstrated experience optimizing CI/CD pipelines, implementing canary deployments, or tools like ArgoCD and FluxCD. 
  • Familiarity with networking concepts and protocols, as well as system monitoring tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana). 
  • Experience deploying and configuring databases such as Postgres.
  • Excellent technical writing skills, with a proven ability to create clear, comprehensive documentation and tutorials. 
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience. 
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate effectively with engineering, operations, and customer-facing teams.

• Experience with secure software deployments in regulated industries such as aerospace, defense, or finance. 
  • Systems software development experience using programming languages like C++, Rust or Golang. 
  • Experience building software development kits or productized tools for deploying cloud systems. 
  • Knowledge of hybrid and on-premises deployment strategies and challenges. 
  • Hands-on experience with database performance optimization and scaling strategies. 
  • Familiarity with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet. 
  • Experience building robust monitoring and alerting systems for mission-critical applications. 
  • Background in managing high-throughput simulation or testing environments. 
  • Experience optimizing databases

descriptionPlain:
Shield AI is a venture-backed defence technology company building intelligent autonomous systems for aircraft. Our mission is to protect service members and civilians through AI and autonomy.

For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


We’re looking for a Computer Vision Engineer (C++) to join our team in Port Melbourne, contributing to the development of innovative, real-time perception solutions for next-gen autonomous platforms. Whether you're a recent PhD graduate or a seasoned commercial developer, this is an opportunity to help solve real-world defence challenges using cutting-edge vision and AI technology.

You’ll be part of a team developing custom algorithms - not just applying libraries - and will work alongside expert AI and deep learning engineers to integrate CV into real-time pipelines across a range of unmanned systems.
description:
Shield AI is a venture-backed defence technology company building intelligent autonomous systems for aircraft. Our mission is to protect service members and civilians through AI and autonomy.

For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

We’re looking for a Computer Vision Engineer (C++) to join our team in Port Melbourne, contributing to the development of innovative, real-time perception solutions for next-gen autonomous platforms. Whether you're a recent PhD graduate or a seasoned commercial developer, this is an opportunity to help solve real-world defence challenges using cutting-edge vision and AI technology.

You’ll be part of a team developing custom algorithms - not just applying libraries - and will work alongside expert AI and deep learning engineers to integrate CV into real-time pipelines across a range of unmanned systems.

lists.content:
• Design and implement novel computer vision algorithms from scratch, optimised for real-time performance.
  • Develop and maintain C++-based CV pipelines as part of autonomous mission systems.
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of AI, robotics, and optical engineers to deliver reliable edge solutions.
  • Support the integration of deep learning models into broader CV systems, working closely with AI experts.
  • Stay across current academic research and emerging techniques in computer vision and ML.

• Deep proficiency in C++ and comfortable working in high-performance real-time environments.
  • Strong experience writing custom computer vision algorithms, beyond just library use.
  • Solid understanding of computer vision, image processing, and machine learning principles.

• Experience in any of the following:
  • Object detection, target tracking, or 3D reconstruction.
  • SLAM, camera calibration, or behaviour analysis.
  • Automated video surveillance or other related real-time vision systems.
  • Familiarity with OpenCV and similar vision toolkits.
  • Exposure to deep learning for image classification, recognition, or sequence modelling.
  • Interest in combining deep learning and CV pipelines in real-time deployment scenarios.
  • Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

• Build mission-critical vision and autonomy systems that make a real-world impact.
  • Collaborate with some of the best minds in AI, autonomy, and defence technology.
  • Hybrid role based in our Port Melbourne office.
  • Salary + equity for permanent roles, with a strong career development pathway.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description:
Shield AI is seeking an Aircraft Configuration Design Engineer to support the development of next-generation autonomous UAVs. In this role, you will assist in the design, optimization, and integration of aircraft configurations, ensuring that vehicle aerodynamics, structures, propulsion, and mission systems are harmonized for performance, manufacturability, and operational effectiveness.

This position is ideal for a mechanical or aerospace engineer with a passion for cutting-edge aircraft design, multi-disciplinary systems integration, and iterative prototyping in a fast-paced defense technology environment.

Job Description:
Shield AI is seeking an Aircraft Configuration Design Engineer to support the development of next-generation autonomous UAVs. In this role, you will assist in the design, optimization, and integration of aircraft configurations, ensuring that vehicle aerodynamics, structures, propulsion, and mission systems are harmonized for performance, manufacturability, and operational effectiveness.

This position is ideal for a mechanical or aerospace engineer with a passion for cutting-edge aircraft design, multi-disciplinary systems integration, and iterative prototyping in a fast-paced defense technology environment.

lists.content:
• Assist in the conceptual and preliminary design of Shield AI’s UAV platforms, ensuring optimal aerodynamic and structural configurations.
  • Support aircraft sizing, weight estimation, and trade studies to evaluate different airframe configurations.
  • Work with multi-disciplinary engineering teams (mechanical, electrical, propulsion, avionics) to ensure seamless system integration.
  • Develop and refine 3D CAD models of aircraft structures, subsystems, and flight-critical components.
  • Perform basic aerodynamic and structural analysis using computational tools to assess feasibility and performance impacts.
  • Participate in design reviews, system trade studies, and prototype development efforts.
  • Support rapid prototyping and wind tunnel testing of scaled models to validate design concepts.
  • Assist in requirements development, documentation, and verification planning for aircraft subsystems.
  • Ensure designs comply with manufacturing feasibility, mission requirements, and aerospace industry standards.
  • Work closely with manufacturing and production teams to transition designs from concept to prototype and full-scale production.

• Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering (or related field).
  • 1-5 years of experience in aircraft design, configuration layout, or airframe integration.
  • Proficiency in CAD modeling (NX, SolidWorks, or similar) for airframe and structural design.
  • Basic understanding of aircraft aerodynamics, structures, and propulsion system integration.
  • Ability to perform basic FEA, CFD, or weight & balance assessments.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in cross-functional teams.
  • Excellent communication and technical documentation skills.

• Experience with unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) design or aircraft conceptual design.
  • Familiarity with aircraft performance modeling, stability & control, and flight dynamics.
  • Hands-on experience with rapid prototyping, wind tunnel testing, or flight hardware development.
  • Knowledge of manufacturing techniques, composite materials, and aerospace structural design principles.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-tech startup or defense environment.

description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Staff Contracts Administrator to manage complex commercial and international software licensing and engineering services agreements. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of commercial contracting best practices, global contracting standards, intellectual property rights, and software licensing models. This role is critical to ensuring the success of the contracting function by supporting complex transactions across a global client base and driving strategic business objectives.

lists.content:
• Collaborate with the business development team to drive customer growth by executing purchase agreements for software license sales. 
  • Draft and review key documents, including Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Intent, Teaming Agreements, Third-Party Intermediary Agreements, and Statements of Work. 
  • Lead or support critical negotiations.
  • Partner with internal teams to ensure transactions align with Shield AI's strategic objectives and growth goals.

• Analyze and negotiate key contractual terms.
  • Administer and monitor contract performance, managing modifications, renewals, amendments, and terminations as necessary. 
  • Negotiate and administer Reseller and Broker agreements to facilitate internationals sales of goods and services in specific territories. 
  • Support proposal development and pricing strategies to meet international and commercial requirements. 
  • Monitor global trends in software contracting and advise on best practices and emerging regulatory requirements. 
  • Analyze contract terms and conditions to identify risks and recommend mitigating strategies. 
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for contractual matters with clients, subcontractors, and internal stakeholders. 
  • Collaborate with legal, finance, and project teams to address contractual issues and resolve disputes. 
  • Maintain organized records of all contract-related documentation.

• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field. 
  • 5+ years of experience in contracts administration, with specific experience in international contracts and U.S. Government Contracting.
  • Familiarity with international trade regulations including export controls. 
  • Experience negotiating terms and conditions and managing complex agreements. 
  • Exceptional organizational skills, communication and attention to detail. 
  • Ability to work independently as well as support multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced environment.  
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).

• Masters Degree in Business Administration or a related field 
  • Certification in Contracts Management (e.g., CPCM, CFCM, or similar) 
  • Experience working with global clients, including familiarity with INCOTERMS and multinational contracting standards. 
  • Knowledge of risk management strategies specific to international agreements.
  • Experience managing contracts in multiple currencies and jurisdictions.

Job Description:
The Deployed Operations Manager is the responsible party for managing, mentoring, and supervising Level 300 Site Leads, who in turn lead the crews that perform our Contractor Owned Contractor Operated (COCO) and extended duration international operations. They are Shield AI’s primary touchpoint for COCO crew information and, though the Senior Manager is the responsible party for COCO manning, the Manager works closely with the FSR Management team to provide personnel courses of action to the Senior Manager. They are responsible for mentoring, developing, and training COCO Site Leads and crews as needed to ensure mission readiness. They also provide technical support for deployed teams as needed.

Job Description:
The Deployed Operations Manager is the responsible party for managing, mentoring, and supervising Level 300 Site Leads, who in turn lead the crews that perform our Contractor Owned Contractor Operated (COCO) and extended duration international operations. They are Shield AI’s primary touchpoint for COCO crew information and, though the Senior Manager is the responsible party for COCO manning, the Manager works closely with the FSR Management team to provide personnel courses of action to the Senior Manager. They are responsible for mentoring, developing, and training COCO Site Leads and crews as needed to ensure mission readiness. They also provide technical support for deployed teams as needed.

lists.content:
• Outcomes: Ensure Site Leads achieve mission impacts, fulfill contractual obligations, and delight customers.
  • Leadership and Supervision: Manage, mentor, and supervise Site Leads who lead crews on COCO and extended duration international operations.
  • Primary Touchpoint: Serve as Shield AI’s primary contact for COCO crew information, collaborating closely with the FSR Management team and Senior Manager.
  • Resource Coordination: Work with the FSR Supervisors on COCO staffing, providing Sr. Manager Deployed Operations courses of action and ensuring optimal crew employment.
  • Training and Development: Mentor, develop, and train Site Leads and crews to ensure mission readiness and operational excellence.
  • Technical Support: Provide technical support to deployed teams as needed, ensuring smooth and efficient operations.

• Demonstrated experience in managing and mentoring operational teams.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and develop team members.
  • Exceptional organizational and communication skills.
  • Experience in international operations and a deep understanding of Contractor Owned Contractor Operated Unmanned Aviation System operations.
  • Technical proficiency to provide necessary support to deployed teams.

• Previously served in a Site Lead capacity on a deployment or extended duration OCONUS operation
  • V-BAT AVO certified
  • V-BAT AVO instructor certified or ability to obtain

Job Description:
As an Airworthiness Engineering Director, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the safety, reliability, and regulatory approval of our autonomous aircraft systems. You will be responsible for defining and executing airworthiness strategies in both civil and military regulatory environments, many of which are ill-defined or evolving. You will engage with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, regulators, and industry partners, to drive regulatory alignment, mitigate risks, and ensure successful operational deployment of Shield AI’s products. 

This role requires a proven leader who thrives in ambiguity, proactively builds consensus, and has a deep understanding of airworthiness, autonomy, and safety in emerging regulatory frameworks. 

Why Shield AI? 
Work on cutting-edge AI-powered systems that redefine how aircraft operate. 
Be at the forefront of navigating UAS regulatory challenges, shaping industry best practices. 
Collaborate with industry leaders, regulators, and top engineering talent to drive real-world impact. 
Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for professional growth. 
If you’re an airworthiness expert who thrives in ambiguity and wants to help shape the future of aviation, we’d love to hear from you!
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:
As an Airworthiness Engineering Director, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the safety, reliability, and regulatory approval of our autonomous aircraft systems. You will be responsible for defining and executing airworthiness strategies in both civil and military regulatory environments, many of which are ill-defined or evolving. You will engage with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, regulators, and industry partners, to drive regulatory alignment, mitigate risks, and ensure successful operational deployment of Shield AI’s products. 

This role requires a proven leader who thrives in ambiguity, proactively builds consensus, and has a deep understanding of airworthiness, autonomy, and safety in emerging regulatory frameworks. 

Why Shield AI? 
Work on cutting-edge AI-powered systems that redefine how aircraft operate. 
Be at the forefront of navigating UAS regulatory challenges, shaping industry best practices. 
Collaborate with industry leaders, regulators, and top engineering talent to drive real-world impact. 
Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for professional growth. 
If you’re an airworthiness expert who thrives in ambiguity and wants to help shape the future of aviation, we’d love to hear from you!

lists.content:
• Develop and execute airworthiness strategies for Group 3-5 UAS in compliance with civil and military regulations. 
  • Engage with regulators and customers to navigate evolving airworthiness requirements for UAS, autonomy, and safety where clear regulations may not yet exist. 
  • Lead airworthiness execution across the product lifecycle, ensuring alignment with operational, technical, and regulatory requirements. 
  • Define safety and airworthiness requirements for Shield AI’s products and contribute to internal policies and procedures. 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate airworthiness and safety considerations into system design, testing, and deployment. 
  • Drive regulatory approvals and certification efforts, building relationships with key stakeholders to influence emerging standards. 
  • Stay informed of evolving domestic and international airworthiness policies affecting UAS and autonomy.

• Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field (or equivalent practical experience). 
  • 10+ years of experience in airworthiness, safety, or regulatory compliance for aerospace systems, with direct experience in UAS or autonomy. 
  • Proven ability to operate in ambiguous regulatory environments, proactively driving solutions and stakeholder alignment. 
  • Strong knowledge of domestic and international airworthiness standards (e.g., FAA, EASA, MIL-HDBK-516, STANAGs). 
  • Experience engaging with civil and military regulators on complex topics such as autonomy, UAS integration, and operational approvals. 
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence internal teams and external stakeholders. 
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, evolving environment. 
  • Ability to obtain a security clearance.

• Experience with artificial intelligence. 
  • Familiarity with aerospace system safety standards, risk management, and certification processes. 
  • Previous experience in a high-growth, fast-paced company. 
  • Current security clearance.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include the V-BAT Uncrewed Aircraft System (UAS), Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software) and Hivemind.  

The Hivemind business utilizes an exportable AI-powered toolset to accelerate advanced mission autonomy development. This toolset has developed and deployed mission autonomy across a number of aerial platforms including collaborative multi-agent autonomous flights on unmanned aerial target drones, within and beyond visual range air combat on modified F-16s (X-62 VISTA), and representative CCA surrogates (General Atomics MQ-20) 

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn,X and Instagram."


Based out of Abu Dhabi, Shield AI’s International Team handles all strategy and business development activity in the Middle East, Asia, and Oceania. The International Team works closely with U.S. based Growth, Product, Operations and other internal functions as well as a variety of international partners and entities. It is our responsibility to build Shield AI’s business around the globe, source opportunities, win deals, and execute international programs. 
 
For this role, you will be located inCanberra, Australia. You will be responsible for both creating and executing the strategy to close deals in order to meet specific annual orders (sales) quotas primarily focused on the Hivemind business. These deals must be set up for successful, programmatic execution in order to achieve overall revenue targets for the company in the following year(s). You will also be accountable to support your team members in achieving the overall annual targets of the Senior Director responsible for the region.  
 
As a key leader on our Business Development team, you will play a pivotal role in positioning Shield AI as the leading provider of AI-driven autonomy solutions for commercial, national security, and defense applications. This is an opportunity to shape a new market, collaborate with technical experts, and deliver state-of-the-art AI solutions that make a real-world impact.

lists.content:
• Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for Hivemind Enterprise, focusing on enterprise-level SaaS sales and establishing Shield AI as an industry leader. 
  • Drive revenue growth through new customer acquisition, expansion of existing accounts, and strategic partnerships. 
  • Lead high-impact sales pursuits by differentiating Shield AI’s offerings and navigating complex procurement environments. 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product management, engineering, and operations to ensure successful delivery of tailored AI solutions. 
  • Provide market insights and customer feedback to shape product development and refine value propositions. 
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to executive stakeholders, articulating the transformative impact of AI-driven autonomy. 
  • Devise and coordinate marketing and government relations opportunities 
  • Build and devise the structure of industry partnerships 
  • Plan and execute product demonstrations/immersions 
  • Lead proposal response 
  • Work closely with the Sentient Vision Systems (SVS) and Hivemind teams based out of Melbourne Australia

• Desire to help build the defining defense technology company of this century 
  • 15+ years of progressive experience in related fields. 
  • International strategy and business development 
  • Defense, aerospace, or autonomy sectors, including knowledge of AI, mission autonomy, and/or Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS). 
  • Exceptional skills in strategic thinking, negotiation, and problem-solving, proven through a track record of independently demolishing obstacles and exceeding critical objectives,.  
  • Team oriented with the ability to communicate with an understanding of nuances associated with being collaborative while also being blunt and forthright    
  • Charismatic leader, with the ability to motivate and inspire others and impart excitement about Shield AI’s mission, technology, and products 
  • Exceptional communicator: strong written, verbal, and presentation skills and the ability to communicate seamlessly at all levels of business and government 
  • Strong ability to engage and influence senior executives and stakeholders across commercial and government sectors. 
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, evolving environment. 
  • Willingness to travel at least 25% of the time. 
  • Already living in or willing to expat to Canberra, Australia for 3+ years 
  • Thorough understanding and knowledge of Australian Defense Force military operations and the acquisition process that allows you to maintain strong customer relations

• Australian Security Clearance 
  • Bachelors degree, and/or MBA / related Master’s degree in a related field 
  • Prior operational senior leadership role with the Australian Defence Force 
  •  Royal Australian Air Force and Royal Australian Navy preferred 
  • Prior operational experience with UAVs and/or systems with advanced mission autonomy 
  • Track record of leading cross-functional teams to achieve business objectives. 
  • Proficiency in sales methodologies like MEDDIC, Challenger Sales, or Solution Selling. 
  • Experience with CRM platforms such as Salesforce or HubSpot.

The International Director of Government Relations for Europe will lead Shield AI's government relations strategy across European markets, building and maintaining relationships with key government stakeholders, defense ministries, and regulatory bodies. This role is critical in expanding Shield AI's European footprint and navigating complex regulatory landscapes. This role will report to the Head of Government Relations.

lists.content:
• Develop and execute Shield AI's government relations strategy across European markets
  • Establish and maintain relationships with European defense ministries, procurement officials, regulatory bodies, and key decision-makers
  • Monitor and analyze European defense policy developments, regulatory changes, and geopolitical trends affecting autonomous systems and AI in defense
  • Represent Shield AI at high-level European defense forums, industry events, and government meetings
  • Collaborate with business development teams to identify opportunities and secure contracts with European defense entities
  • Advise senior leadership on European market entry strategies and regulatory compliance
  • Lead cross-functional teams to navigate complex procurement processes in various European countries
  • Coordinate with legal and compliance teams to ensure adherence to export controls and international regulations
  • Build coalitions with industry partners and advocacy groups to shape favorable policy environments
  • Ensure alignment of European messaging and policies with Shield AI strategic objectives

• 10+ years of experience in government relations, preferably in defense technology or aerospace sectors
  • Extensive knowledge of European defense procurement processes and regulatory frameworks
  • Established relationships with European defense ministries and government officials
  • Experience navigating NATO-related defense initiatives and multinational defense programs
  • Deep understanding of AI and autonomous systems regulatory landscape in Europe
  • Exceptional diplomatic and negotiation skills with ability to engage effectively at senior government levels
  • Degree in International Relations, Public Policy, Political Science, or related field, advanced degrees are preferred
  • Fluency in English and proficiency in at least one other major European language
  • Prior experience managing external consultants is preferred
  • Willingness to travel extensively throughout Europe (40-50%)
  • Security clearance or ability to obtain appropriate clearances

Are you ready to lead end-to-end production operations in a complex, high-standards environment. The Director of Production will oversee manufacturing processes, supply chain coordination, quality assurance, and related cross-functional teams. The individual should have a strong background in advanced manufacturing environments—such as aerospace or automotive—and be adept at managing outsourced elements of production. The role demands strong communication skills to interface with executive leadership and the ability to build and develop a high-performing team. 

*This position requires 50% travel to India, all applicants must be amenable to this requirement.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Are you ready to lead end-to-end production operations in a complex, high-standards environment. The Director of Production will oversee manufacturing processes, supply chain coordination, quality assurance, and related cross-functional teams. The individual should have a strong background in advanced manufacturing environments—such as aerospace or automotive—and be adept at managing outsourced elements of production. The role demands strong communication skills to interface with executive leadership and the ability to build and develop a high-performing team. 

*This position requires 50% travel to India, all applicants must be amenable to this requirement.

lists.content:
• Production Strategy & Planning: 
  • Develop and execute comprehensive production plans aligned with organizational objectives, including capacity planning, resource allocation, and cost management. 
  • Ensure production meets on-time delivery, quality, and cost targets. 

  • Cross-Functional Leadership: 
  • Lead and manage cross-functional teams spanning manufacturing, supply chain, quality, and engineering. 
  • Collaborate closely with vendors, procurement, logistics, and R&D to ensure seamless integration of production processes. 

  • Quality & Compliance: 
  • Enforce quality standards and continuous improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma) to drive product reliability and compliance with industry regulations. 
  • Implement and refine quality management systems to meet certifications and regulatory requirements common in aerospace or automotive sectors. 

  • Supply Chain Integration & Outsourcing Management: 
  • Oversee vendor relationships and outsourced production activities, ensuring supplier performance aligns with internal standards. 
  • Negotiate supplier contracts and manage inventory, lead times, and cost structure to optimize supply chain efficiency and resilience. 

  • Team Building & Management: 
  • Recruit, mentor, and develop a high-caliber production team, including managers and frontline staff. 
  • Define roles, responsibilities, and KPIs for team members to ensure accountability and transparency in performance expectations. 

  • Process Improvement & Advanced Manufacturing Techniques: 
  • Identify and implement advanced manufacturing technologies, automation solutions, and process optimizations to improve throughput, quality, and cost-effectiveness. 
  • Utilize data-driven decision-making to refine production workflows and enhance operational excellence. 

  • Executive Communication & Reporting: 
  • Present production metrics, progress updates, and strategic recommendations to executive leadership. 
  • Communicate complex operational information clearly and concisely to influence decision-making at the senior level.

• Bachelor’s degree in engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, or related field; Master’s degree preferred. 
  • 10+ years of experience in production management, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role. 
  • Proven track record in advanced manufacturing environments (e.g., aerospace, automotive), including familiarity with regulatory and compliance requirements. 
  • Demonstrated success in managing a cross-functional team and outsourced production components. 
  • Strong background in Lean, Six Sigma, or similar continuous improvement methodologies. 
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to report clearly and credibly to executives. 
  • Strategic mindset paired with hands-on operational experience and strong analytical capabilities. 
  • This role card encapsulates common industry expectations, enabling organizations to refine as needed based on their specific context and strategic priorities. 
  • Ability to travel 50% of time to India.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Shield AI is seeking an Accounting Director to join our Finance team. As Shield AI expands globally, this role offers a rare opportunity to shape the accounting function at a high-growth, mission-driven tech company. Reporting to the Controller, this role will oversee the global accounting close process, intercompany operations, and process improvement initiatives while building scalable infrastructure to support audit readiness and public company standards.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). Shield AI is seeking an Accounting Director to join our Finance team. As Shield AI expands globally, this role offers a rare opportunity to shape the accounting function at a high-growth, mission-driven tech company. Reporting to the Controller, this role will oversee the global accounting close process, intercompany operations, and process improvement initiatives while building scalable infrastructure to support audit readiness and public company standards.

lists.content:
• Lead the consolidation process for all subsidiaries, including intercompany eliminations and foreign currency translations.
  • Oversee and execute day-to-day accounting operations, including general ledger accounting, payroll, accounts receivable, and accounts payable.
  • Collaborate with the extended finance team to ensure a timely close and reporting process and support the execution of team objectives.
  • Assist with the implementation and maintenance of internal controls, ensuring compliance with future SOX requirements.
  • Support the implementation and continuous improvement of accounting systems and processes.
  • Lead change management initiatives across teams through documented governance practices.
  • Promote quality within the organization through ongoing inspection, verification, and reconciliation.
  • Stay current on industry best practices and emerging trends.
  • Perform other tasks as assigned to support the company’s strategic objectives.

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (preferred) or in Finance or a related field.
  • Expert-level understanding of U.S. GAAP and experience maintaining a strong internal control environment, including SOX compliance.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities independently in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
  • Highly driven and self-motivated, with demonstrated leadership, presentation, and communication skills.
  • Proven experience coordinating with external stakeholders.
  • Ability to manage projects from inception to completion while incorporating feedback from multiple sources.
  • Skilled at multi-tasking, prioritizing competing demands, and managing assignments within deadlines.
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite required.

• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
  • Active CPA license.
  • Experience in a software, defense technology, or aerospace company.
  • Strong knowledge of project-based accounting.
  • Excellent leadership, people management, communication, and influencing skills.
  • Proven ability to analyze complex problems, interpret operational needs, and implement effective solutions.
  • Demonstrated decisiveness in resolving business issues, making informed decisions, and setting clear priorities.

lists.content:
• Own the avionics system. Define and execute the vision of our next generation aircraft from concept through production 
  • Build, lead, and mentor a world-class avionics engineering team 
  • Establish and enforce appropriate design processes 
  • Maintain technical excellence—implement rigorous design processes and ensure compliance with industry standards. 
  • Ensure system performance meets requirements and design expectations 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Shield’s core teams, such as engineering, production, supply chain, business development, and program management 
  • Engage with external partners – coordinate with vendors and engineering teams as needed 
  • Work in a fast-paced environment

• 10+ years of aerospace engineering experience, ideally with a strong background in avionics system design and integration 
  • 4+ years of leadership experience 
  • Strong technical fundamentals 
  • Knowledge of industry standards, including DO and MIL-STD avionics design and certification processes 
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Job Description:

At Shield AI, we are revolutionizing defense technology to protect service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Our Hardware Test Engineering team plays a critical role in ensuring the V-BAT remains the most reliable, mission-ready UAV in the industry. We design cutting-edge test solutions—custom-built electrical and mechanical systems that push our hardware to its limits in real-world and extreme environments.

As an Electrical Engineer on our Hardware Test team, you’ll have the opportunity to design and automate test systems that validate everything from power electronics to RF communications. You'll work hands-on with PCB design, Python scripting, and advanced environmental testing (HASS, ESS, HALT) to ensure the highest standards of reliability. If you're passionate about building rock-solid hardware and thrive in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment, this role is for you.

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:

At Shield AI, we are revolutionizing defense technology to protect service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Our Hardware Test Engineering team plays a critical role in ensuring the V-BAT remains the most reliable, mission-ready UAV in the industry. We design cutting-edge test solutions—custom-built electrical and mechanical systems that push our hardware to its limits in real-world and extreme environments.

As an Electrical Engineer on our Hardware Test team, you’ll have the opportunity to design and automate test systems that validate everything from power electronics to RF communications. You'll work hands-on with PCB design, Python scripting, and advanced environmental testing (HASS, ESS, HALT) to ensure the highest standards of reliability. If you're passionate about building rock-solid hardware and thrive in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment, this role is for you.

lists.content:
• Design and own test systems for critical UAV components and subsystems, from concept to validation.
  • Work across multiple EE disciplines, including power electronics, RF, communications, and system integration.
  • Develop PCBs to interface between test stands and the device-under-test (DUT).
  • Build custom test fixtures integrating relays, PLCs, PCBAs, and harnessing for automated and high-fidelity testing.
  • Automate test sequences using Python, ensuring repeatability, efficiency, and scalability.
  • Collaborate in cross-functional design reviews, advocating for testability improvements that streamline hardware validation.
  • Adapt and innovate in a fast-moving, high-stakes environment, where your work directly impacts mission success.
  • Other duties as assigned.

• B.S. in Electrical Engineering or equivalent hands-on experience OR you are an undergraduate, graduate or PhD student expected to graduate in 2025.
  • Strong foundation in electrical, mechanical, and software engineering principles.
  • Experience in multidisciplinary hardware projects—whether through internships, jobs, clubs, personal projects, or research.
  • A track record of ownership, innovation, and delivering results in complex technical environments.
  • A team-first mindset, holding yourself and others to high standards, while being adaptable and solution-oriented.
  • A track record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Proficiency in Python or other scripting languages for automation.
  • Experience with PCB design tools (Altium, KiCAD, Eagle, etc.).
  • Familiarity with CAD tools (SolidWorks, NX, CATIA) for mechanical fixture design.
  • Ability to problem-solve under pressure and pivot quickly in a dynamic, fast-paced engineering environment.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
Shield AI’s mission is to protect the lives of service members and civilians with intelligent systems. The Hardware Test Engineering team contributes to this effort by designing test solutions that drive high hardware reliability on all our vehicles: both V-BAT and our next-generation aircraft. These solutions are in-house designed electrical and mechanical equipment used to perform component and system-level testing, both at ambient and in simulated harsh environmental conditions. 

As manager of the electrical engineering team, you will be responsible for the success of multiple engineers that report to you, in addition to your own engineering and design tasks. You will perform individual contributor work in addition to holding 1:1 meetings, writing reviews, and providing career guidance to your team. While leadership is an important part of this role, you are still expected to spend approximately 50% of your time as an individual contributor in your respective field. Your contributions will directly impact the success of Shield AI in addition to influencing the future of the Aircraft Engineering organization. Help us save lives as we strive to deliver the most highly reliable aerospace hardware in the industry.

Shield AI’s mission is to protect the lives of service members and civilians with intelligent systems. The Hardware Test Engineering team contributes to this effort by designing test solutions that drive high hardware reliability on all our vehicles: both V-BAT and our next-generation aircraft. These solutions are in-house designed electrical and mechanical equipment used to perform component and system-level testing, both at ambient and in simulated harsh environmental conditions.

As manager of the electrical engineering team, you will be responsible for the success of multiple engineers that report to you, in addition to your own engineering and design tasks.
