Your contributions will directly impact the success of Shield AI in addition to influencing the future of the Aircraft Engineering organization. Help us save lives as we strive to deliver the most highly reliable aerospace hardware in the industry.

lists.content:
• Lead a team of between 2 and 6 engineers in designing, deploying, and maintaining test stands that support production and qualification of our aircraft.
  • Perform regular 1:1s, provide career guidance, and document performance for all the individuals on your team.
  • Contribute to the entire employee lifecycle, from candidate identification and interviewing to career growth, promotion, or separation.
  • Develop documentation and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for how things are done on the Hardware Test Engineering Team.
  • Own requirements gathering, design, and validation of multiple test stands used to test components and subsystems on all our vehicles.  
  • Gain expertise in multiple disciplines within EE as you design test systems for power electronics, communications, RF, and more. 
  • Design simple to moderately complex PCBs that interface between the test stand and the device-under-test (DUT).  
  • Design test stands and test fixtures, which may include relays, PLCs, PCBAs, harnessing, and various other pieces of electrical and mechanical equipment. 
  • Contribute to and attend cross-functional design reviews. Advocate for design changes that result in simpler testing processes. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• B.S. in Electrical Engineering or related STEM field.  
  • Experience with PCB schematic and layout tools, including Altium, KiCAD, Eagle, etc… 
  • Mastery of fundamental engineering concepts, including EE, Mech E, Programming, Physics, and Mathematics.  
  • Experience working on multidisciplinary hardware development projects, which can be from an internship, job, club, team, personal project, etc… 
  • Demonstrated history of showing ownership of project outcomes and delivering exceptional results.  
  • Record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience with Python or any scripting language. 
  • Experience with CAD tools such as SolidWorks, NX, CATIA, etc… 
  • Demonstrated adaptability, agility, and the ability to innovate under pressure to meet dynamic project demands and drive successful outcomes.

descriptionBody:
Job Description:
Shield AI’s mission is to protect the lives of service members and civilians with intelligent systems. The Hardware Test Engineering team contributes to this effort by designing test solutions that drive high hardware reliability on all our vehicles: both V-BAT and our next-generation aircraft. These solutions are in-house designed electrical and mechanical equipment used to perform component and system-level testing, both at ambient and in simulated harsh environmental conditions.

As manager of the electrical engineering team, you will be responsible for the success of multiple engineers that report to you, in addition to your own engineering and design tasks. You will perform individual contributor work in addition to holding 1:1 meetings, writing reviews, and providing career guidance to your team. While leadership is an important part of this role, you are still expected to spend approximately 50% of your time as an individual contributor in your respective field. Your contributions will directly impact the success of Shield AI in addition to influencing the future of the Aircraft Engineering organization. Help us save lives as we strive to deliver the most highly reliable aerospace hardware in the industry.

We’re looking for an Embedded Software Engineer to join our team in Port Melbourne and help develop high-performance optical processing solutions on NVIDIA Jetson platforms. Sitting at the crossroads of embedded systems, computer vision, and optical engineering, this role is perfect for someone excited to push the limits of edge-based AI systems.

You’ll work with industry experts across AI, imaging, and hardware, building low-latency software pipelines to manage complex data from advanced optical sensors in mission-critical environments.
description:
Shield AI is a venture-backed defence technology company building intelligent autonomous systems for aircraft. Our mission is to protect service members and civilians through AI and autonomy.

For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

We’re looking for an Embedded Software Engineer to join our team in Port Melbourne and help develop high-performance optical processing solutions on NVIDIA Jetson platforms. Sitting at the crossroads of embedded systems, computer vision, and optical engineering, this role is perfect for someone excited to push the limits of edge-based AI systems.

You’ll work with industry experts across AI, imaging, and hardware, building low-latency software pipelines to manage complex data from advanced optical sensors in mission-critical environments.

lists.content:
• Design and develop embedded software for optical systems using NVIDIA Jetson platforms.
  • Build mission system applications and calibration/maintenance tools.
  • Integrate RGB, NIR, thermal, and hyperspectral sensors via MIPI CSI, ethernet, or GMSL.
  • Interface with image signal processors (ISPs) and configure image tuning pipelines.
  • Collaborate with hardware engineers to ensure synchronisation, timing, and signal integrity.
  • Build and optimise calibration tools and synchronisation software.
  • Profile and tune performance for frame rate, latency, and thermal efficiency in low-SWaP environments.
  • Engage with key industry partners on integration and deployment.

• Significant experience in embedded software development, particularly in imaging or optical systems.
  • Proficiency in C++, with strong embedded development experience.
  • Familiar with Linux, including NVIDIA-specific platforms (JetPack, L4T, etc.).
  • Hands-on experience with camera sensor integration and optical tuning.
  • Solid understanding of camera pipelines, calibration, and synchronisation.
  • Knowledge of IoT and how embedded systems integrate into broader networks.

• Experience in real-time image processing for aerospace, robotics, or defence applications.
  • Familiarity with synchronising high-frame-rate or multi-camera systems.
  • Understanding of lens calibration and optical modelling.
  • Exposure to AI/ML inference on optical data (e.g., real-time classification or detection).
  • Experience with RTOS or time-critical Linux environments.
  • Familiarity with GMSL, sensor fusion, and high-speed acquisition pipelines.
  • Experience with video tools such as FFmpeg and GStreamer.

As a simulation engineer, you will be responsible creating and maintaining all of the truth models in the simulation as well as verifying the models against actual live flight data.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a simulation engineer, you will be responsible creating and maintaining all of the truth models in the simulation as well as verifying the models against actual live flight data.

lists.content:
• Port residual Simulink models for aircraft dynamics, engine models, aerodynamic models, etc. to C++
  • Add unit tests for any newly written C++ code / models
  • Manage the lifecycle of the models (improvements, etc.)
  • Validate the models against live flight data
  • Improve documentation for all models
  • Integrate C++ models into existing build, software-in-the-loop simulator and processor-in-the-loop simulator – removing dependencies on Matlab and S-Function
  • Help improve and validate all GUI interfaces with the simulation
  • Scale simulation into CI pipelines
  • Help scale our simulations by implementing Docker containers

• Typically requires a minimum of 1-2 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience developing and delivering a simulation framework for internal or external customers
  • Solid fundamentals in math and physics
  • Experience with C++ 11 or newer in a production environment
  • Experience with Linux, git, command line tools, etc.
  • Experience with Matlab and Simulink
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and external stakeholders.
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and/or containerized application development
  • Experience with physics-based implementations of forces and moments using numerical methods, differential equations, etc.
  • Familiarity with rigid body dynamics (e.g. Euler’s equations, quaternions), aerodynamics, propulsion systems, etc.

As a leader in the Hivemind Autonomy organization, you will contribute to an ambitious mission to design, develop, integrate, test, and deploy the world’s best AI Pilot—capable of executing any mission on any platform. Your expertise in core Perception technologies, such as sensors, sensor calibration, characterization, filtering and fusion for environment representation and estimation will be instrumental in driving this mission forward.

lists.text: As a people manager, you will lead a high-performing team of multi-skilled autonomy developers, where you’ll:
lists.content:
• Collaborate closely with the product team to clarify and prioritize product requirements.
  • Provide clear guidance on scope of work and set achievable goals for the development team.
  • Optimize capacity allocation based on business needs to maximize team efficiency and impact.
  • Establish a commitment-driven environment where the team can reliably deliver features that exceed customer expectations for the Hivemind product.
  • In your role, you’ll also play a critical part in building organizational talent by partnering with talent acquisition throughout the hiring process (recruiting, resume screening, interviews, onboarding) and nurturing a culture of excellence by setting clear job expectations, engaging in performance reviews, and fostering continuous feedback. With a servant leadership mindset, you’ll support team members’ growth in skill development, career advancement, promotion planning, and employee recognition.

lists.text: As a technical leader, you will:
lists.content:
• Generate feasible and inspiring roadmaps in collaboration with your team and broader org
  • Set team direction to maximize value-delivery to the org and the product
  • Resolve technical hurdles by serving as the informed and experienced voice in the room

• Manage a team of 5 to 7 autonomy developers, splitting your time equally between leadership and hands-on development.
  • Develop production-quality autonomy software in C++ for deployment on military platforms, ensuring code robustness, efficiency, and scalability.
  • Provide technical leadership in the design and architecture of key perception framework components.
  • Drive product roadmap execution by leading feature decomposition, capacity planning, and agile development processes.
  • Balance rigor and speed in a fast-paced, collaborative, and continuous development environment.

• Minimum of 7 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 6 years and a master’s degree; or 4 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Proven experience as a people manager overseeing a team of C++ developers.
  • High proficiency in modern C++ and design patterns with a strong record in a core perception discipline (e.g., sensor characterization, sensor modeling, calibration, fusion, Image processing, Visual detection, tracking, SLAM) or another autonomy field.
  • Experience across the full lifecycle of perception software development, testing, and deployment to edge computing environments.
  • Familiarity with CI pipelines and automated testing frameworks for C++.
  • Strong proficiency with Linux operating systems.

• Previous experience delivering autonomy software (C++) to DoD customers.
  • Familiarity with navigational sensors (IMU, GPS, barometers, magnetometers).
  • Experience with GPS-denied navigation technologies.
  • Understanding of EO/IR sensors and RF sensors.

This role will serve as a trusted advisor, providing expert guidance and support to site management, program owners, and personnel across multiple project sites, facilities, and offices throughout North America.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Environmental Health and Safety (EH&S) Manager will have the opportunity to collaborate with team members at all levels across the organization to develop and implement innovative programs that promote a strong culture of safety and environmental responsibility.

This role will serve as a trusted advisor, providing expert guidance and support to site management, program owners, and personnel across multiple project sites, facilities, and offices throughout North America.

lists.content:
• Improve EHS workplace performance by promoting a positive safety culture and implementing safety and environmental management systems in accordance with state, local and federal regulations, corporate compliance policies and standards. 
  • Identify and evaluate hazardous conditions and practices in the workplace. Conduct and coordinate on-site inspections to audit physical conditions and safe work practices. 
  • Coordinate the implementation of controls from results of hazard analyses and risk assessments. Measure and evaluate the effectiveness of the hazard control system, policies and procedures and recommend changes that reflect improved opportunities to mitigate workplace incidents and injuries. 
  • Assists in the development of controlled documents and training programs for employees in areas such as compliance training, lab/plant inspection, material handling, emergency response, and life safety, may be the point of contact for emergency personnel. Develop specialized education and training materials. 
  • Review, investigate and implement action plans for work-related injuries, illnesses, accidents and safety concerns 
  • Maintain thorough knowledge of federal, state and local OSHA regulations, fire and safety codes, engineering safety standards and environmental quality regulations. 
  • Coordinates and participates in committees and attends meetings related to employee safety, manufacturing process safety, fire safety, as well as property loss or damage. 
  • Provides expertise on safety risk management, statistics and trends. 
  • Coordinates and conducts worksite inspections and audits. 
  • Collects and maintains SDS documentation on all approved chemicals 
  • Collaborates with Procurement to ensure only approved chemicals are purchased.  
  • Perform other related duties as directed that correspond to the overall function of this position.

• 10+ years EHS experience in manufacturing setting with Bachelors degree or equivalent experience.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  • Excellent customer service skills, with an advanced understanding of customer relationship building. 
  • Proficient use of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint. 
  • In depth knowledge of EHS laws, standards, codes and regulatory requirements. 
  • Advanced knowledge of manufacturing, laboratory and material handling safety

• Proven capabilities/competencies in training, EPA/OSHA compliance, emergency response, and program implementation. 
  • Strong facilitation and communication skills 
  • Strong project management skills in facilitating projects/activities

As a Facilities Project Manager at our cutting-edge company, you'll be at the forefront of building the future. From high-tech facility expansions to mission-critical infrastructure upgrades, you'll lead projects from concept to completion—ensuring seamless execution of new construction, renovations, and state-of-the-art equipment installations. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to define project scopes, optimize timelines, and drive strategic initiatives that power innovation. If you're ready to shape the backbone of next-gen defense technology, this is your opportunity to make an impact.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Facilities Project Manager at our cutting-edge company, you'll be at the forefront of building the future. From high-tech facility expansions to mission-critical infrastructure upgrades, you'll lead projects from concept to completion—ensuring seamless execution of new construction, renovations, and state-of-the-art equipment installations. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to define project scopes, optimize timelines, and drive strategic initiatives that power innovation. If you're ready to shape the backbone of next-gen defense technology, this is your opportunity to make an impact.

lists.content:
• Project Planning and Coordination:
  • Plan, coordinate, and execute facilities projects, including construction, renovations, expansions, and equipment installations, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets.
  • Define project scopes, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  • Develop comprehensive project schedules and timelines, allocating resources and tracking dependencies to ensure smooth project flow.

  • Develop Insights:
  • Monitor project progress, track milestones, and oversee expenditures, providing timely updates to the Facilities Manager.
  • Identify and proactively manage potential project risks, implementing effective mitigation strategies.
  • Prepare detailed project reports to capture key metrics, highlight progress, and address issues with corrective actions.
  • Schedule and lead meetings with stakeholders to discuss project updates, timelines, and adjustments.
  • Conduct post-project evaluations to assess outcomes and document lessons learned.

• This role requires 50% travel and flexibility for extended hours to meet project demands.
  • 2-3+ years of experience in construction or facilities project management, ideally within a cross-functional environment.
  • Strong project management skills with expertise in scheduling, budgeting, and tracking for construction projects.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of engaging with diverse teams and stakeholders.
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a proven ability to meet deadlines and achieve project objectives.
  • Proficient in reading and interpreting construction documents and specifications.

Job Description: 
This role will be centered around the development and sustainment of a manufacturing execution system, as well as the integration of third-party software systems into a manufacturing environment. You will be working on tough, critical-path projects and exciting challenges that require immediate attention. These can be wide-ranging and located within different parts of Shield AI with Manufacturing Software Systems being at the core of it.

This role is for you if you are used to and enjoy solving hard problems, you have a maniacal sense of urgency and roll up your sleeves to get things done. A daily routine doesn’t exist in our fast-paced environment, which is why you have to adapt to new circumstances regularly.

Job Description:
This role will be centered around the development and sustainment of a manufacturing execution system, as well as the integration of third-party software systems into a manufacturing environment. You will be working on tough, critical-path projects and exciting challenges that require immediate attention. These can be wide-ranging and located within different parts of Shield AI with Manufacturing Software Systems being at the core of it.

This role is for you if you are used to and enjoy solving hard problems, you have a maniacal sense of urgency and roll up your sleeves to get things done. A daily routine doesn’t exist in our fast-paced environment, which is why you have to adapt to new circumstances regularly.

lists.content:
• Develop and sustain manufacturing executional software, as well as integrate third party software into a production ecosystem.
  • Function as lead for factory and manufacturing software integration and development.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify software integration needs and drive continuous improvement in the development of solutions that meet the needs of our technicians, stakeholders, and customers
  • Design and improve UI and UX for Shield AI’s Material Flow, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain Software.
  • Solve challenges or complete project work with a heavy focus on Manufacturing Systems, system integration, production automation and software development
  • Apply your expertise in software development and automation to inform design decisions and ensure software meets the needs of our products
  • Quickly build an understanding of the issues at hand and devise a path to resolution independently or as part of a team, utilizing data-driven analysis, automation tools, and cross-functional collaboration to drive efficient and effective solutions.
  • Show high adaptability and eagerness to handle extra duties and responsibilities, supporting different areas of the organization beyond their main tasks when the criticality justifies it.
  • Other duties as assigned

• Demonstrated experience shipping software to end users.
  • Direct experience building front-end and back-end software for web-based applications.
  • 5+ years of experience in software development (This can be waived with proven record of excellence in field)
  • Can-do attitude and a maniacal sense of urgency
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or related field, or equivalent industry experience
  • Full stack software engineering experience in one or more application-level programming languages (eg python, C#)
  • Experience with web application and desktop application development
  • Experience with every stage of the software lifecycle, including requirements gathering and end user support
  • Experience using databases (e.g. SQL server)
  • Experience with revision control systems and versioning practices (e.g. git and gitflow)
  • Experience supporting applications in production critical environments
  • Experience using or interfacing with ERP/MRP systems
  • Strong understanding of software development principles, including design patterns and testing methodologies
  • Experience with industrial automation tools and technologies
  • Strong inclination for first principles problem-solving
  • Experience with manufacturing environments, or other supply chain experience

• Ideal candidate would be a multitalented engineer eager to learn and take on a wide variety of different software engineering disciplines to create cohesive and integrated solutions
  • Bonus if you have experience with event streaming platforms (e.g., Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, or similar) for data pipelines and real-time analytics.

description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Software Applications Engineer will provide technical expertise and support to customers during the implementation and use of Shield AI enterprise software products. This role involves working closely with customers to understand their requirements and ensuring successful product integration for AI & Autonomy development.

lists.content:
• We are looking to hire U.S based personnel who are willing and able to travel internationally (50% minimum travel required) to support foreign customers and be stationed in foreign nations for extended periods up to 12 months.
  • Become an expert user of the Hivemind enterprise software stack. 
  • Provide technical support and training to customers. 
  • Develop AI & Autonomy applications using the Shield AI enterprise software development kit.
  • Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities, e.g., demos. 
  • Assist in post-sales deployment and integration of Shield AI enterprise software products. 
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and training materials. 
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. 
  • Help customers debug software/API integration issues. 
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to address customer feedback and improve products. 
  • Visit customers on site globally to support software integration and development activities.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. 
  • 7+ years of experience of industry experience or 6+ years of experience plus a master's degree
  • Ability to travel a minimum of 50% of work hours, with extended periods deployed at customer sites (domestic or abroad)
  • 3+ years of experience in an integration/applications engineering role 
  • 3+ years of experience working in a startup environment. 
  • Strong technical background in software engineering. 
  • Strong proficiency in writing modern C++ code. 
  • Intermediate proficiency in writing Python code. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Experience in the defense aviation or robotics industry. 
  • Experience building and running a small enterprise software applications/solutions engineering team.

This pivotal role will drive the scaling of our data-driven decision-making processes, providing real-time insights that shape key financial and operational strategies. You will leverage advanced analytics, visualization tools, and financial modeling techniques to support strategic initiatives and enhance performance optimization.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Shield AI is seeking a Finance Data Engineering & Analytics Manager to join our Finance team. This pivotal role will drive the scaling of our data-driven decision-making processes, providing real-time insights that shape key financial and operational strategies. You will leverage advanced analytics, visualization tools, and financial modeling techniques to support strategic initiatives and enhance performance optimization.

lists.content:
• Lead the creation and implementation of a comprehensive data strategy to enhance data quality, governance, and accessibility across Finance.
  • Utilize SQL, Python, and advanced Excel techniques to extract, transform, and analyze complex datasets.
  • Design, implement, and maintain Microsoft Fabric data warehouse / lakehouse to consolidate and house key financial & operational data from disparate data sources across the organization to build a single source of truth.
  • Automate data workflows and optimize extract, transform, and load processes to improve reporting efficiency and data integrity.
  • Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to provide real-time financial insights for key stakeholders.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams, including FP&A, Accounting, and Program Finance to integrate financial data with broader business intelligence frameworks.
  • Ensure alignment with company-wide data architecture and compliance with data governance standards in collaboration with IT and Engineering.

• At least 5 years of experience in business intelligence, financial analytics, or data strategy roles
  • Advanced proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Excel (including Power Query and Power Pivot) for data visualization and analysis.
  • ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and data integration skills
    • ·        Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure
    ·        Understanding of data modeling and database design principles
    ·        Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts
    ·        Ability to work with structured and unstructured data
    ·        Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Strong knowledge of database systems and SQL

• Experience in a software, defense technology or aerospace company.
  • Deep knowledge of ERP / MRP systems like SAP or Deltek Costpoint and integration with BI tools.
  • Experience working with Python and/or Microsoft Fabric for data management, analytics, and automation.
  • Exposure to FP&A processes and strategic financial planning in high-growth or startup environments.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Hivemind Forge is an innovative simulation, data science, and infrastructure team at Shield AI. We own the tools for designing, developing, testing, deploying and evaluating instances of the Hivemind AI pilot and commander. Our software products enable companies to construct and control sophisticated autonomous systems, and therefore we are transforming the future of autonomy. We are committed to excellence, driving innovations that prepare autonomous agents for the most critical missions. 

The Hivemind Forge product is Shield AI's AI Factory; a service-oriented architecture leveraged through an SDK, CLI, and web portal. Our focus is on leveraging both virtualized and bare-metal infrastructure to orchestrate autonomous agents in sophisticated simulations, dynamically configure test beds, and pioneer software configurations and deployments on robotic systems. The Forge team is not only solving problems; we are tasked with setting new benchmarks in technology and delivering unparalleled user experiences. 

We pride ourselves on a diverse team of experts from fields such as computer science, aerospace, game design, and distributed simulation systems. This diversity fuels our innovative spirit, in an environment that values creativity, teamwork, and a relentless pursuit of excellence.  

As a Software Engineer you’ll help lead the development of the Forge product web portal and integrated installer. Our web portal provides a user interface for Operators to rehearse missions, plan scenarios, and analyze performance. It also provides a central location for autonomy engineers to interact with Hivemind software and communicate with other teams. We're looking for an engineer with a visionary outlook and a solid track record of delivering great user interfaces.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Hivemind Forge is an innovative simulation, data science, and infrastructure team at Shield AI. We own the tools for designing, developing, testing, deploying and evaluating instances of the Hivemind AI pilot and commander. Our software products enable companies to construct and control sophisticated autonomous systems, and therefore we are transforming the future of autonomy. We are committed to excellence, driving innovations that prepare autonomous agents for the most critical missions. 

The Hivemind Forge product is Shield AI's AI Factory; a service-oriented architecture leveraged through an SDK, CLI, and web portal. Our focus is on leveraging both virtualized and bare-metal infrastructure to orchestrate autonomous agents in sophisticated simulations, dynamically configure test beds, and pioneer software configurations and deployments on robotic systems. The Forge team is not only solving problems; we are tasked with setting new benchmarks in technology and delivering unparalleled user experiences. 

We pride ourselves on a diverse team of experts from fields such as computer science, aerospace, game design, and distributed simulation systems. This diversity fuels our innovative spirit, in an environment that values creativity, teamwork, and a relentless pursuit of excellence.  

As a Software Engineer you’ll help lead the development of the Forge product web portal and integrated installer. Our web portal provides a user interface for Operators to rehearse missions, plan scenarios, and analyze performance. It also provides a central location for autonomy engineers to interact with Hivemind software and communicate with other teams. We're looking for an engineer with a visionary outlook and a solid track record of delivering great user interfaces.

lists.content:
• Build custom editors (e.g., maps, forms, visualizations, and graphs) to configure and execute simulations of autonomous vehicles 
  • Develop extensible user interfaces for interacting with large multi-dimensional datasets 
  • Develop RESTful APIs and data-models 
  • Create end-user documentation

• Typically requires a minimum of 7 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 2 years experience; or equivalent experience.
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience in designing and developing production quality software systems. 
  • 3+ years experience developing software to interface with web APIs, including proficiency with gRPC and RESTful APIs. 
  • 1+ years demonstrated experience with React/Node/Typescript and Material UI 
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, similar degree, or equivalent practical experience 
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others

• Experience with geospatial data and WebGL   
  • Experience applying design systems to UI components  
  • Experience with Web RTC 
  • Eye for design and UX sensibilities 
  • Hands-on experience with a major cloud platform (Azure, GCP, AWS)  
  • Experience with Linux, Docker, and CI/CD environments  
  • Experience with WebSockets and Electron (or similar)  
  • Experience with Playwright UI testing

Job Description:
We are currently seeking a Global S/R Specialist with international shipping experience. This is a full-time warehouse position that requires daily communication and shipment documentation.

lists.content:
• Support the implementation of processes and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for international and domestic shipments, freight, and parcel including preparation of required documentation (commercial invoices, packing slips, country of origin forms, dangerous goods certifications, etc.)   
  • Provide timely and accurate quotes to customers as requested; support the team on carrier contract negotiations   
  • Schedule, execute and oversee an array of transportation brokerage services in accordance with legal and customer requirements, including cargo characteristics, service options and requirements, transit time and loading and offloading requirements.   
  • Plan, build and manage logistics improvement plans.   
  • Communicate any transportation impacts including analysis and/or information regarding the industry and/or government (foreign and domestic) policies and regulations that may affect the company.  
  • Manage relationships with providers’ sales representatives, operational staff, US ports and terminals, customs broker/s, US Customs and Border Patrol and other gov't agencies.   
  • Maintain accountability for delivery reliability.   
  • Utilize specific knowledge of the logistics market, trends, and capabilities to identify opportunities for cost reductions and savings opportunities.   
  • Create visibility & accountability on all projects; facilitate the development of line-of-sight metrics to link logistics activities to PMT’s strategic initiatives.   
  • Improves and provide logistics solutions to support customer satisfaction

• 3-5 Years working in the shipping industry  
  • Domestic and International shipping experience to include shipping hazardous materials and ITAR exports  
  • A demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others  
  • Excellent skills in time management and organization.

• BS preferred
  • Previous experience with a military logistics organization 
  • Previous experience in field of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS)
  • Dangerous Goods/HAZMAT Certification

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


JOB DESCRIPTION:
As an Architect designer on the HMS Architecture Team, you’ll be at the forefront of designing next-generation autonomous solutions by defining, managing, and governing a key system domain. You’ll collaborate closely with Hivemind (HM) counterparts—across Pilot, Foundation, Forge, and Commander—to seamlessly integrate your domain into the larger ecosystem. Balancing bold innovation with program objectives, you’ll proactively tackle emerging challenges before they impact HMS programs, all while building architectures that stand the test of time. In addition to driving the HMS technical roadmap, you’ll play a pivotal role on the Future Concepts team, pioneering cutting-edge autonomy applications for Shield AI in maritime and space environments. This unique vantage point gives you the chance to explore uncharted territory, pushing technical boundaries and unlocking novel possibilities for next-generation systems. 

You’ll serve as the “belly button” for technical alignment between HM and HMS, ensuring both organizations remain in sync on roadmaps, designs, and execution strategies. Through close partnership with Chief Engineers and the joint Architecture Board, you’ll have significant influence over the technical roadmap, systems engineering processes, and strategic decision-making. In short, you’ll be the catalyst driving cohesive, forward-thinking solutions that turn big ideas into operational reality.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
As an Architect designer on the HMS Architecture Team, you’ll be at the forefront of designing next-generation autonomous solutions by defining, managing, and governing a key system domain. You’ll collaborate closely with Hivemind (HM) counterparts—across Pilot, Foundation, Forge, and Commander—to seamlessly integrate your domain into the larger ecosystem. Balancing bold innovation with program objectives, you’ll proactively tackle emerging challenges before they impact HMS programs, all while building architectures that stand the test of time. In addition to driving the HMS technical roadmap, you’ll play a pivotal role on the Future Concepts team, pioneering cutting-edge autonomy applications for Shield AI in maritime and space environments. This unique vantage point gives you the chance to explore uncharted territory, pushing technical boundaries and unlocking novel possibilities for next-generation systems.

You’ll serve as the “belly button” for technical alignment between HM and HMS, ensuring both organizations remain in sync on roadmaps, designs, and execution strategies. Through close partnership with Chief Engineers and the joint Architecture Board, you’ll have significant influence over the technical roadmap, systems engineering processes, and strategic decision-making. In short, you’ll be the catalyst driving cohesive, forward-thinking solutions that turn big ideas into operational reality.

lists.content:
• Domain & Design Ownership
  • Lead the architecture for your specialized domain, defining designs, interfaces, and dependencies that effortlessly fit into the broader system.
  • Stay ahead of evolving requirements, creating both short- and long-term technical strategies that spark innovation.
  • Collaboration & Integration
  • Partner with fellow architects and the Architecture Board to synchronize roadmaps, eliminate cross-domain hurdles, and keep complex programs on track.
  • Act as the central conduit between Hivemind (HM) and HMS, proactively tackling challenges before they escalate.
  • Technical Roadmap & Innovation
  • Shape the future of your domain by driving a dynamic technical roadmap aligned with customer and program objectives.
  • Champion IRAD opportunities and new concepts, ensuring cutting-edge ideas are tested, validated, and swiftly integrated.
  • Governance & Stakeholder Engagement
  • Influence Systems Engineering processes and program strategies in close coordination with Chief Engineers, keeping all decisions grounded in cohesive governance standards.
  • Gather insights from diverse stakeholders—Systems Engineers, Program Managers, Business Development—to inform design choices and maintain continuous alignment.
  • Testing & Evolution
  • Define rigorous testing strategies that validate architectural integrity, ensuring every solution meets system-level objectives and user needs.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and novel applications for feasibility, helping guide HMS and HM into groundbreaking new territory.

• Delivery of robust, scalable architectures for their assigned domain, fully integrated into the overall system.
  • Comprehensive documentation of MBSE artifacts, designs, interfaces, and testing strategies.
  • Clear alignment of HM and HMS technical roadmaps and development strategies, communicated effectively to stakeholders.
  • Technical innovation driven by a balance of short- and long-term program needs.
  • Effective collaboration across architects, stakeholders, and teams to ensure alignment and coherence in execution.

• Lead the design and integration of complex system architectures for autonomous systems.
  • Develop and maintain a technical roadmap that aligns with both immediate product milestones and broader strategic objectives.
  • Participate in architecture reviews and provide technical guidance on best practices, design patterns, and technology choices.
  • Proactively identify potential risks or bottlenecks and lead the effort to mitigate them.

• Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • 8+ years of experience in systems or software architecture for complex, distributed, or mission-critical applications.
  • Demonstrated expertise in creating and managing architectural artifacts (e.g., system context diagrams, UML/SysML models, interface definitions, design patterns).
  • Proven success coordinating diverse technical teams, resolving stakeholder conflicts, and ensuring cohesive end-to-end solutions.
  • Solid understanding of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and modern software development methodologies in an Agile environment.
  • Familiarity with architecture frameworks such as DoDAF, particularly in regulated or defense-oriented contexts.
  • Strong track record of leading cross-functional governance boards or architecture councils to guide strategic decisions and maintain alignment among stakeholders.

Are you passionate about creating a smooth and meaningful employee experience? Join our People Experience (PX) Operations team—a high-impact group dedicated to supporting every stage of the employee journey, from onboarding to offboarding and everything in between. As a PX Operations Associate, you'll play a vital role in shaping how new team members are welcomed and how employee data is managed with precision and care. You'll collaborate closely with PX leaders to ensure processes run smoothly and efficiently, making a real difference in the day-to-day lives of our employees.

Are you passionate about creating a smooth and meaningful employee experience? Join our People Experience (PX) Operations team—a high-impact group dedicated to supporting every stage of the employee journey, from onboarding to offboarding and everything in between. As a PX Operations Associate, you'll play a vital role in shaping how new team members are welcomed and how employee data is managed with precision and care. You'll collaborate closely with PX leaders to ensure processes run smoothly and efficiently, making a real difference in the day-to-day lives of our employees.

lists.content:
• Lead the onboarding process by collaborating with hiring managers to secure prompt documentation and deliver a seamless, inclusive experience for all new hires—including external labor and international employees. 
  • Facilitate offboarding by proactively communicating with managers and departing employees to ensure a smooth transition, while overseeing documentation, maintaining compliance standards, and managing all necessary offboarding processes. 
  • Maintain HRIS by updating employee information, processing organizational changes, performing regular audits for data accuracy, and generating reports to support business transformation. 
  • Prepare and submit federal and state mandated filings—including EEOC, VETS-4212, Census Bureau, and others—in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. 
  • Administer LOA requests by ensuring compliance with legal requirements and company policies, providing timely, compassionate support, and maintaining clear communication with affected employees. 
  • Managing the Worker’s Compensation program (L&H and DBA components) 
  • Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to drive process clarity and operational excellence across the organization. 
  • Process employee changes across systems to facilitate organizational updates and support overall business transformation. 
  • Provide comprehensive HR administrative support by managing the PX Ops and Benefits inboxes, responding to VOE requests within 24 hours, and following up on pending inquiries and action items.

• 2-5 years of experience in Human Resources operations or related field  
  • Knowledge of current employment laws and regulations 
  • Reporting and data auditing experience

• Excellent customer service skills  
  • Hands on experience with HRIS and Timekeeping systems 
  • Excellent organizational skills, detail oriented, flexible and able to adapt to change  
  • Well-developed critical thinking and ability to independently dig into questions and find solutions 
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others TT

descriptionBody: Are you passionate about creating a smooth and meaningful employee experience? Join our People Experience (PX) Operations team—a high-impact group dedicated to supporting every stage of the employee journey, from onboarding to offboarding and everything in between. As a PX Operations Associate, you'll play a vital role in shaping how new team members are welcomed and how employee data is managed with precision and care. You'll collaborate closely with PX leaders to ensure processes run smoothly and efficiently, making a real difference in the day-to-day lives of our employees.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As an Lab Specialist, you will take ownership of our Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) lab in our Washington, D.C. office, ensuring it operates efficiently and effectively. You will collaborate across teams in a fast-paced environment to design, build, and maintain the HIL infrastructure and assets. This role requires a hands-on approach—fabricating hardware, integrating test systems, troubleshooting complex issues, and optimizing lab processes. Your contributions will be instrumental in accelerating development cycles, improving system reliability, and supporting critical mission objectives.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As an Lab Specialist, you will take ownership of our Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) lab in our Washington, D.C. office, ensuring it operates efficiently and effectively. You will collaborate across teams in a fast-paced environment to design, build, and maintain the HIL infrastructure and assets. This role requires a hands-on approach—fabricating hardware, integrating test systems, troubleshooting complex issues, and optimizing lab processes. Your contributions will be instrumental in accelerating development cycles, improving system reliability, and supporting critical mission objectives.

lists.content:
• Manage Lab Operations – Oversee the organization and daily operation of the integration lab, ensuring safety, compliance, and efficiency. Continuously improve processes, including adopting 5S principles. 
  • Maintain Test Assets – Track, configure, and manage lab equipment and test assets to ensure availability and integrity. Develop tools to streamline and automate inventory management. 
  • Build & Integrate Hardware – Fabricate hardware fixtures and cable harnesses for autonomy and mission systems software testing and validation. 
  • Execute Test Procedures – Work closely with developers to conduct both formal and informal testing, collect and distribute test artifacts to stakeholders 
  • Troubleshoot & Analyze – Perform first-level triage on test failures by reviewing logs and identifying root causes. 
  • Utilize Lab Management Tools – Maintain and operate software tools for inventory management, event scheduling, and test execution. 
  • Support Key Lab Events – Set up and facilitate simulations, feature demonstrations, and critical testing operations. Provide hands-on technical support and troubleshooting in real time.

• High school diploma or equivalent. 
  • 4+ years of hands-on technical experience. 
  • Willingness to travel (approx. 10%) to support offsite test visits.
  • Experience managing a Systems Integration Lab, or similar environment. 
  • Basic familiarity with networking concepts, including Local Area Networks (LANs) in a lab environment, such as setting up network devices, configuring IP addresses, and troubleshooting connectivity issues.  
  • Ability to configure software devices, troubleshoot integration issues, and diagnose root causes. 
  • Proficiency in reading mechanical and electrical drawings, with hands-on experience building test fixtures to spec. 
  • Skilled in fabricating and repairing cable harnesses, including soldering, crimping, and connector assembly. 
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to anticipate and resolve issues before they impact lab operations. 
  • Effective communicator with the ability to guide and support teams during lab events and testing procedures. 
  • Basic experience in python and/or bash scripting.
  • Proven problem-solver with a bias for action, able to take tasks from concept to completion with minimal oversight. 
  • Ability to obtain and maintain an active security clearance.​
  • Physical effort including standing, lifting, and carrying equipment up to 30 lbs. unassisted.
  • Ability to work all shifts and available for overtime and weekends, as needed.

• Associate degree or higher in a STEM or similar field 
  • Experience working in Aerospace or DoD related integration Labs 
  • Background in a fast-paced, R&D or startup environment. 
  • Formal 5S training 
  • Holds active DoD clearance

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description:
Shield AI is on a mission to build the world’s most advanced AI pilots for next-generation autonomous aircraft, and we’re looking for a Lead Fuel Systems Engineer to drive the design, development, and integration of cutting-edge fuel systems that push the limits of endurance and performance.

In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of developing mission-critical fuel solutions for our next generation advanced UAV platform, ensuring seamless fuel storage, transfer, and pressurization for long-endurance, high-performance autonomous flight. You’ll work alongside top-tier engineers in propulsion, avionics, structures, and AI to create game-changing fuel systems that enhance survivability, efficiency, and operational flexibility in contested environments.

This is more than just a job—it’s a chance to redefine what’s possible in autonomous aviation.

Job Description:
Shield AI is on a mission to build the world’s most advanced AI pilots for next-generation autonomous aircraft, and we’re looking for a Lead Fuel Systems Engineer to drive the design, development, and integration of cutting-edge fuel systems that push the limits of endurance and performance.

In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of developing mission-critical fuel solutions for our next generation advanced UAV platform, ensuring seamless fuel storage, transfer, and pressurization for long-endurance, high-performance autonomous flight. You’ll work alongside top-tier engineers in propulsion, avionics, structures, and AI to create game-changing fuel systems that enhance survivability, efficiency, and operational flexibility in contested environments.

This is more than just a job—it’s a chance to redefine what’s possible in autonomous aviation.

lists.text: What you will do in this role:
lists.content:
• Lead the design and integration of advanced fuel systems for autonomous aircraft in high-stakes missions.
  • Optimize mission endurance and weight distribution through innovative fuel storage, transfer, venting, and pressurization solutions.
  • Architect fail-safe, redundant fuel management systems to ensure operational flexibility and survivability.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with propulsion, avionics, thermal, and structures teams for seamless system integration.
  • Apply CFD and system-level modeling to optimize fuel flow, minimize pressure losses, and enhance thermal stability.
  • Oversee supplier selection, component qualification, and aerospace-grade fuel system testing.
  • Solve real-world challenges like cavitation, thermal expansion, and high-altitude fuel behavior.
  • Support fuel system testing, troubleshooting, and performance analysis for flight validation.
  • Ensure compliance with FAA, MIL-STD, and aerospace fuel system regulations.

• 8 + years of experience in aerospace fuel systems engineering, fluid mechanics, and propulsion integration.
  • Deep expertise in fuel storage, transfer, pressurization, and venting systems for high-performance aircraft or UAVs.
  • Strong background in fluid dynamics, thermodynamics, and computational fluid dynamics (CFD).
  • Proficiency in CFD tools (ANSYS Fluent, OpenFOAM), MATLAB, Simulink, and CAD (CATIA, NX, SolidWorks).
  • Experience with DO-160, MIL-STD-810, or other aerospace fuel system certification standards.
  • Hands-on knowledge of fuel pumps, valves, sensors, and system integration testing.
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills for prototype and production fuel systems.
  • US Citizenship required due to security clearance requirements.

• Experience with military UAVs, fighter jets, or high-endurance ISR platforms.
  • Background in stealth fuel system design and vapor management.
  • Knowledge of alternative fuel technologies, hybrid-electric propulsion, and advanced energy storage.
  • Experience supporting flight test operations and mission endurance optimization.

salaryDescription: Please note that the salary range reflects multiple levels of seniority. The final level and scope of the role will be determined through the interview process.

Job Description:
As the Lead Hardware Reliability Engineer for the Aircraft Engineering team, you will manage a team of engineers, data scientists and technicians responsible for hardware failures in the field and new design engineering. You will be responsible for developing the strategy and vision for ensuring Shield AI products are highly reliable when they arrive in customer hands. This team will extract valuable insights from the aircraft fleet and work closely with technical and business teams to optimize hardware reliability. This team will utilize the latest technology and automation available to turn insights from hardware telemetry into action.

Job Description:
As the Lead Hardware Reliability Engineer for the Aircraft Engineering team, you will manage a team of engineers, data scientists and technicians responsible for hardware failures in the field and new design engineering. You will be responsible for developing the strategy and vision for ensuring Shield AI products are highly reliable when they arrive in customer hands. This team will extract valuable insights from the aircraft fleet and work closely with technical and business teams to optimize hardware reliability. This team will utilize the latest technology and automation available to turn insights from hardware telemetry into action.

lists.content:
• Manage and mentor a talented team of up to 5 engineers with different backgrounds such as Electrical Engineers and Data Scientists 
  • Define and execute test campaigns to reproduce failures and determine root cause 
  • Hands on debugging of failures with test equipment as necessary 
  • Develop individual team members by enabling opportunities suited to everyone. Provide guidance and technical coaching to develop the team’s expertise and ownership of field reliability 
  • Define the long-term vision for scaling up field monitoring processes as the fleet grows 
  • Develop and implement field monitoring systems and strategies to quickly detect fleet trends and failures as they arise 
  • Combine statistical analysis, software, and field telemetry to draw correlations between production data, environmental factors, and field performance 
  • Drive hardware, software and operational changes through root cause and analysis findings 
  • Work closely with hardware, software and production leaders to influence reliability improvements across all disciplines 
  • Perform technical and business analysis trades to steer the organization

• Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics, or a STEM discipline 
  • 2+ years of experience in a technical leadership role 
  • 2+ years in a hardware design, reliability, or root-cause analysis role 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Demonstrated capability to parse technical subjects on a deep level 
  • Demonstrated ability to jump into ill-defined problem spaces and drive positive outcomes   
  • Self-starter attitude, energy, and the ability to communicate effectively across business and technical disciplines

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Hivemind Forge is an innovative simulation, data engineering, and infrastructure team at Shield AI. The team drives excellence in designing, testing, deploying, and evaluating instances of Hivemind Pilot and Commander. As Shield AI's AI Factory, Forge implements SDKs, CLIs, and webapps to enable the development of advanced autonomous systems. With a focus on versatility, Forge develops tools that empower developers across environments - from cloud-based solutions and on-premises systems to local developer laptops. The team is dedicated to advancing autonomy and delivering exceptional user experiences through robust, scalable, and developer-friendly solutions.


As a Frontend Engineering Manager for Hivemind Forge, you will lead a team of talented frontend engineers building a web platform that is core to the development and evaluation of advanced autonomous systems. The Forge web application is a mission-critical interface for orchestrating simulations, analyzing AI behavior, and configuring real-world autonomy deployments. 

You’ll be responsible for technical leadership, team growth and mentorship, and cross-functional coordination, while continuing to contribute meaningfully to architecture and implementation. You’ll collaborate closely with teams across product, simulation, backend, systems, and autonomy to deliver a responsive and reliable platform for autonomy engineers. 

We’re looking for a strong engineering leader who combines deep technical expertise in modern frontend development with a passion for growing high-performing teams and delivering excellent user experiences in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.

The Forge web application is a mission-critical interface for orchestrating simulations, analyzing AI behavior, and configuring real-world autonomy deployments. 

You’ll be responsible for technical leadership, team growth and mentorship, and cross-functional coordination, while continuing to contribute meaningfully to architecture and implementation. You’ll collaborate closely with teams across product, simulation, backend, systems, and autonomy to deliver a responsive and reliable platform for autonomy engineers. 

We’re looking for a strong engineering leader who combines deep technical expertise in modern frontend development with a passion for growing high-performing teams and delivering excellent user experiences in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.

lists.content:
• Lead and mentor a team of frontend engineers, helping them grow their skills, meet career goals, and deliver high-quality software. 
  • Drive technical decisions and architecture for the Forge web application and its integration with backend APIs, data pipelines, and autonomy tooling. 
  • Stay hands-on, contributing to complex feature development and code reviews across React and TypeScript-based services. 
  • Coordinate cross-functionally with product managers, designers, and teams across simulation, autonomy, and analysis to align roadmaps and execution. 
  • Deliver user interfaces for advanced autonomy workflows - including simulation visualization, data analysis, and agent configuration tools. 
  • Establish and maintain UI quality standards through design systems, reusable components, automated testing, and robust documentation. 
  • Foster a culture of technical excellence, innovation, and collaboration within the team and the broader organization.

• 10+ years of experience designing and developing production-grade software systems. 
  • 6+ years of experience building and integrating frontend systems with RESTful APIs and backend services. 
  • 3+ years of experience as a team lead or engineering manager, with demonstrated success in growing and mentoring engineers. 
  • Advanced proficiency in React and TypeScript. 
  • Strong architecture and design skills, particularly for scalable and extensible frontend systems. 
  • Experience building interactive UIs for complex domains such as simulation, data analysis, or visualization. 
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 
  • A strong track record of collaboration, high standards, and technical ownership in mission-critical environments.

• Experience with WebGL, geospatial data, or simulation tooling. 
  • Familiarity with WebSockets, WebRTC, or real-time data streaming. 
  • Eye for design and UX sensibilities, including application of design systems. 
  • Experience developing or contributing to an SDK. 
  • Experience with frontend testing frameworks, particularly Playwright. 
  • Exposure to Electron, egui, desktop-class web applications, or hybrid apps. 
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and cloud environments (Azure, GCP, or AWS). 
  • Comfort working in Linux-based development environments.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Platform Engineering Manager on the Hivemind Forge team, you will be at the forefront of designing and developing the infrastructure and tools that power advanced autonomy systems. This role combines technical leadership with hands-on development, requiring a deep understanding of scalable architectures, distributed systems, and developer tooling. 

You will work closely with product management, program teams, and cross-functional engineering groups, including simulation, analysis, frontend, systems, and autonomy teams, ensuring that Forge meets the evolving needs of autonomy engineers. Your leadership will drive high-impact technical decisions, mentor engineers, and shape the future of Forge’s platform capabilities - all while remaining actively involved in writing code and system design
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Platform Engineering Manager on the Hivemind Forge team, you will be at the forefront of designing and developing the infrastructure and tools that power advanced autonomy systems. This role combines technical leadership with hands-on development, requiring a deep understanding of scalable architectures, distributed systems, and developer tooling. 

You will work closely with product management, program teams, and cross-functional engineering groups, including simulation, analysis, frontend, systems, and autonomy teams, ensuring that Forge meets the evolving needs of autonomy engineers. Your leadership will drive high-impact technical decisions, mentor engineers, and shape the future of Forge’s platform capabilities - all while remaining actively involved in writing code and system design

lists.content:
• Manage a team of platform developers 
  • Lead the design and development of Forge’s platform, ensuring scalability, performance, and security. 
  • Architect and implement distributed systems, high-performance APIs, and robust data pipelines for autonomy engineering workflows. 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with simulation, analysis, frontend, systems, and autonomy teams to integrate Forge into the broader Shield AI ecosystem. 
  • Develop and optimize backend services, data models, and cloud-based infrastructure to support simulation and real-world autonomy testing. 
  • Drive technical excellence, establishing best practices for code quality, security, and system reliability. 
  • Balance hands-on development with leadership responsibilities, mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of technical innovation. 
  • Ensure seamless developer experiences, enhancing Forge’s SDK, CLI, and web tooling to empower autonomy engineers. 
  • Manage project priorities, trade-offs, and timelines, ensuring alignment with company objectives. 
  • Create and maintain clear, detailed documentation for internal and external users of Forge’s platform.

• 10+ years of experience designing and delivering scalable, production-grade software systems. 
  • 3+ years of technical leadership experience, guiding teams in designing and building complex software platforms. 
  • Expertise in Golang and Python for backend and systems programming. 
  • Strong background in cloud computing, containerization, and orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker). 
  • Deep understanding of distributed systems, networking protocols (TCP, UDP), and data processing. 
  • Experience deploying secure, reliable infrastructure in hybrid cloud and on-premises environments. 
  • Strong architectural decision-making skills, balancing performance, scalability, and maintainability. 
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience. 
  • Proven ability to mentor engineers, work collaboratively, and drive results in fast-paced environments.

• Experience with Helm charts and automated infrastructure deployment tools. 
  • Familiarity with low-level network analysis tools (e.g., Wireshark, Serf). 
  • Knowledge of CUE for configuration management and schema validation. 
  • Experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing environments. 
  • Background in aerospace, defense, or regulated industries with a focus on secure software practices. 
  • Experience building and maintaining production-grade SDKs. 
  • Proficiency in additional systems-level languages (e.g., C++, Rust). 
  • Hands-on experience with event-driven architectures and distributed systems.

Job Description
Become an integral part of Shield AI’s production team as a Manufacturing Engineering Technician. In this role, you will provide crucial support and implementation assistance to engineers, ensuring the smooth operation of our production manufacturing processes. Your hands-on expertise will be essential in conducting tests, maintaining equipment, documenting processes, and providing technical assistance to our production team.

Job Description
Become an integral part of Shield AI’s production team as a Manufacturing Engineering Technician. In this role, you will provide crucial support and implementation assistance to engineers, ensuring the smooth operation of our production manufacturing processes. Your hands-on expertise will be essential in conducting tests, maintaining equipment, documenting processes, and providing technical assistance to our production team.

lists.content:
• Support and Implementation: Assist engineers in setting up machinery and equipment, conducting tests, and ensuring the operational readiness of manufacturing systems. 
  • Routine Maintenance and Troubleshooting: Perform regular maintenance on manufacturing equipment, troubleshoot issues as they arise during production, and take proactive measures to minimize downtime. 
  • Documentation and Reporting: Document manufacturing work instructions, performance data, and test results. Identify and resolve production blockers. Compile reports based on production data to provide insights for process optimization and improvement. 
  • Technical Assistance: Provide technical support to the manufacturing team, offering guidance on equipment operations, troubleshooting techniques, and best practices. 
  • Hands-On Tasks: Engage in hands-on tasks, directly interacting with production machinery and materials to ensure efficient operation and quality output. 
  • Training Support: Assist in training new staff on equipment operations, safety protocols, and standard operating procedures to ensure competency and adherence to quality standards.

• Proficiency in reading technical drawings, schematics, and specifications
  • Hands-on experience with manufacturing equipment, tools, and instrumentation
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues effectively
  • Excellent documentation and reporting skills, with attention to detail
  • Collaborative mindset with strong communication and interpersonal abilities
  • Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment

• Associate degree or equivalent technical certification in engineering technology, manufacturing, or related field
  • Prior experience in aerospace manufacturing or a similar high-tech industry
  • Prior experience creating visual work instructions for assembly and test processes
  • Prior experience troubleshooting electrical assemblies

Job Description:
The Manufacturing Planner will be responsible for updating and managing ticket requests related to production schedules and workflows. This role involves processing JIRA tickets submitted by internal customers, ensuring timely resolution, and coordinating with cross-functional teams to address any production-related issues. The planner will also track progress, prioritize requests, and maintain clear communication with stakeholders to ensure smooth manufacturing operations. Additionally, they will help streamline processes and suggest improvements to optimize production efficiency.
