Job Description:
The Manufacturing Planner will be responsible for updating and managing ticket requests related to production schedules and workflows. This role involves processing JIRA tickets submitted by internal customers, ensuring timely resolution, and coordinating with cross-functional teams to address any production-related issues. The planner will also track progress, prioritize requests, and maintain clear communication with stakeholders to ensure smooth manufacturing operations. Additionally, they will help streamline processes and suggest improvements to optimize production efficiency.

lists.content:
• Monitor and update JIRA ticket requests related to manufacturing schedules and processes.
  • Review, prioritize, and resolve JIRA tickets submitted by internal teams to address production challenges.
  • Work closely with various departments to troubleshoot and resolve production issues efficiently.
  • Track the status of open tickets and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders.
  • Recommend and implement improvements to enhance production workflows and eliminate delays.

• Experience in manufacturing or production planning with a strong understanding of production processes and workflows.
  • Proficiency with JIRA or similar ticket management systems for tracking and resolving issues.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills for interacting with internal teams and stakeholders effectively.
  • Attention to detail and a focus on maintaining accuracy while managing ticket requests and updates.
  • Familiarity with ERP systems or other software tools used in production planning and scheduling is a plus.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure timely issue resolution and smooth operations.

• 1-3 years experience in a manufacturing environment as a planner or expeditor.
  • APICS certification is a plus.

Job Description: 
At Shield AI, our PCB design team is responsible for all of the circuit board designs in our various hardware products. You will lead and build this team as our product lines grow and we take on new design challenges. This requires a good knowledge of best design practices, manufacturability, PCB design process, and leadership. Ideally you have experience designing with power electronics, RF, high-speed, analog, and AC. Aerospace and/or defense experience is helpful, but not required. A good understanding of IPC standards, PCB materials, and stack-ups is necessary.

lists.content:
• Lead a team of 3-6 CAD engineers and librarians for all of Shield AI’s PCB design needs 
  • Mentor teammates and provide technical feedback 
  • Establish PCB design team standards and processes 
  • Drive team workload, priorities, and schedule 
  • When needed, contribute directly to PCB designs, library work, and ECOs 
  • Engage cross-functionally with engineering teams such as electrical, mechanical, thermal, and HW test 
  • Support manufacturing by incorporating reliability and failure feedback 
  • Work directly with PCB manufacturing and assembly vendors to drive highly reliable designs

• 10+ years of experience as a PCB design engineer 
  • 3+ years of experience as a lead or manager 
  • Excellent technical fundamentals 
  • Extensive experience with constraints, net classes, variants, BOM and library management, design outputs 
  • Highly knowledgeable in cradle to grave PCB design processes 
  • Exceptional organization and communication skills 
  • Familiarity with Altium

As a Platform Software Engineer on the Hivemind Forge team, you will shape the infrastructure and tools enabling the development of advanced autonomy systems. You will contribute to the design of intuitive web applications, robust APIs, and developer-friendly SDKs that empower autonomy engineers to create, refine, and deploy Hivemind’s capabilities in both simulated and real-world environments. We seek engineers with a passion for building scalable, high-performance solutions and the technical expertise to deliver exceptional user experiences.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Platform Software Engineer on the Hivemind Forge team, you will shape the infrastructure and tools enabling the development of advanced autonomy systems. You will contribute to the design of intuitive web applications, robust APIs, and developer-friendly SDKs that empower autonomy engineers to create, refine, and deploy Hivemind’s capabilities in both simulated and real-world environments. We seek engineers with a passion for building scalable, high-performance solutions and the technical expertise to deliver exceptional user experiences.

lists.content:
• Design and implement robust data models and database architectures to support distributed systems. 
  • Develop scalable backend services and APIs to power Forge’s infrastructure and tooling. 
  • Build systems for virtualization, containerization, and orchestration, ensuring optimal performance across cloud, on-premises, and local environments. 
  • Architect and deploy resilient infrastructure for managing high-throughput data pipelines and complex simulation workloads. 
  • Design and implement networked systems, integrating advanced protocols and middleware to enable seamless communication across autonomous agents and backend systems. 
  • Contribute to tools and infrastructure that support secure, efficient deployment of Forge on varied hardware platforms. 
  • Create and maintain clear, detailed documentation for internal and external users of Forge’s platform capabilities.

• 8-15 + years of experience designing and delivering production-grade, scalable software systems. 
  • Advanced proficiency with Golang and Python for systems programming and backend development. 
  • 3+ years of experience with cloud computing platforms, container orchestration, and virtualization technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker, VMware). 
  • Expertise in designing and optimizing relational databases, data models, and high-throughput pipelines. 
  • Strong understanding of network protocols (e.g., UDP, TCP) and hands-on experience with building distributed networked applications. 
  • Familiarity with systems programming concepts such as concurrency, performance optimization, and resource management. 
  • Experience deploying secure, reliable infrastructure in hybrid cloud and on-premises environments. 
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 
  • Proven ability to work collaboratively, mentor team members, and deliver results in fast-paced, mission-driven environments.

• Experience with Helm charts and automated infrastructure deployment tools. 
  • Familiarity with tools for low-level network analysis and debugging, such as Wireshark or Serf. 
  • Knowledge of CUE for configuration management and schema validation. 
  • Experience with virtualization platforms and hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing environments. 
  • Background in aerospace, defense, or another highly regulated industry with a focus on secure and compliant software practices. 
  • Proficiency in additional systems-level programming languages such as C++ or Rust. 
  • Hands-on experience with distributed systems, event-driven architectures, and canary deployments.

Job Description: 
Shield AI is seeking a Principal Aircraft Structures Design Engineer (or Aerostructures Lead) to lead the design and integration of primary and secondary structural systems on our next-gen autonomous aircraft. This is a highly strategic, senior technical role where you will drive the development of lightweight, durable, and mission-adaptable aerostructures from concept through test and production.

You will be a key technical leader guiding decisions around materials, manufacturing, and performance tradeoffs while collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams including aero, propulsion, systems, and manufacturing. This is a hands-on, high-impact opportunity to shape the core structural architecture of a new class of aircraft built for autonomy, resilience, and global defense applications.

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:
Shield AI is seeking a Principal Aircraft Structures Design Engineer (or Aerostructures Lead) to lead the design and integration of primary and secondary structural systems on our next-gen autonomous aircraft. This is a highly strategic, senior technical role where you will drive the development of lightweight, durable, and mission-adaptable aerostructures from concept through test and production.

You will be a key technical leader guiding decisions around materials, manufacturing, and performance tradeoffs while collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams including aero, propulsion, systems, and manufacturing. This is a hands-on, high-impact opportunity to shape the core structural architecture of a new class of aircraft built for autonomy, resilience, and global defense applications.

lists.content:
• Lead the structural design architecture for the next-gen UAV, owning conceptual and preliminary structural configuration down to detailed design of primary and secondary load-bearing assemblies.
  • Oversee the development of composite and metallic structures, optimizing for performance, weight, cost, manufacturability, and mission flexibility.
  • Act as a technical mentor and design authority, coaching structural engineers and ensuring consistent design practices, review standards, and execution quality across teams.
  • Collaborate with aero, GNC, propulsion, payload, and manufacturing teams to define interface and integration requirements for structures under real-world mission conditions.
  • Integrate simulation-driven design workflows and validation methodologies, incorporating FEA, load path optimization, fatigue, and environmental constraints early in the design cycle.
  • Provide hands-on support to prototype builds, manufacturing integration, and flight test activities, helping to resolve structural challenges in real time.
  • Drive adoption of model-based development and digital engineering tools within the Siemens (NX, Teamcenter) environment.
  • Partner with supply chain and manufacturing to ensure structural designs are ready for scalable production with clear specs, tolerances, and fabrication plans.
  • Lead and support design reviews, failure investigations, corrective actions, and documentation efforts aligned with airworthiness and mission safety standards.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  • 10+ years of experience in aircraft structural design, with at least 3 years in a technical leadership or mentorship capacity.
  • Proven expertise in composite and metallic airframe structures, including bonding, bolted joints, sandwich panels, and repairability.
  • In-depth understanding of structural analysis, including kinematics, dynamics, load paths, and stiffness/fatigue behavior.
  • Proficiency in CAD (NX, CATIA, or SolidWorks) and familiarity with FEA tools (e.g., NASTRAN, ANSYS, or HyperWorks).
  • Experience working within or alongside certification processes and airworthiness standards (FAA Part 23/25, MIL-HDBK, etc.).
  • Demonstrated track record of delivering structurally sound, test-validated airframes from clean-sheet design through prototype or production.

• Experience with automated composite manufacturing (AFP, ATL), additive manufacturing, or advanced joining technologies.
  • Hands-on experience with structural validation testing, including static, dynamic, fatigue, and thermal/environmental testing.
  • Familiarity with aero-structural interaction, including aerodynamic performance, control surface loads, and thermal/aeroelastic effects.
  • Exposure to digital engineering practices, model-based design workflows, or PLM integration (e.g., Siemens Teamcenter).
  • Prior work on UAV, high-performance, or unconventional airframes in defense or advanced aerospace programs.

Job Description:
Shield AI is seeking a Principal Airframe & Manufacturing Engineer to lead the design, development, and production of airframe structures for our next-generation autonomous aircraft.

This is a high-impact role at the forefront of full-scale UAV development, requiring expertise in composite and metallic structural design, advanced manufacturing techniques, and full-aircraft integration. You will work across airframe engineering, material selection, production planning, and manufacturing scalability to deliver a mission-ready, production-efficient UAV platform.

This is an opportunity to work on a brand-new AI-powered aircraft. Your work will directly impact the next generation of autonomous airpower, from early-stage R&D to full-rate production.

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Job Description:
Shield AI is seeking a Principal Airframe & Manufacturing Engineer to lead the design, development, and production of airframe structures for our next-generation autonomous aircraft.

This is a high-impact role at the forefront of full-scale UAV development, requiring expertise in composite and metallic structural design, advanced manufacturing techniques, and full-aircraft integration. You will work across airframe engineering, material selection, production planning, and manufacturing scalability to deliver a mission-ready, production-efficient UAV platform.

This is an opportunity to work on a brand-new AI-powered aircraft. Your work will directly impact the next generation of autonomous airpower, from early-stage R&D to full-rate production.

lists.content:
• Lead the design and manufacturing development of advanced airframe structures, ensuring they meet mission, aerodynamic, and durability requirements.
  • Develop and optimize composite and metallic structures, including fuselage, wings, and primary load-bearing airframe components.
  • Drive the transition from R&D to full-scale production, working closely with manufacturing, suppliers, and fabrication teams to ensure a scalable, high-quality manufacturing process.
  • Oversee the integration of propulsion, avionics, and flight control systems within the airframe to ensure a structurally optimized UAV.
  • Develop advanced manufacturing processes, including composite layup, bonding, CNC machining, and automated fabrication techniques.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace standards, including MIL-STD, FAA, and DoD regulations, for airframe design and production.
  • Conduct structural analysis (FEA), fatigue life assessments, and material stress testing to optimize aircraft performance and longevity.
  • Lead airframe prototyping efforts, supporting tooling design, materials testing, and initial flight validation.
  • Mentor and provide technical leadership to junior engineers, collaborating across aerospace, manufacturing, and supply chain teams.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  • 10+ years of experience in airframe structural design, analysis, and production.
  • Expertise in composite and metallic materials, bonded structures, and advanced manufacturing methods.
  • Hands-on experience in full-aircraft development, from concept to production launch.
  • Proficiency in CAD & FEA tools (CATIA, NX, SolidWorks, NASTRAN, Abaqus, ANSYS).
  • Strong knowledge of manufacturing processes, including composite layup, bonding, CNC machining, and supplier management.
  • Experience with structural testing, fatigue analysis, and load validation for aerospace applications.
  • US Citizenship required due to security clearance requirements.

• Experience working on high-performance UAVs, military aircraft, or advanced aerospace platforms.
  • Knowledge of additive manufacturing, rapid prototyping, and automated composite layup techniques.
  • Background in low-observable (stealth) airframe design and aerostructures.
  • Experience in scaling aerospace production, including supplier qualification and cost optimization.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
As a Principal Electrical Power Systems Engineer, you will play a critical role in shaping the next generation of aircraft power systems. You will be responsible for architecting, designing, and deploying a robust, high-reliability power system that meets the unique demands of our aircraft. This includes overseeing the development of an uninterruptible power system with a high-capacity battery, conducting make-vs-buy trade studies, and collaborating with third-party vendors to qualify subsystems. You will lead a team of engineers, drive cross-functional collaboration, and ensure system performance through rigorous testing and validation. Your expertise in power system design for large aircraft, combined with a deep understanding of industry standards and best practices, will be essential in delivering a state-of-the-art solution that meets both operational and environmental challenges.

Job Description:

You will be responsible for architecting, designing, and deploying a robust, high-reliability power system that meets the unique demands of our aircraft. This includes overseeing the development of an uninterruptible power system with a high-capacity battery, conducting make-vs-buy trade studies, and collaborating with third-party vendors to qualify subsystems. You will lead a team of engineers, drive cross-functional collaboration, and ensure system performance through rigorous testing and validation. Your expertise in power system design for large aircraft, combined with a deep understanding of industry standards and best practices, will be essential in delivering a state-of-the-art solution that meets both operational and environmental challenges.

lists.content:
•  Define and execute the vision of our next generation aircraft power system from concept to production
  • Design, develop, and integrate state-of-the-art high-power systems tailored for optimal performance and reliability in harsh environments
  • Design an uninterruptible power system with a high-capacity battery
  • Make vs. buy trade studies. Select, test, and integrate modules for use in the aircraft
  • Engage with 3rd party engineering and vendors as necessary to qualify subsystems and/or guide custom development efforts.
  • Ensure system performance and reliability is met through rigorous verification
  • Debug complex problems related to the electrical design, environmental, manufacturing, etc.
  • Lead multiple engineers dedicated to the power system design
  • Drive a cross-functional team to execute the top-level architecture
  • Develop bench test setups and HIL infrastructure
  • Provide mentorship, design review, and program execution leadership
  • Work in a fast-paced environment

• Power system design experience on large aircraft, such as Group 4 or Group 5
  • Understanding of relevant avionics design standards for UAVs such as DO and MIL-STD
  • 10+ years relevant experience
  • Proficient with electrical engineering development tools, simulation, and test equipment
  • Experience leading key aspects of product design and execution
  • Strong technical fundamentals and analysis

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company whose mission is to protect service members and civilians with intelligent systems. In pursuit of this mission, Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Its AI pilot, Hivemind, has flown a fighter jet (F-16), a vertical takeoff and landing drone (V-BAT), and a quadcopter (Nova). The company has offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington DC and abroad. Shield AI’s products and people are currently in the field actively supporting operations with the U.S. Department of Defense and U.S. allies. 

As an Aerodynamics-Performance Engineer, you will lead the development and optimization of aerodynamic performance for aircraft engineering. Your expertise will be critical in ensuring that our aircraft achieve optimal aerodynamic efficiency, stability, and performance across a variety of operational conditions.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company whose mission is to protect service members and civilians with intelligent systems. In pursuit of this mission, Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Its AI pilot, Hivemind, has flown a fighter jet (F-16), a vertical takeoff and landing drone (V-BAT), and a quadcopter (Nova). The company has offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington DC and abroad. Shield AI’s products and people are currently in the field actively supporting operations with the U.S. Department of Defense and U.S. allies. 

As an Aerodynamics-Performance Engineer, you will lead the development and optimization of aerodynamic performance for aircraft engineering. Your expertise will be critical in ensuring that our aircraft achieve optimal aerodynamic efficiency, stability, and performance across a variety of operational conditions.

lists.content:
• Lead the aerodynamic design, analysis, and optimization of UAS, focusing on performance, stability, and efficiency. 
  • Conduct computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations and wind tunnel tests to validate aerodynamic designs. 
  • Develop and implement aerodynamic performance models and tools to support design and flight operations. 
  • Support conceptual and preliminary design efforts of aircraft and components 
  • Progress infrastructure for databases, codes, and tools management 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including structural engineers, propulsion engineers, and control systems engineers, to ensure integrated and optimized aircraft performance. 
  • Analyze flight test data to validate and refine aerodynamic models and designs. 
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in aerodynamics and apply best practices to our systems. 
  • Mentor and provide technical leadership to junior engineers and contribute to the continuous improvement of our engineering processes.

• Typically requires a minimum of 15 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 14 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 12 years experience; or equivalent experience. 
  • Extensive experience in aerodynamic design and analysis, particularly for unmanned or autonomous aircraft. 
  • Experience partnering with a multidisciplinary engineering team, including mechanical, electrical, propulsion, software, and AI disciplines 
  • Solid understanding of aerodynamic fundamentals, CFD techniques, and wind tunnel testing 
  • Experience with aerodynamic tools and techniques, e.g. vortex-lattice, panel-method, etc. 
  • Experience with Matlab or Python for data analysis 
  • Familiarity with translating aerodynamic analyses into workable design solutions for flight vehicles 
  • Familiarity with lofting/surfacing tools in Solidworks (or equivalent CAD software tools) for generating water-tight geometries 
  • Proven track record of successfully shipping products, showcasing the ability to navigate through development cycles, overcome obstacles, and deliver high-quality solutions to meet project deadlines and exceed expectations in a fast-paced environment. 
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience with UAVs or other autonomous systems. 
  • Knowledge of aircraft propulsion systems and integration. 
  • Familiarity with flight control systems and their impact on aerodynamic performance. 
  • Experience with Pointwise, Tecplot or similar CFD software tools 
  • Experience with low-speed airfoil design 
  • Experience with wind tunnel testing 
  • Experience with aeroelasticity and flutter analysis

Job Description: 
As part of the Hivemind Commander (HMC) team, you’ll play an active role in shaping and implementing our HMC Core Product. This HMC Core Product is a foundational, extensible set of services that enable both human operators (e.g. via command-and-control user interfaces) and third parties (e.g. to interoperate with wider networks) to interact with active Hivemind Edge (HME) autonomy systems and aircraft. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with other Core Product engineers, Solutions engineers and new customers to develop robust interfaces and architectures that enable seamless integration with new systems and user interfaces. Ultimately, you’ll make it easier to improve the ability of our software to adapt to new systems, thereby enhancing the quality and reliability of our products to protect service members and civilians with AI systems.

Job Description:
As part of the Hivemind Commander (HMC) team, you’ll play an active role in shaping and implementing our HMC Core Product. This HMC Core Product is a foundational, extensible set of services that enable both human operators (e.g. via command-and-control user interfaces) and third parties (e.g. to interoperate with wider networks) to interact with active Hivemind Edge (HME) autonomy systems and aircraft. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with other Core Product engineers, Solutions engineers and new customers to develop robust interfaces and architectures that enable seamless integration with new systems and user interfaces. Ultimately, you’ll make it easier to improve the ability of our software to adapt to new systems, thereby enhancing the quality and reliability of our products to protect service members and civilians with AI systems.

lists.content:
• Contribute to the HMC platform that will revolutionize the way engineers, operators, and subject matter experts develop and integrate autonomy solutions. 
  • Contribute to building, extending and documenting interfaces for internal and customer use. 
  • Drive the development of a robust command and control software development kit (SDK) for internal and customer user. 
  • Develop, mature, and maintain test and distribution capabilities within continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• 15+ years of related experience developing large, production quality software systems.  
  • Expertise and deep experience with modern C++ (C++17 and beyond).  
  • Professional experience developing in Linux environments.  
  • Experience with Git and code management tools.    
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience with in aerospace and/or robotics industries.  
  • Experience with command and control, mission planning and other operator-oriented systems for UAVs. 
  • Experience with international interoperability standards like STANAG4586. 
  • Experience with team leadership, or as a technical project lead.  
  • Experience developing and maintaining software development kits (SDKs).

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As part of the Hivemind Foundations (HMF) team, you will play a critical role in shaping and implementing the EdgeOS product. You will partner with the Director of the HMF team to define and execute on HMF team’s vision.  

EdgeOS is a foundational, extensible set of developer facing capabilities that allow development of autonomy systems such as aircraft, marine and land surface vehicles, human-machine interfaces. EdgeOS serves an opinionated, optimized middleware offering capabilities to support all stages of development including simulation stage to real-world operation. You will be the team architect and most impactful developer, collaborating not only within the HMF teams, Hivemind Product managers, Program managers but across all other peer product (e.g., Hivemind Pilot, Forge, Commander) architects, internal and external end-product development teams (e.g., Hivemind-on-X or 3rd party partners), and Customer engineering.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As part of the Hivemind Foundations (HMF) team, you will play a critical role in shaping and implementing the EdgeOS product. You will partner with the Director of the HMF team to define and execute on HMF team’s vision.  

EdgeOS is a foundational, extensible set of developer facing capabilities that allow development of autonomy systems such as aircraft, marine and land surface vehicles, human-machine interfaces. EdgeOS serves an opinionated, optimized middleware offering capabilities to support all stages of development including simulation stage to real-world operation. You will be the team architect and most impactful developer, collaborating not only within the HMF teams, Hivemind Product managers, Program managers but across all other peer product (e.g., Hivemind Pilot, Forge, Commander) architects, internal and external end-product development teams (e.g., Hivemind-on-X or 3rd party partners), and Customer engineering.

lists.content:
• Help define and own HMF team vision and roadmap, in collaboration with engineering, product and customer stakeholders. 
  • Ensure EdgeOS is the world’s best high performance, extensible, portable, certifiable middleware for autonomy applications. 
  • Contribute to building, extending and documenting interfaces for internal and customer developer use as a software development kit (SDK) 
  • Partner with engineers (within and outside direct team), engineering managers, product and program managers to deliver EdgeOS capabilities.  
  • Coach and mentor team members, including customers’ engineers, on industry and HM best-practices. Partner with managers to support team member career progress.

• 15+ years of related experience developing large, production quality software systems.  Typically, 14 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 12 years experience; or equivalent experience. 
  • 10+ years of hands-on experience and deep experience with C++ (including modern C++17 and beyond). 
  • Firsthand experience developing deeply embedded, high-performance systems. 
  • Experience with developer facing solutions like SDKs 
  • Professional experience developing in Linux environments. 
  • Solid understanding of network protocols (eg., UDP, TCP, routing, QoS), with experience in designing and implementing networked applications.  
  • Experience with Git, code management tools & other SDLC tools and practices.   
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience in aerospace and/or robotics industries.  
  • Experience with international interoperability standards, especially in defense and autonomy domains like STANAG458, Mavlink. 
  • Experience or knowledge of integrating embedded solutions with cloud services, and applications. 
  • Experience with team leadership, or as a technical project lead.

descriptionBody:
As part of the Hivemind Foundations (HMF) team, you will play a critical role in shaping and implementing the EdgeOS product. You will partner with the Director of the HMF team to define and execute on HMF team’s vision.  

EdgeOS is a foundational, extensible set of developer facing capabilities that allow development of autonomy systems such as aircraft, marine and land surface vehicles, human-machine interfaces. EdgeOS serves an opinionated, optimized middleware offering capabilities to support all stages of development including simulation stage to real-world operation. You will be the team architect and most impactful developer, collaborating not only within the HMF teams, Hivemind Product managers, Program managers but across all other peer product (e.g., Hivemind Pilot, Forge, Commander) architects, internal and external end-product development teams (e.g., Hivemind-on-X or 3rd party partners), and Customer engineering.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Simulation Software Engineer with the Hivemind Forge Department, you will be responsible for several simulation environments that support the development and implementation of autonomous behavior on Group 3 and Group 5 unmanned aircraft. You will be an integral to definition of sensor capabilities, image rendering, environmental conditions, and integrated EO/IR based simulated payloads on simulated platforms.  The simulation environment you support will directly interact (through interfaces you create and maintain) with the autonomy and ground control station for VBATs and other platforms. As a Simulation Engineer you will ensure compliance with DoD and Industry standards (to include DIS and CIGI).

About our simulation environment – The Forge Simulation environment is multipurpose and written in the same stack as our autonomy environment. It utilizes Unreal Engine 5 for high fidelity visualization, Diligent Engine for low fidelity visualization, and integrates with DoD M&S products AFSIM and NGTS.  The environment promotes modularity with simulation blocks, interface blocks, and a common scenario format.

lists.content:
• Improve and maintain existing Hivemind Forge Simulation Environment
  • Support packaging of final product to internal and external customers for training and testing
  • Driving technical design and integration of new simulated payloads as they become required for platform testing
  • Work on a team of 6-10 other software engineers on advancing features for the Forge simulation product
  • Support extensibility of simulation environment through well-defined interfaces provided by government and business customers

• Experience in a relevant DoD modeling and simulation environment 
  • Strong C/C++ development experience Comfortability within UNIX/Linux environments  
  • 15+ years of industry experience  
  • Experience working projects with 10+ contributors  
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience  
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills by applying a scientific approach  
  • Offer fast, efficient, effective problem-solving approaches  
  • Exceptional collaborator and communicator  
  • Hard-working, trustworthy teammate  
  • Exhibits holding themselves and others to high standard

• Experience using AFSIM or NGTS as a modeler or developer 
  • Integrating DoD M&S environments with a targeted platform (ex - F-16) 
  • Docker, Kubernetes, and/or containerized application development
  • MS or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience  
  • Understanding of robotics technologies related to autonomous behavior development e.g. task allocation or planning.  
  • Understanding/Experience with unmanned system technologies and accompanying algorithms (specifically air domain)

As a Principal Engineer of Software Safety at Shield AI, you will build and lead a small team of experts to shape the future of safe and reliable AI Pilots across a diverse set of platforms. You will partner with our customer Safety community and internal leaders across hardware, software, GNC and Systems engineering to pioneer the future architecture and framework of Autonomy. The right person for this role has knowledge of design, development, test, analysis, software maintenance/sustainment, and continuous improvement. If you are someone who has hands-on experience throughout the entire new product development life cycle from concept to customer delivery, loves to be on the cutting edge, work with many multi-disciplinary teams, then this role is for you.

As a Principal Engineer of Software Safety at Shield AI, you will build and lead a small team of experts to shape the future of safe and reliable AI Pilots across a diverse set of platforms. You will partner with our customer Safety community and internal leaders across hardware, software, GNC and Systems engineering to pioneer the future architecture and framework of Autonomy. The right person for this role has knowledge of design, development, test, analysis, software maintenance/sustainment, and continuous improvement. If you are someone who has hands-on experience throughout the entire new product development life cycle from concept to customer delivery, loves to be on the cutting edge, work with many multi-disciplinary teams, then this role is for you.

lists.content:
• Evolve Shield AI’s Software and System Safety Approach
  • Develop AI certification plan and support design of Run Time Assurance stack
  • Present results of system safety analyses to external parties including FAA licensing individuals and DoD Safety community
  • Clearly communicate technical risks to the executive leadership team
  • Support Design & Development Engineers as a critical partner in Functional Hazard Analysis (FHA) and Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) exercises at system level, and sub-system level for complex aircraft and ground systems
  • Support the Design Requirements Process as a Subject Matter Expert to ensure teams adhere to Safety best practices and triage proactive hazard mitigations
  • Support Systems Integration and Test with Qualification Test Plan Development for new products
  • Support Development Milestone Reviews such as PDR, CDR, QDR representing SAI Safety
  • Host regular corrective action reviews to ensure lessons learned are communicated with all stakeholders, and that all actions have been implemented in a timely manner

• Minimum of 12+ years Industry Experience as a Software Engineer, Flight Controls Engineer, or System Safety Engineer
  • B.S. Degree in Engineering
  • Aircraft, Spacecraft, or UAV Operations Experience
  • Experience with MIL-STD-1629, MIL-STD-882, DO-178
  • Experience working on Advanced Hardware and Software Systems
  • An active security clearance (Secret, Top Secret, TS with SCI)
  • This role requires an onsite presence at our HQ in San Diego, CA, Frisco, TX, or Crystal City, VA

• Experience with Functional Hazard Analysis, Fault Tree Analysis, System Safety Analysis, Root Cause Analysis Methodologies, Corrective action management, Hazard Management, and Risk management
  • Experience with US and International Customers
  • M.S. Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or Systems Engineering
  • Modeling/CAD Experience
  • Electrical Engineering Familiarity with schematics, best practices, and industry guidelines for Reliability
  • Technical writing experience developing standards, specifications, user guides, and policies
  • Requirements drafting experience for Software & Hardware

Job Description: 
As a Principal State Estimation Engineer, you will be a key contributor to the GNC team, driving the development, optimization, and deployment of advanced sensor fusion algorithms that enable V-BAT to navigate and operate autonomously in dynamic, complex, and contested environments. You will develop real-time sensor processing pipelines, integrate multi-sensor data for robust state estimation, and work closely with autonomy researchers, software engineers, and hardware teams to ensure seamless system integration. Y

Your expertise will be critical in advancing Shield AI’s capabilities, from R&D to production, ensuring our UAVs achieve unmatched situational awareness and precision in mission-critical operations.

Job Description:
As a Principal State Estimation Engineer, you will be a key contributor to the GNC team, driving the development, optimization, and deployment of advanced sensor fusion algorithms that enable V-BAT to navigate and operate autonomously in dynamic, complex, and contested environments. You will develop real-time sensor processing pipelines, integrate multi-sensor data for robust state estimation, and work closely with autonomy researchers, software engineers, and hardware teams to ensure seamless system integration. Y

Your expertise will be critical in advancing Shield AI’s capabilities, from R&D to production, ensuring our UAVs achieve unmatched situational awareness and precision in mission-critical operations.

lists.content:
• Develop and implement advanced sensor algorithms for processing data from IMUs, radar, cameras, GPS, and other sensors. 
  • Enhance state estimation algorithms by integrating multi-sensor data for improved accuracy and robustness. 
  • Design and implement real-time sensor data processing pipelines. 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, autonomy researchers, and hardware engineers, to ensure seamless integration of state estimation algorithms. 
  • Conduct experiments and field tests to validate the performance of state estimation algorithms in real-world scenarios. 
  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in sensor technologies and state estimation, applying them to our systems.

• Typically requires a minimum of 15 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 14 years and a master’s degree; or a PhD with 12 years' experience; or equivalent experience.
  • Experience developing and deploying real-time sensor processing algorithms, e.g. with cameras, radar, IMUs, GPS, etc. 
  • Solid understanding of state estimation techniques, such as Kalman filters, particle filters, etc. 
  • Experience with C++ 11 or newer 
  • Experience with Linux, command line tools, etc. 
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and external stakeholders. 
  • Proven track record of successfully shipping products, showcasing the ability to navigate through development cycles, overcome obstacles, and deliver high-quality solutions to meet project deadlines and exceed expectations in a fast-paced environment. 
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience in implementing inertial navigation algorithms on real-time processing systems 
  • Knowledge of computer vision techniques 
  • Proficiency in optimizing algorithms for compute-constrained systems 
  • Experience with CUDA or other hardware acceleration technologies (e.g. FPGAs) 
  • Proven track record of transitioning from R&D to production

The Special Projects team at Shield AI is an elite force within the office of the CTO. It consists of a group of very senior (L5-L8) and highly experienced software engineering experts from diverse fields (aerospace, robotics, cloud infrastructure, game development, interactive media design,…).  The charter of this group is to steer technology development towards strategic alignment with the CTO’s vision, through tactical insertion into teams and technologies across the organization.  Individuals within this team make direct and at times forward-sprinting contributions to all three pillars of Hivemind, Shield AI’s software ecosystem for developing and deploying resilient intelligent teaming for aircrafts.  Hivemind consists of three products:  Hivemind Edge (autonomy for the edge; a models-based, modular and open architecture C++ codebase), Hivemind Design (Shield AI's AI Factory for the design, development, and testing of Hivemind Edge systems; a service-oriented architecture leveraged through an SDK, CLI, and web portal; a Go, Python, Typescript codebase), and Hivemind Commander (Software and hardware to support rich human-in-the-loop and human-on-the-loop interactions with the Hivemind; a C++-based back-end for interaction with Hivemind Edge, and a web-application UI for mission planning, command and control by operators implemented in a Typescript/React codebase). 

The Special Projects team is chartered to operate effectively within ambiguity.  While this team does not own any software products, it tactically and strategically impacts the development of all foundational Hivemind products and leverages those technologies to rapidly deliver low-TRL solutions. This work happens should-to-shoulder with the product teams in some cases, and in a forward-sprinting manner within the Special Projects team in other cases. The result is direct contribution to products in the former case, and development of reference implementations in the latter. 

The Special Projects team also functions as a pipeline for product and solution engineering teams across the organization.  Individuals who enter the Special Projects team rapidly gain depth and breadth in their understanding of the Hivemind software ecosystem.  This positions them well for leading technology development effort across the product and solution organization. 

As part of the Special Projects team, you will work on the integration of Hivemind Edge, Design and Commander into an integrated product.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.

lists.content: • You will architect and build next-generation AI interfaces that enable seamless human-AI interaction. Your work will focus on creating fluid, real-time experiences that handle multiple input types, from text to audio and images, with sophisticated dev tools that make AI interactions shareable, traceable, and reliable. Working closely with ML engineers, you will implement streaming interfaces that provide continuous feedback and clear visibility into AI thought process. Your expertise in frontend architecture will help shape how users interact with our AI systems, making complex technology accessible and intuitive through thoughtful UI design and implementation.

• BS/MS in Computer Science, similar degree, or equivalent practical experience.  
  • 10+ years experience developing large, production quality software systems.  
  • Excellent grasp of software development and coding principles with high productivity in a mainstream language (e.g. Typescript, C++, Go, Python, etc.).  
  • Strong knowledge of modern software engineering best practices; Experience with Git and code management tools; Good software hygiene regarding code documentation, unit testing, bug tracking.   
  • 5+ years of experience with React/Node/Typescript and React Components. 
  • Strong technical collaboration skills and a desire to develop new skills.   
  • Excited by a fast-moving environment with a highly motivated group.  
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others. 
  • Fluid intelligence that allows one to operate effectively in sometimes ambiguous conditions, while finding opportunities to drive technical efforts and force multiply. 
  • Real-time streaming interfaces over HTTP and WebSockets
  • Multi-modal input handling (text, files, images, audio).Advanced SPA routing and dynamic linking
  • Client-side state management
  • Progress indicators and streaming response rendering
  • URL-based state persistence and sharing mechanisms
  • Seamless content loading states and progressive rendering techniques
  • Server-Sent Events (SSE)

• Experience with geospatial data and WebGL. 
  • Experience applying design systems to UI components.  
  • Hands-on experience with a major cloud platform (Azure, GCP, AWS).  
  • Experience with Linux, Docker, and CI/CD environments.  
  • Experience with WebSockets and Electron (or similar).  
  • Experience with TypeScript and React for frontend web applications. 
  • Experience with Playwright UI testing
  • Building debugging/inspection UIs for generative AI systems
  • Client-side LLM Context Management

Job Description:
As a Principal Manufacturing Engineer, you will define and lead the strategic expansion of our manufacturing capabilities, driving both the scale-up of current production and the launch of an all-new production line for our next-generation jet. This is a high-impact, senior technical role responsible for factory architecture, long-term process strategy, capital equipment planning, and integration of advanced tools and technologies. You’ll work with executives, engineering leaders, and external partners to build the infrastructure required for high-volume, high-complexity aerospace manufacturing. You’ll set the standard for technical excellence and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our production systems.

Job Description:
As a Principal Manufacturing Engineer, you will define and lead the strategic expansion of our manufacturing capabilities, driving both the scale-up of current production and the launch of an all-new production line for our next-generation jet. This is a high-impact, senior technical role responsible for factory architecture, long-term process strategy, capital equipment planning, and integration of advanced tools and technologies. You’ll work with executives, engineering leaders, and external partners to build the infrastructure required for high-volume, high-complexity aerospace manufacturing. You’ll set the standard for technical excellence and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our production systems.

lists.content:
• Define and drive the company-wide strategy for scaling production capabilities, including new product introduction and facility expansion. 
  • Serve as the technical lead for standing up a new production line for a significantly larger and more advanced jet, overseeing everything from process architecture to equipment commissioning. 
  • Lead the planning and execution of infrastructure buildout, including capital equipment selection, software tool integration, factory layout, and vendor engagement. 
  • Act as a trusted advisor to executive leadership on manufacturing strategy, risk mitigation, and long-term capability development. 
  • Champion the deployment of cutting-edge manufacturing technologies that enable step-function improvements in cost, quality, and scalability. 
  • Represent manufacturing engineering in high-level program reviews, customer engagements, and strategic planning initiatives.

• Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field, or relevant experience
  • 15+ years of experience in manufacturing engineering, with a focus in rapid growth environments
  • Experience in owning the scale of production processes in a startup or rapid-growth environment.
  • Strong understanding of manufacturing processes, including machining, composites, avionics and/or assembly.
  • Experience with process improvement methodologies, such as Lean Manufacturing or Six Sigma.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment and adapt to changing priorities.

• Knowledge of quality standards, such as AS9100 or ISO 9001.
  • Proficiency in CAD software
  • Familiarity with advanced manufacturing technologies, such as additive manufacturing or automation systems.
  • Knowledge of ERP/MRP systems and data-driven decision-making in a manufacturing context.
  • Hands-on experience with manufacturing equipment and tooling design.
  • Strong project management skills, including experience managing multiple priorities and deadlines.

Job Description:
We are seeking an Operational Analysis Lead to drive the modeling, simulation, and analysis of Shield AI’s autonomous aircraft systems. This role is pivotal in evaluating the mission effectiveness, survivability, and operational impact of our next gen UAS and other autonomous platforms. You will work closely with engineering, product development, and defense stakeholders to inform design trade-offs, assess system performance, and optimize mission capabilities.

This position requires a deep understanding of military operations, wargaming, modeling & simulation (M&S), and operational analysis techniques. Your work will directly shape Shield AI’s strategy by identifying how our AI-powered aircraft can best serve the evolving needs of modern warfare.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:
We are seeking an Operational Analysis Lead to drive the modeling, simulation, and analysis of Shield AI’s autonomous aircraft systems. This role is pivotal in evaluating the mission effectiveness, survivability, and operational impact of our next gen UAS and other autonomous platforms. You will work closely with engineering, product development, and defense stakeholders to inform design trade-offs, assess system performance, and optimize mission capabilities.

This position requires a deep understanding of military operations, wargaming, modeling & simulation (M&S), and operational analysis techniques. Your work will directly shape Shield AI’s strategy by identifying how our AI-powered aircraft can best serve the evolving needs of modern warfare.

lists.content:
• Develop and execute operational analysis strategies to assess the effectiveness of autonomous aircraft in real-world military scenarios.
  • Lead modeling, simulation, and wargaming efforts to evaluate system performance, mission impact, and survivability in contested environments.
  • Work closely with engineering teams to translate operational insights into design decisions and system improvements.
  • Conduct trade studies and sensitivity analyses to assess system performance under varying operational conditions and threats.
  • Utilize advanced modeling & simulation tools (e.g., AFSIM, STK, MATLAB, Python) to develop high-fidelity mission models.
  • Analyze force-on-force engagements, sensor effectiveness, and autonomy-driven decision-making to optimize mission success.
  • Collaborate with DoD stakeholders, operators, and warfighters to understand mission needs and align system capabilities with operational requirements.
  • Develop and present technical reports, briefings, and recommendations to senior leadership, customers, and government agencies.
  • Support concept of operations (CONOPS) development for new AI-driven aircraft capabilities.
  • Identify emerging threats and operational challenges, ensuring Shield AI’s systems remain ahead of adversary capabilities.

• 10+ years of experience in operational analysis, modeling & simulation (M&S), or military operations research.
  • Expertise in military mission analysis, operational planning, and wargaming methodologies.
  • Proficiency with AFSIM, STK, MATLAB, Python, or other M&S tools used for aerospace and defense applications.
  • Deep understanding of air combat, ISR, electronic warfare, or autonomous systems in contested environments.
  • Experience working with DoD stakeholders, warfighters, and government agencies to align capabilities with mission requirements.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret large datasets and translate findings into actionable insights.
  • Excellent communication and briefing skills, with experience presenting to senior leadership, customers, and military personnel.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile development environment with shifting priorities.

• Prior experience in force-on-force analysis, CONOPS development, or military campaign modeling.
  • Familiarity with DoD acquisition processes, Joint Capabilities Integration and Development System (JCIDS), and military operational testing.
  • Experience integrating AI-driven decision-making algorithms into operational analysis frameworks.
  • Prior military service or experience working with U.S. Air Force, Navy, or Special Operations Forces.
  • Active Secret or Top-Secret clearance (or ability to obtain one).

The Staff/Sr. Staff Product Designer role within Shield AI’s Hivemind organization is responsible for solving complex User Experience and Product Design problems associated with the end-to-end user experience of developing, deploying, testing and evaluating autonomy solutions. The core products developed by the Hivemind organization target multiple user personae, ranging from the external end-user (the “Operator” of autonomous systems), to the Test engineer (who tests and evaluates autonomous systems in software-in-the-loop, hardware-in-the-loop and real-world flight test environments), to the AI engineer (who develops and tests autonomy architectures). Significant portions of the product are are best described as developer facing software product (i.e. SDKs, CLIs) and require contribution from designers that have relevant experience. Other portions of the product leverage web technologies and UIs to support configuration management, scenario design, mission planning, mission rehearsal, debrief, and test and evaluation process. The supported workflows with these products range from the highly visual/experiential experience of the operator using a ground-control-station (GCS) client to mission plan and command-and-control, to autonomy engineers working within the Integrated Development Environment, to Test Engineers using the web portal and extensible CLI tool. As such, Hivemind is a highly complex and technical product that enables complex workflows across multiple collaborating teams.

lists.content:
• Work closely with members of the Office of the CTO to crystallize the vision of the Hivemind product and its documentation
  • Lead the user experience design of the Hivemind web portal
  • Lead the user experience design of the expansive and interactive documentation system for the Hivemind product
  • Work closely with the technical leads of Hivemind Commander (mission planning, command and control, air-ground communications) and Hivemind Design (configurations, test and evaluation, rehearsal, analysis) to enhance the user experience of their products
  • Conduct user research to understand user personae and their needs
  • Investigate competing products and their user experiences, synthesize findings to present to engineering and product leadership

• Masters degree or equivalent in design, interaction design, human-computer-interaction, or similar
  • 8+ years of experience as a product and/or user experience designer
  • Experience with highly complex software products
  • Experience with product and user experience design of software products delivered with React / web-stack
  • Comfortable working within a Linux environment, experience with the Linux terminal
  • Thrives in a high-velocity product development environment
  • Is comfortable with ambiguity and is able to produce results with high-level guidance

• Experience with user experience design of autonomous systems
  • Experience with user experience design video games
  • Experience designing for “Low Code” or “No Code” systems
  • Experience and/or comfort reading C++ and/or Python and/or Typescript

As a Principal Engineer on the Generative AI (Gen AI) Team, you will play a pivotal role in harnessing generative AI technologies to enhance the velocity and efficiency of our internal developers and customers. This cross-functional team operates under the Systems Group and collaborates closely with Software Operations, Autonomy Factory Team, and other key stakeholders to integrate AI-driven solutions into our products and processes.

lists.content:
• Core Product Enhancements: Develop and integrate generative AI tools to augment existing feature sets for both internal and external consumption.
  • Standalone Applications: Design and implement new AI-driven tools aimed at improving developer velocity, such as upgrade assistants and documentation aides.
  • Internal Process Tools: Create and deploy AI solutions focused on enhancing internal release velocity, including PR review automation and bug resolution agents.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with the Software Operations group to define requirements and timelines for compute and networking needs, ensuring adherence to best practices and IP safety standards.
  • Integration: Partner with the Autonomy Factory Team to incorporate AI tooling into the deployed server, enhancing workflows and user experiences.

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 15+ years of experience developing large, production-quality software systems for Machine Learning or Autonomy.
  • Expertise in modern programming languages such as Python, C++, or Go.
  • Proven experience with generative AI models and frameworks, including training, fine-tuning, and deployment.
  • Strong knowledge of software development best practices, including CI/CD, version control (Git), and code management tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional projects and mentor junior engineers.

• Familiarity with AI integration into developer tooling and workflows.
  • Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices related to AI deployments.
  • Experience with cloud platforms and scalable AI infrastructure.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description:
The Special Projects team at Shield AI is an elite force within the office of the CTO. It consists of a group of very senior (L5-L8) and highly experienced software engineering experts from diverse fields (aerospace, robotics, cloud infrastructure, game development, interactive media design, …).  The charter of this group is to steer technology development towards strategic alignment with the CTO’s vision, through tactical insertion into teams and technologies across the organization.  Individuals within this team make direct and at times forward-sprinting contributions to all three pillars of Hivemind, Shield AI’s software ecosystem for developing and deploying resilient intelligent teaming for aircrafts.  Hivemind consists of three products:  Hivemind Edge (autonomy for the edge; a models-based, modular and open architecture C++ codebase), Hivemind Design (Shield AI's AI Factory for the design, development, and testing of Hivemind Edge systems; a service-oriented architecture leveraged through an SDK, CLI, and web portal; a Go, Python, Typescript codebase), and Hivemind Commander (Software and hardware to support rich human-in-the-loop and human-on-the-loop interactions with the Hivemind; a C++-based back-end for interaction with Hivemind Edge, and a web-application UI for mission planning, command and control by operators implemented in a Typescript/React codebase). 
 
The Special Projects team is chartered to operate effectively within ambiguity.  While this team does not own any software products, it tactically and strategically impacts the development of all foundational Hivemind products and leverages those technologies to rapidly deliver low-TRL solutions. This work happens should-to-shoulder with the product teams in some cases, and in a forward-sprinting manner within the Special Projects team in other cases. The result is direct contribution to products in the former case, and development of reference implementations in the latter. 

The Special Projects team also functions as a pipeline for product and solution engineering teams across the organization.  Individuals who enter the Special Projects team rapidly gain depth and breadth in their understanding of the Hivemind software ecosystem.  This positions them well for leading technology development effort across the product and solution organization. 

As part of the Special Projects team, you will work on the integration of Hivemind Edge, Design and Commander into an integrated product.

lists.content:
• Technology Strategy Ideation: Create the required technologies for rapid development of architectures to facilitate technology strategy articulation.  
  • Iterate Rapidly with Customer Feedback: Demonstrate developed architectures as solutions to the customer and gather feedback; iterate.  
  • Create Reference Implementations: Create reference implementations for potential future products or product components.   
  • Explore Future Technologies: Explore and evaluate future hardware and software technologies that are relevant to Shield AI’s product roadmap and potentially high-ROI, but beyond the scope of current Direct and IRAD projects in engineering.  
  • Identify areas of technical debt across the stack, analyze and synthesize solutions and paths towards achieving them.

• 15+ years of related experience developing large, production quality software systems.  
  • Expertise and deep experience with modern C++ (C++17 and beyond).
  • Expertise in deep experience architectural design and implementation of large and complex distributed systems.  
  • Experience with Git and code management tools.   
  • Passionate about developing high-quality and optimized software solutions.   
  • Excellent software hygiene regarding code documentation, unit testing, bug tracking.   
  • Strong technical collaboration skills and a desire to develop new skills.   
  • Excited by a fast-moving environment with a highly motivated group.  
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.
  • Fluid intelligence that allows one to operate effectively in sometimes ambiguous conditions, while finding opportunities to drive technical efforts and force multiply.

• Experience with C++17 and greater.  
  • Experience with in aerospace and/or robotics industries.  
  • Hands-on experience with a major cloud platform (Azure, GCP, AWS).  
  • Experience with team leadership, or as a technical project lead.  
  • Professional experience Linux environments.  
  • Experience with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.

As a Principal Systems Engineer of Cloud Architecture for the Hivemind Enterprise team, you will work closely with our other architects to drive quality system and feature designs and guide product component teams through design iterations. You will be a subject matter expert on software as a service deployments and technical architectures, working close with Hivemind Forge and Commander product components that provide the framework for developing autonomy. The right person for this role has many years and product cycles of experience for cloud software product launches, including design, development, test, analysis, software maintenance/sustainment, and continuous improvement. If you are someone who has hands-on experience cloud/SaaS products and wants to create the ecosystem for how the community develops and certifies autonomy, then come join the team!
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Principal Systems Engineer of Cloud Architecture for the Hivemind Enterprise team, you will work closely with our other architects to drive quality system and feature designs and guide product component teams through design iterations. You will be a subject matter expert on software as a service deployments and technical architectures, working close with Hivemind Forge and Commander product components that provide the framework for developing autonomy. The right person for this role has many years and product cycles of experience for cloud software product launches, including design, development, test, analysis, software maintenance/sustainment, and continuous improvement. If you are someone who has hands-on experience cloud/SaaS products and wants to create the ecosystem for how the community develops and certifies autonomy, then come join the team!

lists.content:
• Support the design and implementation of platform back-end, including robust data models and database architectures to support distributed systems, scalable APIs and resilient infrastructure for managing high-throughput data pipelines and complex simulation workloads, and networked systems.
  • Support the design and optimize cloud deployments of Forge to ensure scalability, reliability, and cost efficiency. 
  • Engage in technical strategy and roadmap capture for upcoming releases and 18-month lookahead.
  • Mentor and guide component engineering teams on best practices.
  • Conduct technical design reviews and audits of code and implementations.
  • Serve as the primary technical consultant to Product for architecture and future customer/partner engagements.

• 12+ years of industry experience as a Software Engineer, Systems Engineer, or System Safety Engineer focused on cloud product architectures and production software deployments.
  • 5+ years of technical leadership experience.
  • 5+ experience with cloud computing platforms, container orchestration, and virtualization technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker, VMware).
  • Experience deploying secure, reliable infrastructure in hybrid cloud and on-premises environments. 
  • Advanced proficiency with Golang and Python for systems programming and backend development. 
  • Advanced proficiency with Typescript, React, or Angular.
  • Advanced proficiency in cloud infrastructure (AWS and Azure preferred).
  • B.S. Degree in Engineering or more advanced degree.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Staff Technical Program Manager you will be responsible for leading the releases of Hivemind Enterprise, a software development kit that enables both Shield AI and third parties to create a new generation of unmanned systems and mission applications that deliver transformative capabilities for the U.S. and its allies. You will work with sponsors, product managers, designers and a talented cross-functional engineering team to lead on-time, on-target software releases. This Technical Program Manager role requires a versatile individual who can plan and manage a complex software development program and make difficult and informed trade off decisions.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Staff Technical Program Manager you will be responsible for leading the releases of Hivemind Enterprise, a software development kit that enables both Shield AI and third parties to create a new generation of unmanned systems and mission applications that deliver transformative capabilities for the U.S. and its allies. You will work with sponsors, product managers, designers and a talented cross-functional engineering team to lead on-time, on-target software releases. This Technical Program Manager role requires a versatile individual who can plan and manage a complex software development program and make difficult and informed trade off decisions.

lists.content:
• Drive the planning, execution, and delivery of complex software releases for the Hivemind Enterprise platform
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and customer engagement, to define release scope, objectives, and deliverables.
  • Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation, ensuring adherence to budget and schedule.
  • Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project completion.
  • Facilitate regular communication with stakeholders, providing updates on project status, challenges, and accomplishments.
  • Drive continuous improvement in project management processes, tools, and methodologies.
  • Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence within the program management team.
  • Facilitate technical decision making to appropriately prioritize work and make complex trades.
  • Reinforce Shield AI's reputation for technical excellence and ability to deliver through expert engagement and disciplined execution.

• B.S. in Computer Science, or a related field with 15+ years of work experience in Program Management or Engineering Management; alternative degrees are acceptable if professional experience is focused in Enterprise Software, Artificial Intelligence, or Robotics. 
  • Experience delivering software into production environments with high-reliability and high uptime
  • Experience driving development of complex software systems.
  • You have a track record of driving results, not just providing status
  • You have solid technical foundations in software development, deep knowledge of how to optimize the software development lifecycle and experience with both agile and waterfall methodologies.
  • You have the ability to recognize efficiency and inefficiency in projects and prioritize remedies based on accurate cost-benefit analysis. 
  • You are an exceptional, fundamentals-driven problem solver and communicator. 
  • You have a demonstrated record of setting and achieving goals in dynamic environments, working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Power user of Azure DevOps (ADO), Jira or work management tools

• Advanced degree in Computer Science or MBA
  • Previous experience as a software developer
  • Previous experience managing enterprise software
  • Passionate about software documentation
  • Autonomy, AI, ML expertise
  • PMP, Scrum Master, or similar qualifications
  • Must have experience delivering enterprise software. Ideally software that is used by developers.
  • Must have worked very closely with software engineering teams, not just managing schedules and budgets
