Job Description:
In this role, you will be responsible for processing items in a ticket workflow system and creating purchase requisitions in our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. Your primary objective will be to ensure the seamless flow of materials and supplies necessary for our operations.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:
In this role, you will be responsible for processing items in a ticket workflow system and creating purchase requisitions in our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. Your primary objective will be to ensure the seamless flow of materials and supplies necessary for our operations.

lists.content:
• Ticket Workflow Management:
  • Receive and review incoming tickets for material requirements, ensuring accuracy, and completeness.
  • Prioritize and organize tickets based on urgency and importance.
  • Collaborate with relevant departments to gather necessary information and clarify specifications as needed.
  • Update ticket status and progress in the workflow system, keeping stakeholders informed.

  • Purchase Requisition Generation:
  • Translate ticket requirements into detailed purchase requisitions in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
  • Verify item specifications, quantities, and delivery timelines to align with operational needs.
  • Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and procedures.
  • Follow up with requisition approvers to expedite the approval process.

  • Data Management and Documentation:
  • Maintain accurate records of all transactions, including purchase requisitions and related correspondence.
  • Generate reports on ticket processing and purchasing activities for management review.

  • Collaboration and Communication:
  • Work closely with the supply chain team and other relevant stakeholders to facilitate efficient procurement processes.
  • Communicate effectively with supply chain to resolve issues and ensure timely delivery of materials.
  • Provide support and assistance to colleagues as needed.

• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field preferred.
  • Proven experience in procurement, purchasing, or supply chain management roles.
  • Familiarity with ticket workflow systems and MRP software (e.g., SAP, Oracle, or similar).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make informed decisions under pressure.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with a focus on accuracy and completeness.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments and communicate with external stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and other relevant software applications.

• APICS/ASCM Certification 
  • Previous Aerospace Experience
  • 1-3 years in a similar role

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Product Manager on the Hivemind team, you will lead efforts to identify and address the most critical autonomy needs for Shield AI and its customers. Collaborating with a cross-functional team—business development, program managers, engineers, and executives—you'll help define what we build, when, and for whom. This high-impact role requires deep expertise in the testing, development, procurement, and operational use of military aircraft—with a focus on multi-role fighters and unmanned ISR platforms.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Product Manager on the Hivemind team, you will lead efforts to identify and address the most critical autonomy needs for Shield AI and its customers. Collaborating with a cross-functional team—business development, program managers, engineers, and executives—you'll help define what we build, when, and for whom. This high-impact role requires deep expertise in the testing, development, procurement, and operational use of military aircraft—with a focus on multi-role fighters and unmanned ISR platforms.

lists.content:
• Collaborate with BD, Engineers, and PMs to develop technical, management, and pricing strategies.
  • Work with other Product Managers, Program Managers, Business Development, sponsors, operational end-users, DoD acquisition organizations, industry partners, and a talented cross-functional engineering team to determine what we will build, when, why and for whom. You will communicate your findings via a variety of artifacts including product roadmaps, whitepapers, CO NOPs, and presentations.
  • Lead studies that result in a multi-year look ahead for Shield AI’s Jet Autonomy product offerings. This includes assessing everything required to develop, deploy, operate, sustain, evolve and maintain autonomous systems on military aircraft.

• Typically requires a minimum of 15 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 14 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 12 years' experience; or equivalent experience.
  • Jet aviation expertise: This role requires a versatile individual who has a deep understanding of aviation autonomy, DoD program funding & development cycles, military aviation testing, and the operational experience to frame and make informed decisions regarding requirements trades, integrated hardware, software, and systems engineering efforts
  • Exceptional communication skills—can effectively communicate with business executives, engineers, customers, end users, senior military leaders, etc. 
  • 8+ years' experience with jet aviation, as either a flight engineer or aviator
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a US Security Clearance. US citizenship is required as only US citizens are eligible for a security clearance.

• Military positional leadership (Squadron Commander, etc.)
  • Operational planning experience
  • Programmatic experience developing, acquiring, and implementing new technology or capabilities for military aviation units

Hivemind Forge is Shield AI’s productized platform for autonomy development and testing that provides capabilities for scenario design, simulation, test orchestration, data management, data analysis and visualization, configuration management, machine learning, reinforcement learning, and much more. As Forge Product Manager, you will guide the product’s development and roadmap and set priorities for software releases based on a deep understanding of both internal user and external customer needs. These will be driven by direct interaction with autonomy engineers and test engineers, as well as a deep understanding of the technical landscape and both government and commercial customers. You will be the owner and primary driver of Shield AI’s autonomy development and testing platform.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Hivemind Forge is Shield AI’s productized platform for autonomy development and testing that provides capabilities for scenario design, simulation, test orchestration, data management, data analysis and visualization, configuration management, machine learning, reinforcement learning, and much more. As Forge Product Manager, you will guide the product’s development and roadmap and set priorities for software releases based on a deep understanding of both internal user and external customer needs. These will be driven by direct interaction with autonomy engineers and test engineers, as well as a deep understanding of the technical landscape and both government and commercial customers. You will be the owner and primary driver of Shield AI’s autonomy development and testing platform.

lists.content:
• Develop and maintain a roadmap for Hivemind Forge that provides cutting edge applications, services, and tools to accelerate and simplify develop-test workflows for complex autonomy. 
  • Design and oversee delivery of highly scalable software that solves some of the most challenging problems in autonomy development, including high-fidelity physics-based simulation, orchestrating distributed tests on heterogeneous compute resources, analyzing and visualizing autonomy data from real-world flights, fine-tuning state estimation algorithms, training autonomous behavior policies using reinforcement learning, applying generative AI and large language models (LLMs) to autonomy development, and much more. 
  • Interface directly with customers and users to understand their goals, needs, and priorities with respect to their development and testing workflows. 
  • Develop product requirements based on deep understanding of customer needs. 
  • Be an expert user of and evangelist for Hivemind Forge. 
  • Ensure the Hivemind Forge product has industry leading capabilities, quality, extensibility, and documentation. 
  • Understand the business and technical landscape that affects your product.

• Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 9 years and a Master’s degree; or 7 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • B.S. in Computer Science or a similar technical degree. 
  • 8+ years of relevant work experience and 3+ years of software engineering experience. 
  • You have both breadth and depth of experience developing developer-oriented software products. 
  • You are comfortable working in a UNIX terminal and using Git, a common build tool such as CMake, and basic development tools such as Docker. 
  • You are an expert communicator and collaborator with both technical and non-technical audiences. 
  • You are an expert at balancing technical vs business risks and turning engineering output into business outcomes. 
  • You are a relentless learner who can comfortably develop the specialized knowledge necessary to drive the roadmap of a highly technical product. 
  • You have deep customer empathy and are highly creative at crafting technical solutions to solve customer problems.

• Advanced degree in Computer Science or MBA 
  • Experience developing and shipping software for autonomous robots or autonomy software developers and testers 
  • Experience in highly technical customer facing roles 
  • Expertise with modern scalable software technologies and frameworks such as Docker, Kubernetes, microservice architectures, distributed systems, or cloud-based deployment.  
  • Experience with defense focused simulators such as NGTS, AFSIM, etc. 
  • Experience with unmanned air or maritime systems 
  • Experience in cybersecurity, especially for US defense or government customers

This role requires deep expertise in space operations, test and evaluation, and capability development to drive the success of advanced autonomy solutions for task and mission management of space assets, satellite command and control, and real-time operational decision support.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Space Operations Autonomy Solutions Product Manager is responsible for the strategic planning, development, deployment, and sustainment of autonomy solutions supporting space operations. This role requires deep expertise in space operations, test and evaluation, and capability development to drive the success of advanced autonomy solutions for task and mission management of space assets, satellite command and control, and real-time operational decision support.

lists.content:
• Product Strategy & Development:
  • Define and manage the product roadmap for space operations autonomy solutions, ensuring alignment with mission requirements and emerging threats.
  • Work with cross-functional teams, including autonomy engineering, systems engineering, and operations teams, to develop and refine autonomy solutions.
  • Ensure autonomy solutions are modular, scalable, and compliant with DoD and Space Force requirements.

  • Operations & Execution:
  • Oversee autonomy integration, validation, and testing within operationally relevant environments, including Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL), Software-in-the-Loop (SIL), and Live, Virtual, and Constructive (LVC) testbeds.
  • Lead the transition of autonomy solutions from development to operational deployment, ensuring seamless integration with existing space architectures.
  • Provide technical oversight and coordination for autonomy software releases, patches, and updates in collaboration with cybersecurity and mission assurance teams.

  • Space Operations Expertise:
  • Leverage prior experience in space operations to inform autonomy solution design decisions, ensuring systems meet operational needs.
  • Assess and incorporate lessons learned from exercises, operational deployments, and space system test events.
  • Support the development and execution of test plans to validate system performance and reliability under realistic conditions.

  • Stakeholder Engagement & Communication:
  • Serve as the primary interface between autonomy development teams, operators, program managers, business development, and senior leadership. 
  • Brief stakeholders, including government sponsors, on system capabilities, development status, and risk management strategies. 
  • Collaborate with acquisition and contracting teams to define system requirements and acquisition strategies.

  • Capability Development & Continuous Improvement:
  • Identify and implement emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence and machine learning, to enhance mission effectiveness. 
  • Support wargaming, modeling & simulation (M&S), and digital engineering initiatives to refine space autonomy operations capabilities.

• Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • 10+ years of experience in space operations, autonomy solutions development, test and evaluation, or capability development.
  • Experience with operational testing and space system validation processes in or supporting the Space Force.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Active TS with SCI eligibility clearance.

• Space Superiority Weapons Instructor Course (WIC) graduate
  • Space Warfighter Advanced Instructor Course (AIC) graduate
  • Familiarity with autonomy development methodologies (Agile, DevSecOps)
  • Familiarity with space systems architectures.
  • Proven experience managing complex programs within DoD or IC environments.

Job description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Production Supervisor to oversee V-BAT manufacturing operations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring efficient production workflows, maintaining quality standards, and driving continuous process improvement in a fast-paced, high-tech environment. This role requires strong leadership, technical expertise, and a deep understanding of aerospace manufacturing and defense industry requirements.

lists.content:
• Supervise daily production operations, ensuring adherence to schedules, safety regulations, and quality standards.
  • Lead and develop a team of technicians and assembly personnel, fostering a culture of accountability and innovation.
  • Implement and maintain lean manufacturing principles to optimize efficiency and reduce waste.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Collaborate with engineering, supply chain, and quality teams to resolve production challenges and ensure seamless execution of manufacturing plans.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace and defense industry standards, including AS9100, ITAR, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Maintain and enforce safety protocols to create a secure and compliant work environment.
  • Train and mentor production staff, promoting best practices and technical skill development.
  • Troubleshoot production issues, implement corrective actions, and provide technical support as needed.
  • Participate in new product introduction (NPI) activities, ensuring manufacturability and scalability of designs.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related field preferred. Equivalent experience will be considered.
  • 5+ years of experience in a production supervisory role in a medium to high rate production environment for complex assemblies/products.
  • Experience with lean manufacturing, Six Sigma, and continuous improvement methodologies.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions.
  • Strong communication and leadership abilities to manage cross-functional teams effectively.
  • Proficiency in ERP/MRP systems and production planning tools.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment while maintaining a focus on operational excellence.

• Experience working with aerospace composites, avionics, propulsion systems, or final aircraft integration.
  • Strong knowledge of aerospace manufacturing processes, assembly, and testing.
  • Familiarity with defense-related compliance requirements (e.g., ITAR, DFARS).
  • Certifications in Lean Six Sigma, PMP, or equivalent.
  • Experience in a rapidly scaling production environment.

Job Description:
We are currently seeking highly skilled Production Technicians to work on composite aircraft, avionics and all systems associated. This role is for a hands-on person with excellent interpersonal skills and experience in a quality-focused production environment. The ideal candidate will work with engineering drawings and detailed instructions to acquire the desired finish of each production component as well as assist with fabrication and assembly tasks.

lists.content:
• Support and perform assembly, testing and configuration of aircraft systems such as: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV), Avionics, Ground Control Stations (GCS), Ground Support Equipment (GSE), Ground Data Terminals (GDT), and electronics.
  • Assist in troubleshooting, component removal/replacement and testing and documentation while utilizing approved technical publications, maintenance standards and approved procedures.
  • Trim, Paint, and Bodywork UAV Components.
  • Assemble, Test, and Support engine ground runs and break-ins.
  • Modifications or repairs to composite components if needed.
  • Coordinate with and assist other team members to ensure on-time delivery of aircraft.
  • Interpret engineering drawings, diagrams as well as work instructions and manuals related to all part fabrication.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

• Minimally 6 months-1 year of relevant experience in a combination of Aircraft Production/Manufacturing including but not limited to Composite Layup, Avionics fabrication, Avionics Installation, Aircraft Final Assembly, Ground Support ETC.
  • Minimally 6 months-1 year of experience with Material Requirements Planning. (MRP)
  • Must have good interpersonal skills with the ability to interface cooperatively with departmental personnel and customers.

• Possess time management, organizational and communication skills.
  • Strong safety work ethic – recognizes the importance of properly handling hazardous materials, chemicals, tools, etc.
  • Computer skills; knowledgeable in MS software programs, and other relevant computer applications involving production.
  • Analytical and problem-solving approach with the continual pursuit of perfection.
  • Must be able to work in a continually changing environment with the ability to change direction quickly to support departmental needs.

Job Description:
We are seeking a Project Manager to lead our V-BAT unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) demonstrations in both domestic and international locations.

lists.content:
• Generate demonstration plans
  • Conduct demonstration event logistics planning
  • Coordinate with Business Development leads and customers 
  • Establish and maintain project action plans and risk metrics
  • Generate and maintain project schedules
  • Coordinate participation of personnel for demonstration events
  • Establish and lead a consistent cadence of well-organized, well-facilitated, and effective meetings, including driving all preparation and follow up activities
  • Manage project budgets
  • Manage and organize customer correspondence
  • Coordinate import/export regulatory compliance – ITAR and EAR
  • Facilitate fuel availability and procurement
  • Review, understand, and comply with proposals and contracts
  • Drive subcontractor performance as applicable
  • Report directly to Shield AI’s Senior Director of V-BAT Program Management

• 2+ years of Project Management experience, including managing schedules, budget, resources, events
  • Experience with scheduling tools such as Microsoft Project, Smartsheet
  • Significant experience and excellent skills with Microsoft Office suite
  • Excellent skills in leadership, time management, organization, team management
  • Theoretical and practical project management knowledge
  • Application of project management techniques and tools
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Willingness and ability to travel internationally and domestically as needed 
  • A demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standard and being kind to others

• Experience in the field of unmanned aerial vehicles 
  • Familiarity with aviation product delivery, maintenance, sustainment, and field support
  • Undergraduate degree in engineering or business
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification

Job Description: 
We are seeking a highly capable Propulsion Engineer II to join our multidisciplinary team that owns the full lifecycle of UAV propulsion systems—from system sizing and design to build, test, flight integration, and post-mission analysis. This role will focus on heavy-fuel two-stroke and jet-based propulsion platforms, supporting both developmental and operational programs.

You’ll work alongside technicians and fellow engineers to iterate rapidly on propulsion hardware, driving performance, reliability, and mission capability improvements. Candidates with experience supporting military propulsion systems, tactical aircraft, or high-performance aerospace platforms are especially encouraged to apply.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly capable Propulsion Engineer II to join our multidisciplinary team that owns the full lifecycle of UAV propulsion systems—from system sizing and design to build, test, flight integration, and post-mission analysis. This role will focus on heavy-fuel two-stroke and jet-based propulsion platforms, supporting both developmental and operational programs.

You’ll work alongside technicians and fellow engineers to iterate rapidly on propulsion hardware, driving performance, reliability, and mission capability improvements. Candidates with experience supporting military propulsion systems, tactical aircraft, or high-performance aerospace platforms are especially encouraged to apply.

lists.text: What you will do in this role:
lists.content:
• Design, modify, and integrate UAV propulsion systems, including both internal combustion and turbine-based architectures.
  • Lead or support system-level sizing, thermal/fluid analysis, and mechanical design of propulsion subsystems (fuel, cooling, airframe integration).
  • Own hardware through its lifecycle—from CAD and procurement through hands-on build, test execution, flight operations, and data review.
  • Analyze test and flight data to validate system performance and inform design iterations.
  • Collaborate with technicians to execute test plans and troubleshoot propulsion anomalies.
  • Maintain and generate documentation including engineering drawings, models, and procedures.

• Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related engineering discipline.
  • 2+ years of experience in propulsion system development or related engineering roles.
  • Experience owning hardware from design through test and flight.
  • Strong grasp of thermodynamics, combustion systems, and fluid mechanics.
  • Proficiency in Python for data analysis, automation, or modeling.
  • Hands-on experience with engine assembly, test environments, and hardware debugging.
  • U.S. Citizenship or ability to comply with ITAR requirements.

• Familiarity with REFPROP, GFSSP, or similar thermal/fluid modeling tools.
  • Experience supporting turbine engines for high-performance or tactical aerospace platforms, including UAVs or jet aircraft.
  • Exposure to high-temperature materials, thermal protection systems, or extreme thermal environments.
  • Working knowledge of engine instrumentation, sensors, and control logic.
  • M.S. or Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related engineering discipline.
  • Proficiency in Siemens NX for mechanical design and Teamcenter for PLM and BOM management.
  • Experience creating and interpreting detailed engineering drawings, specs, and CAD models.
  • Ability to operate effectively in a fast-paced, test-driven development environment.

Job Description: 
We are seeking a highly skilled Propulsion Technician to join our team, specializing in UAV propulsion systems. In this role, you will be responsible for the assembly, testing, troubleshooting, and maintenance of aerospace-grade engines in both test cell environments and pre/post-flight operations. Our team owns the engine from start to finish, requiring technicians with a high level of expertise, attention to detail, and a strong problem-solving mindset.

We are particularly looking for candidates with an A&P license, prior experience working with aircraft engines, and a background in aerospace companies or military aviation maintenance. If you are a self-starter, high-energy technician who thrives in a hands-on, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Propulsion Technician to join our team, specializing in UAV propulsion systems. In this role, you will be responsible for the assembly, testing, troubleshooting, and maintenance of aerospace-grade engines in both test cell environments and pre/post-flight operations. Our team owns the engine from start to finish, requiring technicians with a high level of expertise, attention to detail, and a strong problem-solving mindset.

We are particularly looking for candidates with an A&P license, prior experience working with aircraft engines, and a background in aerospace companies or military aviation maintenance. If you are a self-starter, high-energy technician who thrives in a hands-on, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

lists.content:
• Conduct engine assembly, disassembly, and integration for UAV propulsion systems.
  • Perform pre-flight and post-flight inspections, ensuring all propulsion systems meet operational standards.
  • Operate test cells for engine validation, tuning, and troubleshooting.
  • Diagnose and resolve mechanical, electrical, and performance issues related to propulsion systems.
  • Work closely with engineers and flight test teams to ensure system readiness.
  • Maintain detailed records of maintenance activities, inspections, and modifications.
  • Follow strict safety protocols and standard operating procedures in handling high-performance UAV propulsion systems.

• Minimum 3-5 years of experience working on aircraft engines (military or civilian).
  • Prior experience at an aerospace company or military aviation unit.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills with gas turbine, reciprocating, or hybrid propulsion systems.
  • Ability to interpret technical manuals, schematics, and engineering documents.
  • Comfortable working in high-energy, high-precision environments.
  • Strong safety mindset, with meticulous attention to detail.
  • U.S. Citizenship or ability to comply with ITAR requirements.

• Airframe & Powerplant (A&P) License.
  • Military background, particularly in jet propulsion, UAVs, or rotary-wing aircraft.
  • Experience with unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) propulsion.
  • Knowledge of fuel systems, ignition systems, and advanced propulsion technologies.
  • Hands-on experience with engine dynamometers, test cells, or ground support equipment.
  • FAA Powerplant or military equivalent engine qualifications.
  • Ability to work independently, taking ownership of full-cycle propulsion system maintenance.

    • This role is ideal for high-energy, motivated individuals who understand what it takes to do the job well while maintaining precision and safety. If you’re ready to bring your propulsion expertise to an advanced UAV program, apply now!

descriptionBody:
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Propulsion Technician to join our team, specializing in UAV propulsion systems. In this role, you will be responsible for the assembly, testing, troubleshooting, and maintenance of aerospace-grade engines in both test cell environments and pre/post-flight operations. Our team owns the engine from start to finish, requiring technicians with a high level of expertise, attention to detail, and a strong problem-solving mindset.

We are particularly looking for candidates with an A&P license, prior experience working with aircraft engines, and a background in aerospace companies or military aviation maintenance. If you are a self-starter, high-energy technician who thrives in a hands-on, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

Job Description:
The Prototype Technician is responsible for the precision assembly, inspection, and testing of complex early-design stage wire harnesses, PCBAs, and composite structures used in aircraft and aerospace systems. This role requires adherence to stringent quality standards, detailed technical specifications, and industry regulations (such as IPC/WHMA-A-620 and AS9100). The technician will contribute to building high-reliability products that meet the safety and performance requirements of aerospace applications.

Job Description:
The Prototype Technician is responsible for the precision assembly, inspection, and testing of complex early-design stage wire harnesses, PCBAs, and composite structures used in aircraft and aerospace systems. This role requires adherence to stringent quality standards, detailed technical specifications, and industry regulations (such as IPC/WHMA-A-620 and AS9100). The technician will contribute to building high-reliability products that meet the safety and performance requirements of aerospace applications.

lists.content:
• Wire Harness / PCBA Assembly, Inspection and Testing
  • Read and interpret aerospace schematics, technical drawings, and detailed work instructions.
  • Measure, cut, strip, crimp, and terminate wires and cables to precise tolerances using specialized tools and equipment.
  • Assemble wire harnesses, connectors, backshells, and shielding components per aerospace industry standards.
  • Route wires carefully to meet form board layouts, bend radii, and environmental specifications.
  • Perform board hardening and gel coating procedures
  • Coordinate with Avionics team members for the successful testing and provisioning of software on to Boards
    • Mechanical Assembly / Composite Airframe
  • Conduct engine assembly, disassembly, and integration for UAV propulsion systems.
  • Perform composite assembly work including basic layup procedures, bonding, vacuum bagging, running cure cycles, etc.
  • Diagnose and resolve mechanical, electrical, and performance issues
  • Work closely with engineers and flight test teams to ensure system readiness.
    • Quality and Compliance
  • Perform visual inspections, continuity testing, and high-voltage insulation resistance testing to verify conformance to aerospace standards.
  • Ensure all work adheres to IPC/WHMA-A-620 Class 3, AS9100, and other aerospace quality requirements.
  • Identify and repair defects, ensuring zero tolerance for errors that could impact safety or reliability.
  • Maintain traceability of all components, wires, and work performed
    • Documentation and Reporting
  • Accurately complete production records, test logs, and quality assurance reports.
  • Maintain detailed documentation for traceability and compliance with aerospace industry standards.
    • Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
  • Work closely with engineers, quality control, and production teams to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
  • Provide feedback for process improvements and ensure compliance with lean manufacturing principles.
    • Adherence to Safety Protocols
  • Follow all safety regulations, including ESD (Electrostatic Discharge) prevention, PPE requirements, and cleanroom protocols where applicable.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace in line with aerospace safety standards.

• Technical Skills:
  • Strong proficiency in reading and interpreting aerospace schematics, blueprints, and work instructions.
  • Experience in wire harness assembly, including crimping, soldering, and connector assembly.
  • Experience handling and working with PCBAs
  • Composite assembly skills including basic layup procedures, bonding, vacuum bagging, running cure cycles, etc.
  • Engine assembly, disassembly, and integration
  • Familiarity with aerospace-specific components such as MIL-SPEC connectors, backshells, braiding, and shielding.
  • Experience with quality standards like IPC/WHMA-A-620 Class 3, AS9100, and MIL-STD requirements.
    • Attention to Detail and Precision:
  • Ability to work with tight tolerances and ensure 100% quality in all wire harness assemblies.
  • Strong problem-solving skills for identifying and addressing manufacturing defects.
    • Certifications:
  • IPC/WHMA-A-620 Certification required or willingness to obtain.
  • Certification in soldering to J-STD-001 standards preferred.
    • Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to work with small components, perform repetitive tasks, and sit or stand for extended periods.
  • Good manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination.
    • Education and Experience:
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of experience in wire harness assembly, preferably in aerospace, aviation, or defense industries.

Job Description
Are you a seasoned quality engineer with a passion for making a tangible impact both within your organization and on a global scale? Intrigued by cutting-edge technology and products? Keen on collaborating with mission-oriented colleagues who prioritize excellence and shared values? Shield AI is precisely where you belong!

lists.content:
• Own the overall quality management of a V-BAT aircraft module, overseeing New Product Introduction (NPI), Supplier Quality, and Product Quality processes.
  • Serve as the systems expert for Shield AI’s Quality Management System (QMS), ensuring effective execution through mastery of processes, documentation, and data management. Drive continuous improvement by defining, updating, and streamlining essential quality documentation and activities.
  • Collaborate closely with design and manufacturing teams to support the design development process. Provide expertise in quality assurance, process optimization, risk assessment and management, and strategies for verification, validation, and capability qualification. Identify and integrate industry standards to ensure the successful delivery of the V-BAT aircraft.
  • Develop and evaluate inspection and testing methods, tools, and equipment to uphold product integrity. Conduct assessments to determine accountability and cost implications for products, materials, or processes that deviate from established standards and specifications.
  • Review and refine quality systems to identify gaps, implement corrective actions, and ensure consistent adherence to reliable standards. Maintain comprehensive documentation to meet regulatory and operational requirements.
  • Manage non-conformance processes, including providing material review dispositions.
  • Lead Root Cause Analysis (RCA) investigations to identify underlying issues, implement effective corrective actions, and prevent recurrence.

• Degree in a field of STEM (B.S. level or equivalent).
  • 3-5+ years of experience in Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) and Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)
  • 3-5+ years of developing PFMEA, Control Plans and/or Inspection Plans
  • 3-5+ years of experience in supporting and working with Quality Management System (QMS).
  • 3-5+ years of experience in interpreting engineering drawings, blueprints, schematics, and specifications.

• Electrical: IPC-610 (Acceptability of Electronic Assemblies), IPC-620 (Requirements and Acceptance for Cable and Wire Harness Assemblies)
  • Industrial Experience: Aerospace sector, Defense sector, Automotive sector
  • Techniques & Methodologies: Lean Manufacturing, Kaizen (Continuous Improvement), Six Sigma, Statistical Process Control (SPC), Gage Repeatability & Reproducibility (Gage R&R).
  • Regulatory & Standards: Experience in a regulated environment such as AS9100 and ISO9001
  • Miscellaneous: Supplier Quality Management and Assurance, Process improvements and Experience or interest in model aviation or unmanned crafts.

Job Description:
The Quality Engineering Inspector is responsible for monitoring and ensuring conformance with production processes and inspecting incoming product to ensure that quality standards are met. The Quality Inspector is a critical role in the manufacture of reliable, world-changing Unmanned Aerial Vehicles.

lists.content:
• Ensure the assembly documentation is accurate and complete.
  • Observe assembly, lay-up, and torque operations.
  • Conduct dimensional inspections on both parts and assemblies.
  • Examine raw materials, piece-parts, and final assemblies.
  • Produce First Article Inspections (FAI) in accordance with AS9102.
  • Interpret specifications, drawings, tolerances, and additional requirements.
  • Document inspection and test results through logs, graphs, reports, and local systems.
  • Uphold maintenance of test and measurement equipment as well as calibration systems.
  • Assess customer returns and implement necessary internal corrective actions.
  • Execute other tasks related to the position as directed by leadership.

• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Quality Assurance, or a related field is preferred.
  • Certification from a recognized quality institution like ASQ (American Society for Quality) is advantageous.
  • Certification in AS9100 or similar quality management standards in aerospace is a plus.
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a Quality Inspector role within aerospace manufacturing or a related industry.
  • Experience in First Article Inspection (FAI) and familiarity with AS9102 standards.
  • Practical experience with various inspection techniques and equipment (CMM, calipers, micrometers, etc.).
  • Exposure to Lean Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement methodologies.

descriptionPlain:
As a Quality Manager, you will establish and maintain quality assurance processes to ensure products meet industry standards and customer expectations. This includes developing quality control procedures, conducting regular audits, and implementing corrective actions for non-conformities. You will also train staff on quality standards and work with other departments to integrate quality into all aspects of the manufacturing process. In addition, you will be responsible for hiring and training a dedicated quality team to uphold these standards

Note: this role may involve substantial international travel.
description:
As a Quality Manager, you will establish and maintain quality assurance processes to ensure products meet industry standards and customer expectations. This includes developing quality control procedures, conducting regular audits, and implementing corrective actions for non-conformities. You will also train staff on quality standards and work with other departments to integrate quality into all aspects of the manufacturing process. In addition, you will be responsible for hiring and training a dedicated quality team to uphold these standards

Note: this role may involve substantial international travel.

lists.content:
• Develop and implement quality assurance strategies and processes to meet industry standards.
  • Conduct regular audits and inspections, and manage corrective actions for quality issues.
  • Train staff on quality control procedures and integrate quality into all manufacturing aspects.
  • Monitor and analyze quality performance metrics and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Hire, train, and lead a dedicated quality assurance team.
  • Assist in setting up manufacturing facilities internationally

• Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 8 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 5 years experience; or equivalent experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Quality Management, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in quality assurance, preferably in a manufacturing setting.
  • Extensive knowledge of quality control processes, standards, and regulations (e.g., ISO AS9100).
  • Strong analytical skills and proficiency in quality management software.
  • Excellent training and team leadership capabilities.

• Master’s degree in Quality Management, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) or Certified Quality Manager (CQM).
  • Experience with Lean, Six Sigma, or other process improvement methodologies.

lists.content:
• Supervise and coordinate the activities of inspectors and technicians within the Quality department.
  • Ensure compliance with aerospace quality standards, including ISO 9001 and AS9100, and any other relevant certifications.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain quality inspection protocols and procedures.
  • Analyze and resolve work problems or assist technicians in solving quality issues.
  • Monitor and review inspection and test data, identifying trends, and initiating corrective action as necessary.
  • Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency, productivity, and quality.
  • Provide training, guidance, and support to quality team members, promoting a culture of quality and excellence.
  • Collaborate with manufacturing, engineering, and other departments to ensure quality products are delivered on time.
  • Maintain clear communication with senior management and provide reports on quality activities and performance metrics.
  • Perform internal audits, facilitate third-party audits, and ensure audit findings are addressed and corrected in a timely manner.
  • Participate in the development and review of specifications for products or processes.

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or related field.
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in aerospace manufacturing, with at least  years in a supervisory or managerial role.
  • In-depth understanding of aerospace quality standards and regulations.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.

• Certification in quality assurance (CQA) or quality engineering (CQE) is preferred.
  • Proficient in the use of quality tools and software, including statistical analysis, process mapping, and root cause analysis.

Job Description:
Are you a passionate, innovative, experienced Electrical Engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI hardware products? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you! 
 
Shield AI is seeking a passionate and experienced RF Antenna Engineer to develop cutting-edge AI-driven hardware. In this high-impact role, you'll design and integrate conformal antenna and radomes  for the next-generation autonomous aircraft.  Your role will play a pivotal part in ensuring the reliable and resilient performance of RF systems onboard the aircraft.

Job Description:
Are you a passionate, innovative, experienced Electrical Engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI hardware products? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you! 
 
Shield AI is seeking a passionate and experienced RF Antenna Engineer to develop cutting-edge AI-driven hardware. In this high-impact role, you'll design and integrate conformal antenna and radomes  for the next-generation autonomous aircraft.  Your role will play a pivotal part in ensuring the reliable and resilient performance of RF systems onboard the aircraft.

lists.content:
• Lead radome and antenna design and requirement development efforts for RADAR and EW-resilient data links. 
  • Collaborate with antenna and radome suppliers to ensure high-reliability and effective solutions. 
  • Work with interdisciplinary engineering teams including structural, flight science and EW systems.  
  • Analyze simulation or test data to verify performance to requirements. 
  • Execute link budget analysis for airborne platforms, accounting for range, atmospheric effects, and interference. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or an equivalent field.  
  • Experience in antenna and radome design, placement, and co-site integration for large airborne systems. 
  • Expertise in antenna range testing and RF system performance verification. 
  • Proficiency in link budget analysis and validation. 
  • Hands-on design experience using CST or HFSS. 
  • Strong background in propagation modeling and validation for end-to-end RF data link systems. 
  • Proficiency in using RF test and measurement equipment.

descriptionPlain:
About Shield AI     

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company focused on protecting service members and civilians with intelligent systems. Its flagship autonomy software, Hivemind, powers aircraft, drones, and other platforms, enabling complex missions with high reliability in contested environments. With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., and internationally, Shield AI’s products actively support U.S. and allied operations worldwide.

We are seeking an Senior Autonomy Flight Software Integration and Test Engineer to support customer engagements by integrating, testing, and demonstrating Hivemind on a variety of UAV platforms. This role blends hands-on software engineering, flight operations, and direct customer interaction, making it an exciting opportunity for engineers who thrive in fast-paced environments.
description:
About Shield AI     

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company focused on protecting service members and civilians with intelligent systems. Its flagship autonomy software, Hivemind, powers aircraft, drones, and other platforms, enabling complex missions with high reliability in contested environments. With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., and internationally, Shield AI’s products actively support U.S. and allied operations worldwide.

We are seeking an Senior Autonomy Flight Software Integration and Test Engineer to support customer engagements by integrating, testing, and demonstrating Hivemind on a variety of UAV platforms. This role blends hands-on software engineering, flight operations, and direct customer interaction, making it an exciting opportunity for engineers who thrive in fast-paced environments.

lists.content:
• Support live customer demonstrations of Hivemind autonomy by setting up and operating software on UAVs in field environments.
  • Develop, test, and debug software components for flight operations, ensuring seamless integration of Hivemind SDK onto customer platforms.
  • Conduct flight testing of UAV autonomy, logging results, debugging issues, and providing feedback to the autonomy development team
  • Work cross-functionally with engineering, product, and customer success teams to refine software configurations and optimize mission performance.
  • Analyze and document flight test results, providing actionable insights to improve autonomy, controls, and user experience.
  • Collaborate directly with customers, pilots, and engineers to tailor UAV behavior and troubleshoot technical challenges.
  • Contribute to automation tools for telemetry collection, flight data analysis, and debugging.

• B.S in Computer Science, AI, Robotics, Aerospace Engineering or similar.
  • 5+ years of experience in software development with strong proficiency in C++.
  • Experience working with UAV flight software, autonomy, or robotics systems.
  • Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills, particularly in real-time field environments.
  • Familiarity with flight controllers (PX4, ArduPilot, or similar) and UAV integration workflows.
  • Experience conducting field tests and live demonstrations with autonomous systems.
  • Ability to travel domestically and internationally (30%).
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work directly with customers in high-stakes environments.

• Hands-on experience with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) or software-in-the-loop (SIL) simulation for UAV testing.
  • Prior experience in DoD programs, military UAV operations, or aerospace/defense testing.
  • Experience working with MAVLink, RTPS, or DDS-based communication protocols.
  • FAA Part 107 certification or experience operating UAVs in field environments.

Job Description: 
Shield AI is looking for a Cloud Engineer to support its leadership in applied artificial intelligence development. In this role, you will be responsible for engineering, deploying, provisioning, and managing critical cloud systems that drive innovation across Shield AI’s public and private cloud environments, both domestically and internationally. As part of the Cloud and Infrastructure team within Enterprise Operations, you will play a key role in ensuring the performance, scalability, and reliability of these systems to support various business units. This position may involve occasional travel to Shield AI locations.

Job Description:
Shield AI is looking for a Cloud Engineer to support its leadership in applied artificial intelligence development. In this role, you will be responsible for engineering, deploying, provisioning, and managing critical cloud systems that drive innovation across Shield AI’s public and private cloud environments, both domestically and internationally. As part of the Cloud and Infrastructure team within Enterprise Operations, you will play a key role in ensuring the performance, scalability, and reliability of these systems to support various business units. This position may involve occasional travel to Shield AI locations.

lists.content:
• Engineering:
  • Oversee the day-to-day management and optimization of cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure, AWS).
  • Support and optimize cloud and virtual machine environments, assisting with capacity planning, performance monitoring, security compliance, and vulnerability remediation.
  • Assist in implementing and maintaining infrastructure systems, including servers, storage, backup solutions, and disaster recovery processes, for both public and private clouds.
  • Demonstrate a willingness to learn and work with familiar or unfamiliar operating systems and workloads with the desire to leverage automation tasks for repeatable tasks.
  • Author and produce the necessary documentation for engineered and maintained systems along with associated processes which supporting teams can leverage.
  • Assist in researching, recommending, and developing innovative solutions for complex requirements and issue resolution.
  • Participate in Agile methodologies and sound engineering principles.

  • Operations and Support:
  • Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs.
  • Support system maintenance and upgrades, including OS patching, software configuration, hardware updates, and performance tuning to ensure optimal cloud infrastructure performance.
  • Provide escalated support for operational issues possibly during and after normal business hours for systems, workloads, and Kubernetes AI infrastructure.
  • Analyze, troubleshoot and resolve system infrastructure and software issues.
  • Possess the capacity to participate in on-call, emergency, or maintenance roles.

• Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, or at least 4 years of experience plus an engineer level certification, Azure/AWS Associate, or another similar level certification.
  • 4 years’ experience supporting applications and systems in a production environment, preferably for a software and/or manufacturing development company.
  • Comfortable with operational efficiencies utilizing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience in automating repetitive tasks using scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or Bash.
  • Experience with deployment and systems administration of at least one type of Linux distribution (i.e. RHEL, Ubuntu)
  • Experience with concepts of Microsoft Windows Server administration, Azure and Active Directory environments
  • Ability to work independently to accomplish assigned tasks.
  • Possesses organizational skills, with a process-oriented mindset, attention to detail, and effective verbal and written communication abilities.
  • Solution-oriented, constructive approach to problem-solving.
  • Local to San Diego, CA, Dallas, TX and Washington D.C.

• Proven engineering experience with deploying and maintaining workloads in Azure public cloud
  • Fundamental understanding of at least one type of virtualization platform for private cloud (i.e. VMware, Hyper-V, KVM, etc.).
  • Experience in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering, or cloud infrastructure roles. 
  • Familiarity with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet. 
  • Experience building robust monitoring and alerting systems for mission-critical applications. 
  • Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines and possesses the ability to optimize.

The PMO Lead will oversee a team of Program Managers (PM) and Technical Program Managers (TPM), ensuring the successful execution of large-scale efforts and rapid prototypes. This role is responsible for ensuring each program is strictly managing program budget, schedule, and scope and delivering results in accordance with Shield AI and customer expectations. The PMO Lead will coordinate closely with engineering leadership across Engineering, Capture team, Product Development, and external stakeholders to ensure teams are resourced and objectives are clear. The PMO Lead will also support international partners and external organizations in establishing their own solutions engineering capacity.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The PMO Lead will oversee a team of Program Managers (PM) and Technical Program Managers (TPM), ensuring the successful execution of large-scale efforts and rapid prototypes. This role is responsible for ensuring each program is strictly managing program budget, schedule, and scope and delivering results in accordance with Shield AI and customer expectations. The PMO Lead will coordinate closely with engineering leadership across Engineering, Capture team, Product Development, and external stakeholders to ensure teams are resourced and objectives are clear. The PMO Lead will also support international partners and external organizations in establishing their own solutions engineering capacity.

lists.content:
• Program Leadership and Drive Execution: Lead and Drive execution of large-scale, complex programs and rapid prototypes from initiation through delivery, ensuring alignment with customer expectations, budget, schedule, and scope. 
  • Budget, Schedule, and Scope Management: Maintain overall responsibility for program budgets, schedules, and scope, ensuring that all projects stay within financial and time constraints. Monitor and control program expenses, track progress against schedules, and ensure that scope is managed through change control processes to avoid scope creep. 
  • Collaboration with Engineering Leadership: Partner closely with engineering leaders to ensure each program is resourced appropriately with the right technical expertise, tools, and capacity. Coordinate with engineering teams to balance program needs with engineering capabilities and resource availability, ensuring smooth execution without compromising quality or timelines. 
  • Collaboration with Capture and Product Development: Work with the capture team to ensure alignment between program execution strategies and new business opportunities. Collaborate with product development teams to ensure program execution reflects technical requirements and the product roadmap while staying within budget and time constraints. 
  • Support for Global Solutions Engineering Initiatives: Play a key role in helping other countries or companies set up their own solutions engineering organizations, offering guidance on program management, budgeting, resourcing, and operational readiness. Assist international partners in customizing solutions engineering frameworks to meet their specific financial, operational, and cultural requirements. 
  • Process Improvement and Standardization: Standardize PMO processes for budgeting, scheduling, scope management, and resource allocation to ensure consistent program delivery across all efforts. Drive continuous improvement initiatives, focusing on enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of project tracking, financial reporting, and program management practices. 
  • Team Leadership and Mentorship: Lead and mentor a team of traditional and technical program managers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, financial accountability, and cross-team partnership. Provide coaching to develop team members' abilities to manage program budgets, schedules, scopes, and resource needs effectively. 
  • Performance Reporting and Metrics: Establish and maintain program performance metrics related to budget, schedule, scope, and resourcing. Ensure consistent tracking and reporting to senior leadership on financial performance, timeline adherence, and scope management. Ensure that program managers have the tools and processes to effectively track financial performance, resource utilization, and project status.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field, with 12+ years of relevant experience. 
  • 5+ years of experience leading a PMO in a fast-paced, technology-driven organization. 
  • Proven track record of leading and facilitating cross-functional teams to successfully bring products to market. 
  • Self-starter with a history of forging clarity and structure in the face of ambiguous or dynamic constraints. 
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to quickly synthesize disparate viewpoints to deliver well-informed, data-driven decisions. 
  • Relentless learner capable of developing specialized knowledge in niche domains. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  • Eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. Secret clearance.

descriptionBody: The PMO Lead will oversee a team of Program Managers (PM) and Technical Program Managers (TPM), ensuring the successful execution of large-scale efforts and rapid prototypes. This role is responsible for ensuring each program is strictly managing program budget, schedule, and scope and delivering results in accordance with Shield AI and customer expectations. The PMO Lead will coordinate closely with engineering leadership across Engineering, Capture team, Product Development, and external stakeholders to ensure teams are resourced and objectives are clear. The PMO Lead will also support international partners and external organizations in establishing their own solutions engineering capacity.

Job Description:

Do you want to work alongside mission-driven and values-focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you! Job Description:
Are you a passionate and innovative Electrical Engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI products? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission-driven and values-focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you! Join us and help define elegant, high-performance computing, sensing, communication, and power systems to support our aircrafts.

lists.content:
• Lead circuit board and avionics subsystem designs for our next generation autonomous aircraft and its support equipment. This includes complex system architectures utilizing custom circuitry (power management, analog, digital, servos, microcontrollers, FPGAs, SoMs, sensors, radios, etc.) 
  • Support the design and integration of complex embedded systems and sensors which enable aircraft autonomy and AI 
  • Be responsible for part selection, schematic capture, simulation, analysis, verification, debugging, and release to production 
  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams (mechanical, embedded, software, manufacturing, supply chain, etc.) 
  • Manage your project timelines and deliverables 
  • Conduct and attend cross-functional design reviews 
  • Work closely with CAD engineering for PCB layout (Altium) 
  • Interface with customers, contractors, and other 3rd parties as it pertains to design execution of our products 
  • Provide feedback on other team work where applicable 
  • Mentor teammates when possible 
  • Help develop automated test solutions 
  • Proactively identify opportunities for improvement within hardware development projects, demonstrating initiative to propose and implement innovative solutions that enhance efficiency, quality, and overall project success and aircraft reliability 
  • Other duties as assigned

• Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering; or equivalent work experience
  • Have contributed to a product design involving EE, ME, and SW engineering. 
  • You are experienced with circuit design, schematic capture, component selection, and circuit testing. 
  • Demonstrated track record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others. 
  • Demonstrated track record of assuming ownership over development processes and features and delivering outstanding outcomes  
  • Proven track record of successfully shipping products, showcasing the ability to navigate through development cycles, overcome obstacles, and deliver high-quality solutions to meet project deadlines and exceed client expectations in a fast-paced environment   
  • Proactively identify opportunities for improvement within hardware development projects, demonstrating initiative to propose and implement innovative solutions that enhance efficiency, quality, and overall project success and aircraft reliability

• Experience working on cutting-edge autonomous robotic systems  
  • Experience designing high reliability avionics subsystems compliant with military standards for avionics (MIL-STD 810, MIL-STD 461, etc.) 
  • Active DoD Security Clearance or ability to obtain 
  • Proven background in thriving within fast-paced environments, particularly within startup or R&D settings 
  • Demonstrated adaptability, agility, and the ability to innovate under pressure to meet dynamic project demands and drive successful outcomes.

An autonomy engineer on the Hivemind Systems Emerging Applications team will be responsible for developing new Hivemind SDK capabilities and applying them to emerging platforms and solutions. Our goal is act as a customer surrogate, develop transformative capabilities in the SDK, and provide “defect-free“product releases to ensure that internal and external customers are able to rapidly build upon Hivemind.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

An autonomy engineer on the Hivemind Systems Emerging Applications team will be responsible for developing new Hivemind SDK capabilities and applying them to emerging platforms and solutions. Our goal is act as a customer surrogate, develop transformative capabilities in the SDK, and provide “defect-free“product releases to ensure that internal and external customers are able to rapidly build upon Hivemind.

lists.content:
• Leverage Shield AI’s autonomy software development kit to develop innovative solutions for runtime assurance and autonomy across emerging platforms. 
  • Integrate autonomy software on hardware platforms 
  • Develop specialized capabilities for emerging platforms that incorporate platform specific sensors, effectors, and motion models 
  • Package and deploy code for a variety ofcomputer architectures 
  • Develop simulation in the loop, hardware in the loop, and vehicle in the loop tests 
  • Create tools that assist in certifying code for flight readiness. 
  • Improve the SDK by identify gaps and working with Product Management to design solutions 
  • Work with the autonomy teams to resolve issues that might require more in-depth solutions.

• Typically requires a minimum of 7 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years and a Master’s degree; or 4 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Deep experience with C++14 and beyond 
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with Docker
  • Experience with git or other modern version control systems (e.g. mercurial) 
  • Experience working in large, complex, distributed systems 
  • You have a demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others. 
  • You have a willingness to jump out of your comfort zone to help out other teammates as needed. 
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.

• Experience with C++17 or greater
  • Experience with hands-on debugging of complex software and autonomy systems on real world platforms 
  • Experience with Image Acquisition and Processing, Embedded Platforms, or Run-Time Assurance 
  • Familiarity with CUDA, streaming video, hardware integration, networking, communications  
  • Experience with writing sensor drivers
  • Experience with robotics frameworks, such as ROS, and simulators (e.g.AirSim)
  • Understanding about a wide range of autonomy products

This position is ideal for a C++ generalist who thrives on tackling complex challenges in systems and systems integration. If you enjoy working on impactful projects and solving problems collaboratively within a dynamic team, this role is for you. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to innovative solutions, integrating third-party systems and advancing cutting-edge technologies.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). This position is ideal for a C++ generalist who thrives on tackling complex challenges in systems and systems integration. If you enjoy working on impactful projects and solving problems collaboratively within a dynamic team, this role is for you. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to innovative solutions, integrating third-party systems and advancing cutting-edge technologies.

lists.content:
• Develop and maintain high-performance C++ software for various projects. 
  • Contribute to system architecture and design, ensuring robust and scalable solutions. 
  • Integrate third-party software and hardware systems into broader architectures. 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables. 
  • Apply modern agile software development practices, including continuous integration and test-driven development. 
  • Debug, optimize, and deploy real-time processing systems. 
  • Embrace opportunities to learn and adopt new technologies.

• Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering,
  • Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience
  • Ability to develop, benchmark, debug, and deploy software-based algorithms
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills by applying a scientific approach
  • 3+ years of industry experience
  • Experience working projects with 10+ contributors
  • Offers Fast, efficient, effective problem-solving approaches
  • Exceptional collaborator and communicator
  • Comfortability within Unix environments
  • Hard-working, trustworthy teammate
  • Exhibits holding themselves and others to high standards
  • Being kind to others
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET clearance

• Real-time and distributed simulation experience
  • Familiarity with Python
  • Knowledge of third-party system integration (software and hardware)
  • Experience with DOD simulations such as AFSIM and NGTS, especially with C++ plugin development 
  • Experience with web-service technologies like gRPC, REST APIs, message queues (ActiveMQ, ZeroMQ), etc
  • Familiarity with C++ tooling like CMake and Conan
  • Experience with UCI and OMS Standards
  • Active SECRET clearance

• A collaborative and adaptable mindset. 
  • Strong communication and organizational skills. 
  • Commitment to delivering high-quality solutions efficiently. 
  • A desire to work in a supportive, team-oriented environment. 

    • This role is for those ready to take ownership of their projects and deliver impactful results while growing within an agile and innovative environment.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 

At Shield AI, we are revolutionizing defense technology to protect service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Our Hardware Test Engineering team plays a critical role in ensuring the V-BAT remains the most reliable, mission-ready UAV in the industry. We design cutting-edge test solutions—custom-built electrical and mechanical systems that push our hardware to its limits in real-world and extreme environments.

As a Senior Electrical Engineer on our Hardware Test team, you will own the design and development of test systems that push our hardware to its limits. From designing custom PCBs and automated test sequences to developing electrical and mechanical test stands, you’ll be at the forefront of ensuring the highest reliability in aerospace hardware. This is a high-impact role where your expertise in power electronics, RF, communications, and automation will help shape the future of intelligent defense systems.

Job Description:

At Shield AI, we are revolutionizing defense technology to protect service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Our Hardware Test Engineering team plays a critical role in ensuring the V-BAT remains the most reliable, mission-ready UAV in the industry. We design cutting-edge test solutions—custom-built electrical and mechanical systems that push our hardware to its limits in real-world and extreme environments.

As a Senior Electrical Engineer on our Hardware Test team, you will own the design and development of test systems that push our hardware to its limits. From designing custom PCBs and automated test sequences to developing electrical and mechanical test stands, you’ll be at the forefront of ensuring the highest reliability in aerospace hardware. This is a high-impact role where your expertise in power electronics, RF, communications, and automation will help shape the future of intelligent defense systems.

lists.content:
• Lead the design, validation, and deployment of advanced test systems for V-BAT’s critical components and subsystems.
  • Architect PCBs and test interfaces for power electronics, RF, and communication systems.
  • Develop automated test sequences in Python, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and repeatability.
  • Design and integrate custom test fixtures, including relays, PLCs, PCBAs, and harnessing.
  • Own and drive cross-functional design reviews, advocating for design-for-testability (DFT) improvements.
  • Work hands-on with HASS, ESS, and HALT testing, validating performance in simulated harsh environments.
  • Be a technical mentor, guiding junior engineers and contributing to Shield AI’s growing expertise in hardware test engineering.
  • Other duties as assigned.

• B.S. in Electrical Engineering or related STEM field.
  • 3+ years of industry experience in hardware design and test engineering (or equivalent experience with advanced degrees).
  • Deep expertise in electrical design, mechanical, and software engineering principles as applied to hardware test systems.
  • Proven ability to design, implement, and validate multidisciplinary hardware systems in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment.
  • Track record of ownership—driving projects from concept to execution, delivering exceptional results.
  • A team-first mindset, with high standards for yourself and others, and a passion for solving complex technical challenges. 
  • Track record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Proficiency in Python or another scripting language for test automation.
  • Hands-on experience with PCB design tools (Altium, KiCAD, Eagle) and CAD software (SolidWorks, NX, CATIA).
  • Experience working in rugged, high-reliability industries like aerospace, defense, or automotive.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to pivot quickly in dynamic, evolving environments.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


This position is perfect for an individual who loves technology, solving complex challenges, wants to develop software for multiple projects, and write code with a motivated, diverse team. Shield AI is pushing the envelope by applying advanced AI solutions to real hardware systems. An ideal candidate should aspire to be a part of this industry-changing team developing and deploying advanced technology that can truly make an impact. 

Shield AI is looking to continue to push the envelope by teaming traditional autonomous systems algorithms and deep reinforcement learning-based solutions to create an unmatched capability and speed to deployment technology base.
