Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

This position is perfect for an individual who loves technology, solving complex challenges, wants to develop software for multiple projects, and write code with a motivated, diverse team. Shield AI is pushing the envelope by applying advanced AI solutions to real hardware systems. An ideal candidate should aspire to be a part of this industry-changing team developing and deploying advanced technology that can truly make an impact. 

Shield AI is looking to continue to push the envelope by teaming traditional autonomous systems algorithms and deep reinforcement learning-based solutions to create an unmatched capability and speed to deployment technology base.

lists.content:
• As a Software Engineer on this team, you will contribute to teams at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls.
  • You will work closely with talented engineers to architect solutions, set standards for software engineering, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.
  • Write Python and C++ software to help develop tooling and automated testing and analysis for autonomy solutions.
  • Work with Subject Matter Experts to understand the customer demand and implement software solutions that meet their needs.
  • Collaborate with Systems and Test engineers to develop fully tested, integrated solutions.

• BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Ability to obtain an active SECRET clearance
  • Ability to develop, benchmark, debug, and deploy software-based algorithms.
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills by applying a scientific approach.
  • Experience with Python, C++, and/or similar languages.
  • Experience working on projects with 10+ contributors.
  • Offers fast, efficient, effective problem-solving approaches.
  • Exceptional collaborator and communicator.
  • Comfort within Linux environments.
  • Hard-working, trustworthy teammate.
  • Exhibits holding themselves and others to high standards.
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery & test-driven development.
  • Strong knowledge of modern software engineering best practices.
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, strong communication skills, being a trustworthy teammate, and being kind to others.
  • Strong organizational skills.

• Experience with Docker or similar containerization technologies.
  • Experience with modern infrastructure technologies (Kubernetes, CI/CD).
  • Experience with web-service technologies like gRPC, REST APIs, message queues (ActiveMQ, ZeroMQ), etc.
  • Experience with Python data analysis tooling like Pandas, NumPy, Dagster, etc.
  • Familiarity with C++ tooling like CMake and Conan.
  • Experience with Reinforcement Learning and other Machine Learning techniques.
  • Understanding of robotics technologies related to autonomous behavior development e.g. task allocation or planning.
  • Understanding/Experience with unmanned system technologies and accompanying algorithms (specifically air domain).
  • Experience with UCI and OMS Standards.

description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Software Applications Engineer will provide technical expertise and support to customers during the implementation and use of Shield AI enterprise software products. This role involves working closely with customers to understand their requirements and ensuring successful product integration for AI & Autonomy development.

lists.content:
• Become an expert user of the Hivemind enterprise software stack. 
  • Provide technical support and training to customers. 
  • Develop AI & Autonomy applications using the Shield AI enterprise software development kit.
  • Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities, e.g., demos. 
  • Assist in post-sales deployment and integration of Shield AI enterprise software products. 
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and training materials. 
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. 
  • Help customers debug software/API integration issues. 
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to address customer feedback and improve products. 
  • Visit customers on site globally to support software integration and development activities.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. 
  • 3+ years of experience of industry experience
  • 2+ years of experience in an integration/applications engineering role 
  • 2+ years of experience working in a startup environment. 
  • Strong technical background in software engineering. 
  • Strong proficiency in writing modern C++ code. 
  • Intermediate proficiency in writing Python code. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Experience in the defense aviation or robotics industry. 
  • Experience building and running a small enterprise software applications/solutions engineering team.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


The Software Applications Engineer will provide technical expertise and support to customers during the implementation and use of Shield AI enterprise software products. This role involves working closely with customers to understand their requirements and ensuring successful product integration for AI & Autonomy development.

lists.content:
• Become an expert user of the Hivemind enterprise software stack. 
  • Provide technical support and training to customers. 
  • Develop AI & Autonomy applications using the Shield AI enterprise software development kit.
  • Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities, e.g., demos. 
  • Assist in post-sales deployment and integration of Shield AI enterprise software products. 
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and training materials. 
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. 
  • Help customers debug software/API integration issues. 
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to address customer feedback and improve products. 
  • Visit customers on site globally to support software integration and development activities.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. 
  • 3+ years of experience of industry experience
  • 2+ years of experience in an integration/applications engineering role 
  • 2+ years of experience working in a startup environment. 
  • Strong technical background in software engineering. 
  • Strong proficiency in writing modern C++ code. 
  • Intermediate proficiency in writing Python code. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Experience in the defense aviation or robotics industry. 
  • Experience building and running a small enterprise software applications/solutions engineering team.

description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Join Shield AI’s EdgeOS team as a Software Quality Engineer and become part of a talented group shaping the future of robotics and autonomy. The EdgeOS team is a core component of the Hivemind team, responsible for developing Shield AI’s critical robotics ecosystem. This platform integrates with various teams to enable cutting-edge autonomy solutions.

lists.content:
• Develop and assist with the design of automation framework and tests to scalably and reliably validate EdgeOS quality. 
  • Address quality needs focused on API coverage, SW integration and Hardware-in-Loop integration. 
  • Address common software code quality issues across EdgeOS as well as software built by peer Hivemind teams. 
  • Assist with creation of frameworks and tooling available for customers so they can leverage and rapidly retest with their own add-on software. 
  • Interface with peer integration and test teams to implement complementary tools, tests, share and best-practices.  
  • Other duties as assigned

• Typically requires a minimum of 4 years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree in CS, Comp Eng, Robotics, or a related field; or 2 years and a master’s degree; or 1 year with a PhD.  
  • Proficiency in software quality best practices, automation, programming in C++, Python. 
  • Experience with embedded systems.  
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions.  
  • Strong communication skills, capable of collaborating effectively across various teams and presenting to customers or technical leadership.

• Experience with C++14, C++17, JSON, DSL.  
  • Experience with ROS.  
  • Proficiency with simulation tools and hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing environments. 
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines. 
  • Familiarity with networking, operating-systems, and radio communications.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft?  Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world?  Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!   

The Hivemind Solutions Test department is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.  

As a Hivemind Solutions Software Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be at the epicenter of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on 3rd Party  Platforms. You will be ensuring our software meets high quality benchmarks, while planning and executing the integration and testing of SW and HW systems throughout the Software Development Life Cycle, preparing them for simulation demonstrations and on-ground and in-flight test campaigns. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast paced, with lots of planning, documentation, communication, coordination, manual testing, scripted testing, test reviews, debugging, and system verification. Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events, leadership growth opportunities at a fast-paced scaling tech company and your contributions will play a key role in developing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, historic aviation firsts and fulfilling our mission to protect service members and civilians the world over!

lists.content:
• Ensure Shield AI Hivemind on X software meets high quality benchmarks, requirements, and industry standards before release.
  • Improve software development processes to minimize defects and accelerate the development cycle. 
  • Create, maintain and present test documentation, including test plans, test results and post flight-test analysis reports. 
  • Work with cross-functional teams to test and integrate software and hardware systems preparing for flight simulation and real flight test milestones. 
  • Run and review tests at a regular cadence to validate software stability, triage issues, report bugs, mitigate and identify flight readiness risks. 
  • Support on-site a test ranges during flight test campaigns that includes system configuration, running Hivemind on X software, and flight data post-analysis.  
  • Create test team reporting methods (such as dashboards) to provide high-level results visibility, metrics, performance and quality trends. 
  • Write Python scripts to test Hivemind on X software and hardware systems (with software emphasis).

• Typically requires a minimum of 1-2 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; or 0 years and a Master’s degree; or 0 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience. 
  • Proficiency in Python and Bash scripting. 
  • The ability to obtain an ACTIVE security clearance 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional software, hardware and mechanical engineering teams. 
  • Strong technical writing skills.  
  • Experience in robotics, aerospace, and/or related hands-on engineering projects. 
  • Experience in test engineering, or similar test generation, test planning, test execution and/or related systems engineering experience. 
  • Strong planning, analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills.  
  • Passionate about intelligent aircraft systems.  
  • Adaptability and a willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies quickly in a fast-paced environment.

• Software Quality Assurance experience. 
  • Experience in the aerospace or defense industries, working with complex systems and adhering to stringent standards and regulations. 
  • Experience running software test or flight test campaigns.  
  • Software management tools (Git, AzureDevOps/Jira, Artifactory).  
  • Experience writing, maintaining and delivering complex technical documentation. 
  • Experience championing, testing and executing, a capability or project throughout the Software Development Life Cycle to delivery.

Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast paced, with lots of planning, documentation, communication, coordination, manual testing, scripted testing, test reviews, debugging, and system verification. Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events, leadership growth opportunities at a fast-paced scaling tech company and your contributions will play a key role in developing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, historic aviation firsts and fulfilling our mission to protect service members and civilians the world over!

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI and robotics products? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission-driven and values-focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!  

The Hivemind Test team is committed to building a complete and robust test infrastructure that supports the development and integration of the world’s best AI pilot. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software systems for autonomy behaviors, ground-control systems, multi-network communications, operating systems, embedded devices, test frameworks, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying that the entire Hivemind software ecosystem is operationally ready to meet mission objectives and reliability standards. This is achieved via a cross-functional team, with skills ranging from autonomy system engineering, robotics integration, software development, test engineering, and quality assurance.   

We are seeking an expert Software Test and Integration Engineer who is motivated to join us in our mission. Someone with experience designing and implementing innovative software solutions for automation testing and data analysis, who can become a Super User of our Hivemind product and extend test plans beyond expected uses to anticipate novel customer use cases and edge-case instances. You will play a critical role in the organization, collaborating with developers to identify and root cause bugs, integrate newly developed capabilities into the product framework, and define the best approaches to software API and autonomy test coverage.

We are seeking an expert Software Test and Integration Engineer who is motivated to join us in our mission. Someone with experience designing and implementing innovative software solutions for automation testing and data analysis, who can become a Super User of our Hivemind product and extend test plans beyond expected uses to anticipate novel customer use cases and edge-case instances. You will play a critical role in the organization, collaborating with developers to identify and root cause bugs, integrate newly developed capabilities into the product framework, and define the best approaches to software API and autonomy test coverage.

lists.content:
• Become a super-user of our state-of-the-art AI software product. Learn to automate multi-agent scenarios, analyze robotic data, and validate test cases. Try using the product as a customer would and try and break it! 
  • Test new features: Collaborate cross-functionally with developer teams to design test plans for new single and multi-robot autonomy algorithms, user interfaces, middleware, and server applications.  
  • Enable coverage testing of product capabilities: Design and implement tests to cover all performance aspects of a product capability across all permutations of operating environments and use cases. 
  • Design automation tooling & automate tests: Architect innovative automation frameworks that enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness. Automate tests to run on Software-in-the-Loop, Hardware-in-the-Loop, and Vehicle-in-the-Loop test fixtures. 
  • Integrate new capabilities: Work with other integration engineers to implement test solutions on prototype robotic hardware platforms.  
  • Optimize test efficiency: Determine the testing strategy (what tests, at what frequencies, etc.) for the overall product and work with DevOps/Ex teams to optimize testing design on CI.  
  • Evaluate test data and automate reporting: Create analyzer code for the automated analysis of test data. Review test data, identify and root cause bugs, report to developers, and create automated reporting tools for test performance and bug attributes.  
  • Check off requirements, help determine metrics: Work with product and system engineers to ensure test coverage of all product and engineering requirements. Assist in developing tooling to demonstrate full requirement coverage and reporting. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Proficiency in programming languages including Python or C++. 
  • Experience with autonomous systems or server applications or middleware. 
  • Demonstrated experience of designing, communicating, and managing test cases, and reporting bugs. 
  • Proficiency with simulation tools and hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) testing environments. 
  • Strong expertise with CI/CD pipelines.  
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. 
  • Excellent communication skills, capable of collaborating effectively across various teams and presenting to customers or technical leadership.

• Demonstrated experience building complex systems with a strong understanding of software architecture and design principles.  
  • Experience with hardware or embedded systems.  
  • Expert knowledge of Python. 
  • Experience with ROS.  
  • Experience with white box testing 
  • Familiarity with networking, operating-systems, and radio communications. 
  • Experience designing automated tooling for testing for GUI applications. 
  • Experience designing automated tooling for testing server applications.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!   

The Hivemind Solutions Test department (HMS Test) is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.  

As a Hivemind Solutions Systems Test Engineer, you will be at the epicenter of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on 3rd Party Platforms. You will be contributing to the planning and execution of the integration and testing of software and hardware systems throughout the Development Life Cycle, preparing them for simulation demonstrations and real-world flight tests. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast paced, with test planning, integration, testing, data analysis, debugging, and system verification. Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events and your contributions will play a key role in developing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, historic aviation firsts and fulfilling our mission to protect service members and civilians the world over!

lists.content:
• Work with multiple teams to integrate and test aircraft software and hardware systems preparing for simulation milestones and flight tests. 
  • Write Python code to test Hivemind + aircraft SW and HW systems (with SW emphasis). 
  • Create SW based tools to improve flight testing and expedite troubleshooting (in Python and/or C++). 
  • Hands-on debugging during flight simulation and in-flight test campaigns.  
  • Become a subject-matter-expert for running Hivemind tests on Hardware-In-The-Loop test systems. 
  • Contribute to software utilities and automated test suites. 
  • Contribute to and execute test plans to validate Hivemind SW and HW systems.  
  • Identify, analyze, and document software defects, issues, and inconsistencies in software behavior. 
  • Develop data analysis tools to visualize and report test results from large datasets. 
  • Support on-site flight testing that involves system configuration, running aircraft software, and data post-analysis. 
  • Drive continuous improvement in testing methodologies, tools, and processes

• Level 2 - Typically requires a minimum of 2-3 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 1 years and a Master’s degree; or 0 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience. 
  • Level 3 - Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience. 
  • Excellent Python skills (with C++ helpful). 
  • Passion for intelligent aircraft systems. 
  • Strong problem-solving, debugging and analytical skills. 
  • Experience in robotics, unmanned air systems, or related hands-on engineering projects. 
  • Adaptability, a bias towards action and a willingness to learn new technologies quickly in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional software, hardware and mechanical engineering teams.
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET Clearance. US citizenship is required as only US citizens are eligible for a security clearance.

• Aviation experience, such as Private Pilot’s License or Part 107c.
  • Proficiency in Python and C++. 
  • Software management tools (Git, AzureDevOps/Jira, Artifactory). 
  • Aerospace, defense or space industries experience, working with complex systems while adhering to stringent standards and regulations. 
  • Active SECRET clearance

Job Description: 
Are you a passionate and innovative flight test engineer with deep hands-on experience in aircraft system-level testing? Are you looking to apply your expertise to cutting-edge AI and robotics technologies with real-world impact? At Shield AI, we’re building the future of autonomous flight—and we’re looking for a mission-driven, technically excellent Senior Flight Test Engineer to help lead the way.

As a Senior Flight Test Engineer, you will own the integration, test planning, and flight verification processes for our vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) UAVs, with a focus on mission capability, system performance, and flightworthiness. You’ll operate at the center of fast-paced product development and R&D efforts, collaborating cross-functionally to ensure our systems are rigorously tested, iterated on quickly, and delivered with excellence.

With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Job Description:
Are you a passionate and innovative flight test engineer with deep hands-on experience in aircraft system-level testing? Are you looking to apply your expertise to cutting-edge AI and robotics technologies with real-world impact? At Shield AI, we’re building the future of autonomous flight—and we’re looking for a mission-driven, technically excellent Senior Flight Test Engineer to help lead the way.

As a Senior Flight Test Engineer, you will own the integration, test planning, and flight verification processes for our vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) UAVs, with a focus on mission capability, system performance, and flightworthiness. You’ll operate at the center of fast-paced product development and R&D efforts, collaborating cross-functionally to ensure our systems are rigorously tested, iterated on quickly, and delivered with excellence.

lists.content:
• Lead the end-to-end planning, execution, and post-analysis of complex ground and flight test campaigns for the V-BAT unmanned aircraft system.
  • Serve as a flight test conductor during operations, leading pre-flight briefings, flight readiness reviews, and debriefs to ensure mission clarity and team alignment.
  • Guide hardware and software troubleshooting and modifications based on real-time data and test results.
  • Mentor junior engineers and operators in test design, execution, and flight safety practices.
  • Perform risk assessments and develop test hazard analyses (THAs) and mitigation strategies to ensure safety of flight and compliance with test standards.
  • Develop and maintain detailed test plans, test cards, and post-test reports to support iterative development and system validation.
  • Collaborate closely with avionics, software, and mechanical teams to drive resolution of issues and validation of requirements.
  • Identify and implement improvements to the flight test process, infrastructure, and toolchain to improve speed, safety, and reliability of testing.

• B.S. in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of direct, hands-on experience in UAV or aircraft flight testing.
  • Demonstrated ownership of major flight test efforts, including campaign planning, flight execution, and technical reporting.
  • Strong understanding of aircraft systems, flight controls, telemetry, instrumentation, and test safety.
  • Proven experience in cross-functional collaboration and leading test events in high-stakes environments.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with experience delivering technical debriefs, reports, and risk assessments.
  • Track record of thriving in fast-paced, iterative development environments.
  • Comfortable working onsite in dynamic, hands-on testing environments (airfield, hangar, etc.).

• Proficiency in MATLAB and/or Python for data analysis and scripting.
  • Experience building or prototyping small aircraft, UAVs, or RC systems.
  • Familiarity with FAA Part 107 operations or flight safety protocols.
  • Hands-on design experience (mechanical or electrical subsystems).
  • Background in startup or advanced R&D flight test programs.

descriptionBody:
Job Description:
Are you a passionate and innovative flight test engineer with deep hands-on experience in aircraft system-level testing? Are you looking to apply your expertise to cutting-edge AI and robotics technologies with real-world impact? At Shield AI, we’re building the future of autonomous flight—and we’re looking for a mission-driven, technically excellent Senior Flight Test Engineer to help lead the way.

As a Senior Flight Test Engineer, you will own the integration, test planning, and flight verification processes for our vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) UAVs, with a focus on mission capability, system performance, and flightworthiness. You’ll operate at the center of fast-paced product development and R&D efforts, collaborating cross-functionally to ensure our systems are rigorously tested, iterated on quickly, and delivered with excellence.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!   

The Hivemind Solutions Test department (HMS Test) is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.  

As a Hivemind HIL Integration Engineer, you will be at the epicenter of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on various aircraft platforms. You will be helping us build Hardware-In-The-Loop infrastructure to execute the integration and testing of SW and HW systems throughout simulation and on-ground test campaigns. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast paced, depending on high-fidelity simulation hardware to ensure high-quality flight software releases. Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events and your contributions will play a key role in developing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, historic aviation firsts and fulfilling our mission to protect service members and civilians the world over!

Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft? Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world? Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!   

The Hivemind Solutions Test department (HMS Test) is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.  

As a Hivemind HIL Integration Engineer, you will be at the epicenter of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on various aircraft platforms. You will be helping us build Hardware-In-The-Loop infrastructure to execute the integration and testing of SW and HW systems throughout simulation and on-ground test campaigns. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast paced, depending on high-fidelity simulation hardware to ensure high-quality flight software releases. Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events and your contributions will play a key role in developing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, historic aviation firsts and fulfilling our mission to protect service members and civilians the world over!

lists.content:
• Design, build and maintain Hivemind Hardware-in-the-loop infrastructure including mechanical design, electrical integration and building fixtures with lab technicians. 
  • Lead sensor integration into Hivemind targeted platforms. 
  • Create software support utilities and automated test tools for Hardware-In-The-Loop test fixtures and simulated flight testing (Python and/or C++). 
  • Hands-on testing, integration and debugging during on-ground and in-flight test campaigns. 
  • Work with Hivemind engineering to test and integrate software and hardware systems preparing for simulation milestones and flight tests. 
  • Become a subject-matter-expert for running Hivemind tests on our Hardware-In-The-Loop and Vehicle-In-The-Loop systems. 
  • Run simulated flight tests to validate Hivemind + aircraft subsystems. 
  • Support on-site flight testing that involves system configuration, running aircraft software, and data post-analysis. 
  • Contribute to and execute test plans to validate Hivemind SW and HW systems.  
  • Drive continuous improvement in testing methodologies, tools and rapid prototyping.

• Level 3 - Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience. 
  • Hands-on mechanical and electrical engineering skills. 
  • Proficiency in Python (or C++). 
  • Experience in robotics, small UAS, or related hands-on engineering projects. 
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills .  
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional software, hardware and mechanical engineering teams.  
  • Adaptability and a willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies quickly in a fast-paced environment with a bias towards action. 
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET Clearance. US citizenship is required as only US citizens are eligible for a security clearance.

• Exposure to CAD software (i.e.. SolidWorks). 
  • Experience rapid prototyping, building and/or flying small aircraft, such as quadrotor drones, robotics or similar. 
  • FIRST Robotics experience. 
  • Experience in the robotics, aerospace, space or defense industries, working with complex systems and adhering to stringent standards and regulations. 
  • Experience working with software management tools (Git, AzureDevOps/Jira, Artifactory) helpful. 
  • Active SECRET clearance

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
Shield AI’s mission is to protect the lives of service members and civilians with intelligent systems. The Hardware Test Engineering team contributes to this effort by designing test solutions that drive high hardware reliability on all our vehicles: Both V-BAT and our next-generation aircraft. These solutions are in-house designed electrical and mechanical equipment used to perform component and system-level testing, both at ambient and in simulated harsh environmental conditions. 

In this role, you will serve as the architect for jet engine propulsion testing for our next-generation aircraft. You will lay out test plans and then design the test systems to conduct those tests. This individual will also be responsible for trading off purchasing test equipment off-the-shelf or designing it in-house. Help us save lives as we strive to deliver the most highly reliable aerospace hardware in the industry.

Job Description:
Shield AI’s mission is to protect the lives of service members and civilians with intelligent systems. The Hardware Test Engineering team contributes to this effort by designing test solutions that drive high hardware reliability on all our vehicles: Both V-BAT and our next-generation aircraft. These solutions are in-house designed electrical and mechanical equipment used to perform component and system-level testing, both at ambient and in simulated harsh environmental conditions.

In this role, you will serve as the architect for jet engine propulsion testing for our next-generation aircraft. You will lay out test plans and then design the test systems to conduct those tests. This individual will also be responsible for trading off purchasing test equipment off-the-shelf or designing it in-house. Help us save lives as we strive to deliver the most highly reliable aerospace hardware in the industry.

lists.content:
• Prioritize safety above all else. You will work with our EHS team to ensure that all propulsion testing activities are being conducted in a safe manner.
  • Own requirements gathering, design, and validation of multiple test stands used to test jet engines on our next-generation aircraft.
  • Work with electrical, software, and mechanical engineers to design test stands, test fixtures, instrumentation and telemetry systems, etc…
  • Specify facilities requirements (electrical, plumbing, etc…) needed for the propulsion test stands.
  • Contribute to and attend cross-functional design reviews. Advocate for design changes that result in simpler testing processes. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or related STEM field.  
  • 6+ years' experience designing test stands for jet engines.
  • Mastery of fundamental engineering concepts, including Mech E, EE, Programming, Physics, and Mathematics.  
  • Experience with CAD tools such as SolidWorks, NX, CATIA, etc. (NX preferred). 
  • Familiarity with designing mechanical tooling or test fixtures. 
  • Experience working on multidisciplinary hardware development projects, which can be from an internship, job, club, team, personal project, etc.
  • Demonstrated history of showing ownership of project outcomes and delivering exceptional results.  
  • Record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Ability to rapidly manufacture your designs in a machine shop.  
  • Experience with scripting languages, such as Python.
  • Demonstrated adaptability, agility, and the ability to innovate under pressure to meet dynamic project demands and drive successful outcomes.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


This position is perfect for an individual who enjoys solving the most complex problems across a portfolio of diverse domains and modalities. An ideal candidate is expected to apply classical autonomous techniques, algorithms, and theory to various platforms in multiple tactical scenarios. These solutions are expected to be integrated into real-world problems with near-term program impacts and rewards. In this role, you will manage a technical team supporting the development, testing, and analysis of autonomy algorithms for advanced aerospace, defense, and robotic systems. 

Shield AI is looking to continue to push the envelope by teaming traditional autonomous systems algorithms and deep reinforcement learning-based solutions to create an unmatched capability and speed to deployment technology base.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

This position is perfect for an individual who enjoys solving the most complex problems across a portfolio of diverse domains and modalities. An ideal candidate is expected to apply classical autonomous techniques, algorithms, and theory to various platforms in multiple tactical scenarios. These solutions are expected to be integrated into real-world problems with near-term program impacts and rewards. In this role, you will manage a technical team supporting the development, testing, and analysis of autonomy algorithms for advanced aerospace, defense, and robotic systems. 

Shield AI is looking to continue to push the envelope by teaming traditional autonomous systems algorithms and deep reinforcement learning-based solutions to create an unmatched capability and speed to deployment technology base.

lists.content:
• Multidisciplinary Team Leadership: Lead teams across autonomy, integration, and testing by aligning technical efforts, resolving cross-functional challenges, and driving mission-focused execution. Balance hands-on technical oversight with performance optimization, innovation, and clear stakeholder communication.
  • Autonomy Development: As an Autonomy Engineer on this team, you will lead teams at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls. Write autonomous behaviors for varying aircraft platforms (i.e., VTOL and Fixed Wing)
  • Collaboration: You will work closely with talented engineers to architect solutions, set standards for software engineering, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers. Work with Subject Matter Experts to understand customer needs and implement appropriate autonomy solutions
  • System Integration: Integrate Shield AI autonomy products together with third party systems

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Robotics, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience developing and integrating autonomy algorithms in robotics, aerospace, or defense systems.
  • 2+ years managing technical teams.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as C++ and Python, and familiarity with real-time operating systems (RTOS).
  • Significant background in robotics technologies related to sensing, estimation, path planning, and data fusion. 
  • Significant experience with unmanned system technologies and accompanying algorithms (specifically air domain) 
  • Experience with simulation tools and environments (e.g., AFSIM, NGTS) for testing and validation.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and optimize system performance.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multidisciplinary environment.
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET clearance.

• Mathematical background in both linear/nonlinear control theory and autonomous systems technologies/algorithms
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills by applying a scientific approach
  • Ability to understand, derive, and implement motion models and accompanying controllers for trajectory generation and tracking.
  • Experience with UCI and OMS Standards
  • Active SECRET clearance

Shield AI is looking to continue to push the envelope by teaming traditional autonomous systems algorithms and deep reinforcement learning-based solutions to create an unmatched capability and speed to deployment technology base.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


We are seeking a skilled and motivated Autonomy Integration Engineer with 10+ years of experience to manage a technical team supporting the development, integration, and testing of autonomy algorithms for advanced aerospace, defense, and robotics systems. In this role, you will contribute to implementing and integrating innovative autonomy solutions while collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of engineers to meet challenging operational requirements.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to apply your technical expertise in autonomy and system integration while growing your skills in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. You will work on cutting-edge projects that advance the capabilities of autonomous systems and ensure their seamless integration into real-world platforms.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Autonomy Integration Engineer with 10+ years of experience to manage a technical team supporting the development, integration, and testing of autonomy algorithms for advanced aerospace, defense, and robotics systems. In this role, you will contribute to implementing and integrating innovative autonomy solutions while collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of engineers to meet challenging operational requirements.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to apply your technical expertise in autonomy and system integration while growing your skills in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. You will work on cutting-edge projects that advance the capabilities of autonomous systems and ensure their seamless integration into real-world platforms.

lists.content:
• Multidisciplinary Team Leadership: Lead teams across autonomy, integration, and testing by aligning technical efforts, resolving cross-functional challenges, and driving mission-focused execution. Balance hands-on technical oversight with performance optimization, innovation, and clear stakeholder communication.
  • Autonomy Development: Assist in developing autonomy algorithms for path planning, decision-making, perception, and control to meet system performance and mission requirements.
  • System Integration: Support the integration of autonomy algorithms with platform hardware and software, including sensors, control systems, and communication interfaces.
  • Validation and Testing: Conduct simulation-based testing (HIL/SIL) and participate in live system tests to validate autonomy functionality and identify areas for improvement.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with software developers, systems engineers, and testing teams to ensure alignment of autonomy capabilities with overall system architecture and mission goals.
  • Optimization and Troubleshooting: Debug and optimize autonomy systems to enhance performance, reliability, and adaptability.
  • Documentation and Reporting: Contribute to technical documentation, test reports, and presentations for stakeholders and team members.
  • Innovation and Learning: Stay current on emerging trends and technologies in robotics, autonomy, and AI to incorporate best practices into development efforts.

• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Robotics, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience developing and integrating autonomy algorithms in robotics, aerospace, or defense systems.
  • 2+ years managing technical teams.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as C++ and Python, and familiarity with real-time operating systems (RTOS).
  • Knowledge of sensor integration, sensor fusion, and middleware frameworks (e.g., ROS, DDS).
  • Experience with simulation tools and environments (e.g., AFSIM, NGTS) for testing and validation.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and optimize system performance.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multidisciplinary environment.
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET clearance.

• Familiarity with open architecture standards (e.g., OMS/UCI or FACE) and regulatory standards (e.g., DO-178C)
  • Active SECRET Clearance.

This individual will hire and manage a team of high-performing sales engineers who engage with customers alongside our business development team to demonstrate, position, and technically integrate Hivemind into next-generation unmanned systems. description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Shield AI is seeking a Senior Sales Engineering Manager to lead and scale our technical pre-sales function for Hivemind Enterprise. This individual will hire and manage a team of high-performing sales engineers who engage with customers alongside our business development team to demonstrate, position, and technically integrate Hivemind into next-generation unmanned systems. You’ll serve as the technical bridge between our customer needs and product capabilities, ensuring rapid adoption and faster sales cycles.

lists.content:
• Lead, mentor, and grow a global team of sales engineers supporting Hivemind adoption across defense and commercial customers.
  • Own and scale the technical pre-sales process, including demos, technical discovery, architecture design, and customer immersion programs.
  • Act as the primary technical point of contact for the sales team and customers during deal capture, providing expertise on the technical aspects of our solutions V
  • Build and maintain strong customer relationships by addressing technical concerns and managing expectations throughout the sales process. 
  • Collaborate with BD to identify customer needs and deliver technical presentations, support customer engagements as technical leads, provide engineering depth for BD Ops efforts in proposals, white papers, and RFIs. 
  • Work with engineering and product management to tailor existing solutions to customer requirements, ensuring technical feasibility and alignment with product capabilities, schedule, and roadmap.  
  • Assess and clear feasibility for opportunities outside the existing product roadmaps. Coordinate with engineering, product management, and project management to ensure new project technical scope and requirements are clearly defined and achievable, integrating them into the development process. 
  • Create and maintain technical documentation repository, ensuring materials are accurate, releasable, and accessible for the BD teams. Specific items that will be maintained: Presentations, Specifications, Roadmaps, Capability Briefs, Talk Scripts / FAQs etc.
  • Educate the sales team on technical aspects of our solutions, developing materials and conducting training sessions to keep the team informed.
  • Manage resourcing of sales engineers across business development deal capture efforts.
  • Support international go-to-market efforts by training and embedding sales engineers into major and micro hub regions.
  • Travel to customer sites globally for technical interchange meetings.
  • Monitor industry trends and competitor products to provide insights and maintain a competitive edge.

• 10+ years of experience in a Sales Engineering or Solutions Engineering role
  • 5+ years of professional experience in building and managing sales or solutions engineering teams.
  • Strong understanding of mobile robotics, autonomy, and AI/ML.
  • Strong familiarity with C++ and Python.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, especially in customer-facing settings.
  • Willingness to travel to customer sites globally for immersive engagements.

• Experience supporting UAS, UGV, or maritime autonomy systems.
  • Ability to speak or manage engagements in multilingual regions (Asia, Middle East, Europe).
  • Proven success navigating pre-sales in complex, high-stakes defense environments.
  • Prior experience with defense, aerospace, or dual-use technologies strongly preferred.

Shield AI is seeking a Tax Senior Manager to join our Finance team. As Shield AI expands globally, this role offers a rare opportunity to shape the tax function at a high-growth, mission-driven tech company. This role will be critical in ensuring compliance with global tax laws and developing forward-thinking tax strategies aligned with our innovation and international growth. This role will report to the Controller and work closely with internal stakeholders and external advisors to guide business decisions, manage compliance, and optimize tax operations globally.

lists.content:
• Lead and execute all aspects of global tax strategy, planning, and compliance. 
  • Oversee preparation and submission of tax filings (income tax, sales & use tax, VAT, payroll tax, property tax). 
  • Ensure accurate global tax provision (ASC 740) and reporting. 
  • Support international operations, managing cross-border tax planning and compliance. 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to advise on tax implications of business transactions and expansion plans. 
  • Research complex tax issues, summarize the implications for management, and prepare technical tax memorandums and documentation. 
  • Oversee transfer pricing arrangements and intercompany tax issues. 
  • Manage relationships with external tax consultants and advisors. 
  • Foster a culture of compliance and tax awareness across departments.

• Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in Accounting or Tax. 
  • Strong knowledge of U.S. federal and state income tax, indirect taxes, and international tax principles. 
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities independently in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Knowledge of global transfer pricing, VAT, and M&A tax strategies. 
  • Self-motivation with high standards of integrity, ethics, and accountability.

• JD, master’s degree in taxation, CPA, and/or LLM in Tax 
  • Experience in a software, defense technology or aerospace company.

Job Description:

At Shield AI, we are revolutionizing defense technology with AI-powered autonomous systems. As a Project Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of driving cutting-edge programs from concept to deployment, working alongside a world-class team of engineers, program managers, and technical leaders. This role is perfect for a detail-oriented, proactive engineer who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about AI-driven autonomy, complex system integration, and technical program execution.

lists.content:
• Lead the execution of cutting-edge UAV programs, ensuring technical, schedule, and budget objectives are met.
  • Act as the bridge between engineering, leadership, and stakeholders, ensuring seamless communication and alignment.
  • Transform complex technical challenges into clear, actionable solutions, supporting key decision-making and risk mitigation.
  • Support UAV system design and integration, collaborating with experts in hardware, software, and systems engineering.
  • Develop high-impact technical documentation, including risk assessments, reports, and executive-level updates.
  • Optimize schedules and resources, driving efficiency while identifying and resolving potential roadblocks.
  • Continuously refine and improve program execution, implementing process enhancements to accelerate innovation.

• B.S. in a STEM field (Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or related).
  • 5+ years of experience in engineering, project management, or technical program execution.
  • Strong organizational and communication skills, with experience interfacing across engineering, leadership, and external stakeholders.
  • Understanding of systems engineering principles, including mechanical, electrical, and software development.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret clearance.
  • Willingness to travel up to 25%.
  • Proven track record of excellence, teamwork, and high standards in execution.

• Active Secret security clearance.
  • Hands-on experience in manufacturing, flight testing, design engineering, or systems engineering.
  • Experience working on mission-critical DoD systems or within DoD acquisition programs.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Secret security clearance.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Are you passionate about designing secure, scalable, and innovative collaboration solutions? Do you thrive in environments where your technical expertise directly contributes to national security and cutting-edge AI development? At Shield AI, you’ll be part of a mission-driven team that’s revolutionizing how applied artificial intelligence supports critical operations. 
As a Senior SharePoint Engineer, you’ll be at the heart of building and optimizing our SharePoint environment within Azure Government. You’ll play a pivotal role in enhancing collaboration, streamlining workflows, and ensuring compliance with stringent DoD security standards. Your work will help empower teams across Shield AI to achieve operational excellence and create a safer, more secure world.

lists.content:
• Design, develop, and maintain secure SharePoint, Teams and Power BI solutions in Azure. 
  • Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions. 
  • Implement and optimize workflows using Power Automate, PowerApps, custom web parts, and system integrations. 
  • Ensure compliance with DoD security standards and best practices. 
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior engineers while maintaining system documentation and processes. 
  • Continuously improve the SharePoint environment by staying current with emerging technologies. 
  • Manage SharePoint helpdesk tickets.

• You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. 
  • You have at least 5 years of experience in SharePoint development and administration. 
  • You are proficient in Power Automate, PowerApps, PowerShell, and related tools. 
  • You are knowledgeable about DoD security standards and compliance requirements. 
  • You excel in problem-solving and have strong attention to detail. 
  • You can obtain and maintain a security clearance if required.

• Microsoft Teams administration.
  • Power BI administration.

The Developer Experience Team strives to improve the development experience by optimizing workflows and guidelines, developing internal tools, and providing technical support to our customer, the Hivemind engineers. We identify areas of improvement by analyzing support requests, conducting interviews, and gathering feedback through surveys. Using these insights, in the role of DevEx Engineer - Tools, you'll collaborate with engineers to design, build, monitor, and maintain solutions to optimize the velocity, productivity, and efficiency of our engineers, while positively impacting software quality. If Developer Experience is new to you, read this!

The Developer Experience Team strives to improve the development experience by optimizing workflows and guidelines, developing internal tools, and providing technical support to our customer, the Hivemind engineers. We identify areas of improvement by analyzing support requests, conducting interviews, and gathering feedback through surveys. Using these insights, in the role of DevEx Engineer - Tools, you'll collaborate with engineers to design, build, monitor, and maintain solutions to optimize the velocity, productivity, and efficiency of our engineers, while positively impacting software quality. If Developer Experience is new to you, read this!

lists.content:
• Own internal tooling for Hivemind
  • Support and maintain our internal CLI tool ensuring it meets needs and its ease-of-use for developers.
  • Enhancing the productivity and efficiency of internal developers by creating, monitoring, and maintaining developer tools and workflows ensuring high reliability and performance.
  • Provide developers with technical support and help triage issues relating to tools the DevEx team supports.
  • Work closely with other team members and internal customers to understand and identify their needs to provide value.
  • Work with the rest of the DevEx team to support tool reusability between the inner and outer dev loop.
  • Help with the creation and interpretation of Developer Experience metrics & signals to identify and prioritize change.
  • Other DevEx duties as assigned.

• BS in computer science or related engineering field with 5+ years of professional experience.
  • Experience with a compiled programming language (e.g. C, C++, Rust, Go) in a production environment.
  • Strong knowledge of scripting in Bash and Python.
  • Strong experience with Linux.
  • Familiarity with containers (e.g. Docker, Podman, etc.).
  • Strong desire to learn and grow on the job.

• Experience with Conan Package Manager (Conan 2 preferred)
  • Experience building production-ready developer tools from scratch 
  • Deep understanding of the C++ build ecosystem (CMake, make, vcpkg, Ninja)
  • Cloud experience with AWS/Azure

Join Shield AI’s Hivemind autonomy team, where we are pushing the boundaries of assured navigation and autonomous flight. As a Senior Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, integrating, testing, and deploying cutting-edge navigation and state estimation algorithms within our Hivemind SDK. We are seeking engineers with a strong foundation in state estimation theory and practical experience deploying robust, real-time solutions in commercial robotics, SLAM, or related autonomy applications.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Join Shield AI’s Hivemind autonomy team, where we are pushing the boundaries of assured navigation and autonomous flight. As a Senior Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, integrating, testing, and deploying cutting-edge navigation and state estimation algorithms within our Hivemind SDK. We are seeking engineers with a strong foundation in state estimation theory and practical experience deploying robust, real-time solutions in commercial robotics, SLAM, or related autonomy applications.

lists.content:
• Research and develop state-of-the-art state estimation and navigation algorithms to enable resilient autonomy in challenging GPS-denied environments. 
  • Design and deploy production-grade C++ software for embedded robotic systems operating in dynamic, real-world environments. 
  • Build and maintain rigorous unit, integration, and system-level tests to ensure system robustness and safety. 
  • Develop and enhance modeling, calibration, and simulation tools for inertial and vision-based navigation systems. 
  • Contribute to roadmap planning, feature decomposition, and agile execution alongside a multidisciplinary team of autonomy engineers. 
  • Continuously enhance performance analysis, benchmarking, and validation pipelines to drive rapid innovation and improvement.

• M.S. in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Computer Science or a related field;  Minimum 2+ years of related professional work experience if you have an M.S degree or 0 years if you have a new Ph.D graduate.
  • Professional proficiency in modern C++ (C++11 or newer) and strong object-oriented design skills. 
  • Hands-on experience deploying low-latency C++ applications to embedded Linux platforms. 
  • Professional experience designing and implementing state estimation algorithms (e.g., EKF, UKF, Graph-based optimization). 
  • Familiarity with VIO, SLAM, or multi-sensor fusion frameworks (e.g., gtsam, Ceres, OpenVINS). 
  • Strong working knowledge of CI pipelines and automated testing frameworks for C++. 
  • Ability to independently deploy high-reliability code suitable for real-world autonomous systems. 
  • Familiarity with prototyping in Python or MATLAB is welcome, but this role demands professional C++ production deployment skills. Candidates whose primary experience is in MATLAB or Python are unlikely to find this position a good fit.

• Deep understanding of graph-based optimization for state estimation. 
  • Experience developing vision-aided inertial navigation systems (VINS, VIO). 
  • Experience with navigation sensor calibration (IMU, GPS, barometers, magnetometers, laser altimeters). 
  • Experience in benchmarking and system validation for real-world navigation performance.
• Candidates will be asked to complete a practical C++ coding exercise as part of the interview process to demonstrate advanced proficiency in software design and system implementation.

Shield AI’s Hivemind autonomy team is building next-generation autonomy and navigation solutions for resilient, mission-critical systems. As a Senior Engineer, you will contribute directly to the design, development, integration, test, and deployment of the Hivemind navigation stack. description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Shield AI’s Hivemind autonomy team is building next-generation autonomy and navigation solutions for resilient, mission-critical systems. As a Senior Engineer, you will contribute directly to the design, development, integration, test, and deployment of the Hivemind navigation stack. We seek engineers with experience delivering robust navigation and state estimation solutions for defense aviation systems, ISR platforms, or other DoD-relevant applications, with strong expertise in C++ software development for embedded Linux systems.

lists.content:
• Research and develop advanced state estimation and navigation algorithms to ensure assured Position, Navigation, and Timing (PNT) in contested environments. 
  • Design, write, and deploy production-quality C++ software for aviation platforms requiring real-time, deterministic performance. 
  • Build and maintain comprehensive unit, integration, and system-level tests to validate navigation software performance under operational constraints. 
  • Develop modeling, calibration, and simulation tools for inertial and aided navigation technologies used in airborne platforms. 
  • Participate in agile-based product planning, feature definition, capacity estimation, and cross-team collaboration. 
  • Contribute to ongoing system performance evaluation, regression analysis, and V&V (Verification and Validation) efforts.

• Strong proficiency in modern C++ (C++11 or newer) and professional experience developing software for embedded Linux systems. 
  • Experience designing and deploying state estimation algorithms (e.g., EKF, UKF) in real-world defense or aerospace applications. 
  • Familiarity with developing for constrained environments requiring deterministic timing and high reliability. 
  • Professional experience with continuous integration (CI) workflows and automated C++ testing. 
  • Practical understanding of inertial navigation systems (INS), GNSS integration, and navigation error modeling. 
  • Ability to deploy and maintain robust, efficient, production-level C++ code. 
  • Familiarity with MATLAB or Python for prototyping is acceptable; however, primary development experience must be in C++.

• Experience developing and deploying assured PNT systems for DoD customers. 
  • Expertise calibrating and integrating IMUs, GPS receivers, magnetometers, and barometric sensors. 
  • Familiarity with alternative navigation techniques, such as celestial navigation, terrain-aided navigation, or vision-based navigation (VBN). 
  • Experience validating and verifying navigation systems in operational test environments.
• Candidates will be asked to complete a C++ coding exercise as part of the interview process to assess comfort with modern software design practices and system-level thinking.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


The VBAT Embedded Software team is a motivated group of engineers focused on developing complex avionics software that merges hardware, operating systems and applications for cutting-edge Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV). Embedded Software engineers work with customer programs, electrical engineers, Guidance, Navigation and Controls (GNC) engineers, systems engineers, test engineers and the Autonomy AI team to design and develop software systems which utilize modern aerospace sensors, state-of-the-art UAV avionics, and groundbreaking Artificial Intelligence applications.  

As a member of the VBAT Embedded Software team, you will develop and maintain software architectures, generate and maintain all levels of software requirements, document and present software designs, coordinate software development, and marshal the entire suite of VBAT software through test and verification, release, and deployment to production and customers.
