lists.content:
• Develop high-quality C++ code tailored specifically for V-Bat aircraft, ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and safety. 
  • Develop hardware drivers for controlling robotic vehicles in flight – including drivers for navigation systems, radar systems, and engine control. 
  • Implement cutting-edge software solutions for operating autonomous aircraft during GPS-denied flight and landing sequences 
  • Attend flight test events in the field, performing integration activities and live debugging on aircraft in-flight 
  • Design and implement systems for automated testing, including creating new CI/CD pipelines and creating tests for virtualized hardware and hardware-in-the-loop simulations. 
  • Prototype new hardware platforms to validate critical design concepts and assess technical limitations 
  • Integrate a real-time operating system onto custom System-On-a-Module (SOM)

• A minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree is required; or 2 years and a PhD. 
  • Bachelors in CS, CE, EE. 
  • Demonstrated track record of assuming ownership over development processes and features and delivering outstanding outcomes.   
  • Strong C/C++ background 
  • Experience in bare-metal firmware development for embedded systems 
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery & unit testing to assure software quality. 
  • Familiarity with common version control (git) and build systems (CMake, or similar) 
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, strong communication skills, being a trustworthy teammate, and being kind to others.

• 2+ years professional avionics software development experience 
  • Experience working on cutting-edge autonomous robotic systems   
  • Experience in Linux Kernel or RTOS development - device trees and bring up on new hardware 
  • Experience working on safety-critical applications in a regulated industry (civil aviation, automotive, etc.)

Shield AI is building a world-class autonomy stack for intelligent aircraft. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Perception team within our Hivemind Pilot organization, you will design, implement, and optimize image and video processing algorithms that empower autonomous systems to understand and operate in complex real-world environments.

description:

Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Shield AI is building a world-class autonomy stack for intelligent aircraft. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Perception team within our Hivemind Pilot organization, you will design, implement, and optimize image and video processing algorithms that empower autonomous systems to understand and operate in complex real-world environments. 

You’ll work closely with senior team members guiding the design of the computer vision pipeline, and you’ll contribute to the full software development lifecycle—from architecture and implementation to test and release.

lists.content:
• Develop and optimize C++ software modules for video and image processing, including components like: 
  • Denoising, cropping, filtering, feature extraction, and object classification 
  • Integration of open-source frameworks such as OpenCV and GStreamer 
  • Work closely with other computer vision experts to implement high-performance, modular computer vision pipelines 
  • Develop and enhance various testing modalities (e.g., digital simulation, software-in-the-loop, hardware-in-the-loop, and flight testing) to mature the perception software stack 
  • Contribute to real-time processing and deployment of EO/IR video streams on embedded hardware 
  • Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and test planning 
  • Deliver production-quality code used in safety-critical autonomy systems

• 3–5 years of experience in C++ software development, preferably in a Linux environment 
  • Familiarity with image and video processing techniques and tools 
  • Experience with at least one of: OpenCV, GStreamer, FFmpeg, or equivalent 
  • Solid understanding of software engineering best practices: version control, CI/CD, testing 
  • Growth mindset and ability to work under the mentorship of a more senior technical lead

• Experience with real-time video pipelines or embedded perception systems 
  • Experience deploying software and algorithms to military platforms 
  • Familiarity with EO/IR camera models and calibration 
  • Background in robotics, computer vision, or aerospace systems 
  • Contributions to open-source vision libraries

• At Shield AI, you will work on cutting-edge technology that pushes the boundaries of autonomous systems. This role offers the opportunity to lead the technical direction of a critical component in our perception stack while collaborating with a team of talented engineers and researchers. Your work will have a direct impact on enabling advanced robotics for defense and beyond.

The Planning and Controls (PAC) team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world.

As a member of PAC, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls. You will architect core systems, write high quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Planning and Controls (PAC) team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world.

As a member of PAC, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls. You will architect core systems, write high quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.

lists.content:
• Research, design, and implement state-of-the-art planning algorithms, taking ideas from conception to field deployment
  • Optimize the planning stack on the CPU and GPU
  • Develop core systems that must be portable and scalable across different UAS platforms and compute architectures
  • Work with our Hivemind Design Software team to design and build infrastructure for the PAC team that both supports local development and scales into the cloud
  • Work with soft or hard real-time operating systems
  • Work with robotics middleware such as ROS and PX4
  • Work on algorithms, including graph search, sampling-based planning, etc.
  • Work with and deploy our AI stack to edge devices
  • Work in collaboration with our DevOps teams to architect and maintain our cloud infrastructure, working with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes; assist with cross-platform builds and test orchestration, working with build tools (e.g. CMake, Bazel, etc.) and compiler tool chains (e.g. gcc, llvm, etc.)

• Design and implement Mission Planning interfaces or Multi-agent coordination for Tasks given to heterogeneous teams.
  • Port PAC libraries, where applicable, to CUDA kernels
  • Port PAC libraries to EdgeOS, a Shield AI Middleware framework, that enables portability of PAC libraries to multiple platforms and compute architectures
  • Design and implement an analysis and simulation framework that: enables testing of various components in isolation or in a fully integrated manner; supports parameter sweeps; supports hardware-in-the-loop

• Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Proficient with C++ 11, 14, or 17 in a production environment (e.g. support for both internal and external customers)
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery & test-driven development
  • Strong knowledge of modern software engineering best practices
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, strong communication skills, being a trustworthy teammate, and being kind to others
  • Familiarity with writing thread-safe multi-threaded programs
  • Familiarity with common debugging and profiling tools (e.g. gdb, valgrind, etc.)
  • Familiarity with git, bash, Python

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft?  Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world?  Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!    

The Hivemind Solutions Test department is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.   

As a Hivemind Software Test and Automation Engineer, you will be at the forefront of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on third-party platforms. Your role will involve developing automated test frameworks, executing tests, analyzing flight test results, and creating tools to accelerate the development cycle. You will collaborate closely with software, hardware, and systems flight engineers to validate complex systems, ensuring they meet our high quality and reliability standards. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast-paced, involving rapid testing, reviews, debugging, and system verification.  

Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events, leadership growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech company, and the knowledge that your contributions are advancing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, achieving historic aviation firsts, and protecting service members and civilians worldwide.

lists.content:
• Write Python (and/or C++) software to test complex Hivemind Autonomy software integrated with aircraft systems. 
  • Design and develop automated test frameworks to streamline the validation of Hivemind Autonomy solutions. 
  • Develop data analysis tools to visualize and report test results from large datasets. 
  • Create test team reporting dashboards to provide high-level visibility into results, performance metrics, and quality trends. 
  • Implement CI/CD automation for test execution. 
  • Integrate testing solutions with hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and software-in-the-loop (SIL) systems. 
  • Execute and integrate flight test simulations to validate Hivemind Autonomy and aircraft subsystems. 
  • Support the Quality Assurance and Infrastructure test teams by developing automation and data analysis tools. 
  • Improve software development processes through innovative solutions such as AI/ML, evolutionary algorithms, and automation to minimize defects and accelerate development. 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and systems flight teams to prepare for simulated and real-world flight test campaigns. 
  • Document test plans, test results, defects, workflows, and software tools to support development, certification, and test campaigns.

• Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; or 4 years and a Master’s degree; or 2 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience. 
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET Clearance
  • Strong experience with Python. 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional engineering teams. 
  • Experience in robotics, aerospace, defense and/or related hands-on engineering projects. 
  • Test engineering experience in test generation, planning, execution, or related systems engineering.
  • Strong problem-solving debugging and analytical skills.  
  • Passion for intelligent aircraft systems.  
  • Adaptability, a bias towards action and a willingness to learn new technologies quickly in a fast-paced environment.

• Active SECRET clearance
  • Proficiency with Python and C++. 
  • Experience analyzing large datasets (e.g. using Pandas, NumPy, or similar tools). 
  • Software Quality Assurance and test experience. 
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g. Azure DevOps). 
  • Experience leveraging AI / Machine Learning techniques in testing and software validation.  
  • Experience with software management tools (e.g.Git, AzureDevOps/Jira, Artifactory). 
  • Aerospace or defense industries experience, working with complex systems while adhering to stringent standards and regulations.

descriptionBody:
Are you a passionate and innovative engineer looking to help develop state-of-the-art AI aircraft?  Are you eager to make a positive difference in the world?  Do you want to work alongside mission driven and values focused teammates? Shield AI is just the place for you!    

The Hivemind Solutions Test department is a group on a mission to build comprehensive and robust testing infrastructure that supports the development and deployment of the world’s best AI pilot and most reliable aircraft. Hivemind Test is dedicated to ensuring the highest level of quality, reliability, and performance in our Hivemind software ecosystem. This ecosystem includes software for AI behaviors, embedded systems, system integration, and more. Our group is charged with validating and verifying our Hivemind software meets reliability standards and is operationally ready to meet mission objectives on aircraft, such as real world jets, Shield AI’s V-BAT and beyond.   

As a Hivemind Software Test and Automation Engineer, you will be at the forefront of integration and testing for deploying our Hivemind Software and AI Pilot on third-party platforms. Your role will involve developing automated test frameworks, executing tests, analyzing flight test results, and creating tools to accelerate the development cycle. You will collaborate closely with software, hardware, and systems flight engineers to validate complex systems, ensuring they meet our high quality and reliability standards. Our test campaigns are hands-on and fast-paced, involving rapid testing, reviews, debugging, and system verification.  

Your efforts will be rewarded with successful flight test events, leadership growth opportunities in a fast-scaling tech company, and the knowledge that your contributions are advancing an AI autopilot, enabling intelligent aircraft, achieving historic aviation firsts, and protecting service members and civilians worldwide.

Job Description: 
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Hivemind, you will play a key role in ensuring the performance, reliability, and scalability of our cloud infrastructure. You’ll be responsible for building and maintaining monitoring and alerting systems for both internal and external services, defining and evolving incident response strategies, and automating operational processes to minimize risk and eliminate toil. Your work will directly impact the stability and resilience of Hivemind’s platform, helping us deliver exceptional experiences to our users.

Job Description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Hivemind, you will play a key role in ensuring the performance, reliability, and scalability of our cloud infrastructure. You’ll be responsible for building and maintaining monitoring and alerting systems for both internal and external services, defining and evolving incident response strategies, and automating operational processes to minimize risk and eliminate toil. Your work will directly impact the stability and resilience of Hivemind’s platform, helping us deliver exceptional experiences to our users.

lists.content:
• Design, implement, and maintain robust monitoring, logging, and alerting systems 
  • Define incident response procedures and participate in on-call rotations 
  • Identify and resolve reliability and performance issues across services 
  • Develop automation tools to streamline operations and reduce manual interventions 
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure new services are production-ready 
  • Conduct root cause analyses and implement post-incident improvements 
  • Champion a culture of reliability, observability, and operational excellence

• 5+ years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or related roles 
  • Strong experience with AWS services (EC2, ECS/EKS, RDS, IAM, etc.) 
  • Deep understanding of Kubernetes and containerized deployments 
  • Proficiency with monitoring and observability tools (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, ELK) 
  • Strong scripting or programming skills (Python, Go, Bash, etc.) 
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar) 
  • Solid understanding of networking, Linux systems, and distributed architectures

• Experience with service meshes (e.g., Istio or Linkerd) 
  • Familiarity with security best practices in cloud environments 
  • Exposure to GitOps workflows and tools (e.g., ArgoCD or Flux)

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company whose mission is to protect service members and civilians with intelligent systems. In pursuit of this mission, Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Its AI pilot, Hivemind, has flown a fighter jet (F-16), a vertical takeoff and landing drone (V-BAT), and a quadcopter (Nova). The company has offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington DC and abroad. Shield AI’s products and people are currently in the field actively supporting operations with the U.S. Department of Defense and U.S. allies.  

The Task Planning team is part of the Pilot/Autonomy team for Hivemind Enterprise. The team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world. As a member of the team, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task, and motion planning. You will architect and write high-quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company whose mission is to protect service members and civilians with intelligent systems. In pursuit of this mission, Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Its AI pilot, Hivemind, has flown a fighter jet (F-16), a vertical takeoff and landing drone (V-BAT), and a quadcopter (Nova). The company has offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington DC and abroad. Shield AI’s products and people are currently in the field actively supporting operations with the U.S. Department of Defense and U.S. allies.  

The Task Planning team is part of the Pilot/Autonomy team for Hivemind Enterprise. The team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world. As a member of the team, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task, and motion planning. You will architect and write high-quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.

lists.content:
• Be the technical subject matter expert for task planning (planning, scheduling, allocation for multi-agent teams of autonomous systems)
  • Research, design, and implement state of the art algorithms for task planning in an extensible autonomy framework
  • Develop core systems that must be portable and scalable across different UAS platforms and compute architectures 
  • Develop software for a enterprise SDK for autonomy development
  • Work with our engineers, program managers, and product managers to define a technical roadmap for future autonomy solutions

• A Multi Agent Executive Manager for heterogeneous teams, which allocates members of flight wings to real-time emergent tasks. 
  • State of the art assignment, planning, or scheduling algorithms to vastly reduce operator overhead or operate in denied environments autonomously. 
  • NATO system interoperability and command chains for our autonomous vehicles 
  • End to end simulation and analysis for software- and hardware-in-the-loop testing and continuous integration.

• Typically requires a minimum of 12 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 9 years and a Master’s degree; or 7 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience with task planning/scheduling and multi-agent collaborative autonomy
  • Drive technical initiatives and architectural decisions that impact multiple teams and shape the overall engineering organization
  • Proficient with C++ 11 or newer in a production environment 
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery & test-driven development 
  • Strong knowledge of modern software engineering best practices 
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, strong communication skills, being a trustworthy teammate, and being kind to others 
  • Strong organizational skills

We are seeking a Senior Staff Aero-Propulsion Engineer with 10+ years of experience to lead the development, integration, and optimization of air-breathing propulsion systems for our aircraft platforms. This individual will play a key role in conceptual design, performance analysis, and system-level integration of propulsion technologies, ensuring optimal efficiency, reliability, and mission capability.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

We are seeking a Senior Staff Aero-Propulsion Engineer with 10+ years of experience to lead the development, integration, and optimization of air-breathing propulsion systems for our aircraft platforms. This individual will play a key role in conceptual design, performance analysis, and system-level integration of propulsion technologies, ensuring optimal efficiency, reliability, and mission capability.

lists.content:
• Lead aero-propulsion system design and optimization for aircraft platforms
  • Optimize propulsion integration with airframe and mission requirements
  • Drive aircraft inlet and nozzle design using a range of approaches from first-order to complex CFD and test
  • Integrate propulsion models into aircraft performance estimation tools
  • Define propulsion system architecture, including engine selection, thrust vectoring system design, and power management strategies.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with airframe, controls, electrical, and systems engineering teams to ensure seamless propulsion integration.
  • Work closely with suppliers and partners to evaluate and select propulsion system components.
  • Drive testing and validation, including wind tunnel, ground, and flight tests, to refine propulsion performance and reliability.
  • Mentor junior engineers and provide technical leadership on propulsion-related initiatives.

• B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field
  • 10+ years of industry experience
  • 5+ years of experience in aero-propulsion system design, integration, and testing
  • Expertise in inlet and nozzle design for air-breathing engines
  • Experience with ground and flight testing of propulsion systems
  • Strong problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills

• Background in external aerodynamics
  • Experience working in a fast-paced startup or R&D environment.

As part of the Hivemind Commander (HMC) team, you’ll play an active role in shaping and implementing our HMC Core Product. This HMC Core Product is a foundational, extensible set of services that enable both human operators (e.g. via command and control user interfaces) and third parties (e.g. to interoperate with wider networks) to interact with active Hivemind Edge (HME) autonomy systems and aircraft. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with other Core Product engineers, Solutions engineers and new customers to develop robust APIs and supporting infrastructure that enable seamless integration with new systems and user interfaces. Ultimately, you’ll make it easier to improve the ability of our software to adapt to new systems, thereby enhancing the quality and reliability of our products to protect service members and civilians with AI systems.

You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with other Core Product engineers, Solutions engineers and new customers to develop robust APIs and supporting infrastructure that enable seamless integration with new systems and user interfaces. Ultimately, you’ll make it easier to improve the ability of our software to adapt to new systems, thereby enhancing the quality and reliability of our products to protect service members and civilians with AI systems.

lists.content:
• Contribute to the HMC platform that will revolutionize the way engineers, operators, and subject matter experts develop and integrate autonomy solutions. 
  • Contribute to building, extending and documenting interfaces for internal and customer use. 
  • Drive the development of a robust command and control software development kit (SDK) for internal and customer user. 
  • Develop, mature, and maintain test and distribution capabilities within continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines. 
  • Other duties as assigned.

• 10+ years of related experience developing large, production quality software systems.  
  • Expertise and deep experience with modern C++ (C++17 and beyond) .  
  • Professional experience developing in Linux environments.  
  • Experience with Git and code management tools.    
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others.

• Experience with in aerospace and/or robotics industries  
  • Experience with command and control, mission planning and other operator-oriented systems for UAVs. 
  • Experience with international interoperability standards like STANAG4586. 
  • Experience with team leadership, or as a technical project lead  
  • Experience developing and maintaining software development kits (SDKs).

This position is perfect for a seasoned C++ engineer with advanced expertise in modeling and simulation, systems, and systems integration. As a key leader, you will tackle the most challenging and complex projects with minimal oversight, driving impactful results in collaboration with a dynamic and skilled team. You will develop simulation solutions to drive autonomy development on high impact projects. This is an opportunity to shape innovative solutions, integrating third-party systems and simulation environments, and advancing cutting-edge technologies.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

This position is perfect for a seasoned C++ engineer with advanced expertise in modeling and simulation, systems, and systems integration. As a key leader, you will tackle the most challenging and complex projects with minimal oversight, driving impactful results in collaboration with a dynamic and skilled team. You will develop simulation solutions to drive autonomy development on high impact projects. This is an opportunity to shape innovative solutions, integrating third-party systems and simulation environments, and advancing cutting-edge technologies.

lists.content:
• Lead the design, development, and maintenance of high-performance C++ software for complex systems. 
  • Architect robust, scalable simulation solutions for systems of systems and real-time processing. 
  • Drive the integration of third-party software and hardware systems into comprehensive architectures. 
  • Set technical standards and mentor other engineers to promote excellence and best practices. 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment and successful delivery. 
  • Implement modern agile software development practices, including continuous integration and test-driven development. 
  • Tackle complex debugging and optimization challenges to enhance system performance. 
  • Explore and adopt new technologies to stay at the forefront of the field. 
  • Drive task decomposition for teams and individuals

• Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 9 years and a Master’s degree; or 7 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience
  • Advanced professional experience in software engineering and systems integration 
  • Familiarity with design patterns and system-level engineering principles
  • Extensive experience in C++ using modern C++ (C++17/20) while possessing a solid understanding of older standards (C++98/03) for adapting to legacy code and systems seamlessly
  • Experience in Python
  • Experience with AFSIM or NGTS
  • Real-time and distributed simulation experience
  • Programming experience in a Linux environment (Windows experience is a bonus)
  • Expertise with Docker or other containerization mechanisms
  • Demonstrated success leading projects with 10+ contributors
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills, with a fast, efficient, and effective approach
  • Deep understanding of design patterns and system architecture principles
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery and test-driven development
  • Passion for learning and implementing new technologies 
  • Demonstrated experience being a trustworthy teammate 
  • Demonstrated kindness to teammates 
  • Ability to obtain a SECRET clearance

• MS or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience. 
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Advanced knowledge of third-party system integration (software and hardware). 
  • Experience with plugin development in DOD simulations such as AFSIM and NGTS 
  • Experience with web-service technologies like gRPC, REST APIs, message queues (ActiveMQ, ZeroMQ), etc.
  • Familiarity with C++ tooling like CMake and Conan
  • Experience with UCI and OMS Standards
  • Active SECRET clearance

• Strong leadership and mentorship capabilities
  • Exceptional communication and organizational skills
  • Dedication to delivering high-quality, innovative solutions
  • A collaborative and supportive team-oriented mindset
    •  
    This role is for individuals ready to lead with impact, taking ownership of their work and inspiring their teams to deliver outstanding results in an agile and forward-thinking environment

Shield AI has developed a software factory for building, optimizing, evaluating, and analyzing autonomy solutions. The technology has drawn significant interest from industry. lists.content:
• Work with a team of autonomy developers, test engineers, cyber security, and system administrators
  • Lead a small team of infrastructure engineers
  • Integrate our AI training factory and tooling onto new hardware
  • Provide software updates and configuration management between various isolated environments
  • Ensure proper operation of our AI training factory and tooling
  • Coordinate with autonomy teams to build and meet requirements
  • Solve challenging and important problems

• The ability to obtain and maintain a US Security Clearance.
  • Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 7 years and a Master’s degree; or 5 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • 3+ years demonstrated experience with cloud computing solutions and architecture, with a focus on Kubernetes and container orchestration
  • Experience with supporting C++ or Python-based applications
  • Expert understanding of Linux/Unix-based systems (specifically in networking and experience in designing and implementing networked applications)
  • Experience leading/mentoring a small team
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, similar degree, or equivalent practical experience
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, being a trustworthy teammate, holding yourself and others to high standards, and being kind to others
  • Experience debugging/troubleshooting deployed, distributed problems
  • Experience developing and deploying automation tooling (ex. Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Must be available to support onsite in Crystal City and surrounding NOVA area

• Experience with Authentication and Authorization frameworks and protocols
  • DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 Compliance

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Simulation Software Engineer with the Hivemind Forge Department, you will be responsible for several simulation environments that support the development and implementation of autonomous behavior on Group 3 and Group 5 unmanned aircraft. You will be an integral to definition of sensor capabilities, image rendering, environmental conditions, and integrated EO/IR based simulated payloads on simulated platforms.  The simulation environment you support will directly interact (through interfaces you create and maintain) with the autonomy and ground control station for VBATs and other platforms. As a Simulation Engineer you will ensure compliance with DoD and Industry standards (to include DIS and CIGI).

About our simulation environment – The Forge Simulation environment is multipurpose and written in the same stack as our autonomy environment. It utilizes Unreal Engine 5 for high fidelity visualization, Diligent Engine for low fidelity visualization, and integrates with DoD M&S products AFSIM and NGTS.  The environment promotes modularity with simulation blocks, interface blocks, and a common scenario format.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Simulation Software Engineer with the Hivemind Forge Department, you will be responsible for several simulation environments that support the development and implementation of autonomous behavior on Group 3 and Group 5 unmanned aircraft. You will be an integral to definition of sensor capabilities, image rendering, environmental conditions, and integrated EO/IR based simulated payloads on simulated platforms.  The simulation environment you support will directly interact (through interfaces you create and maintain) with the autonomy and ground control station for VBATs and other platforms. As a Simulation Engineer you will ensure compliance with DoD and Industry standards (to include DIS and CIGI).

About our simulation environment – The Forge Simulation environment is multipurpose and written in the same stack as our autonomy environment. It utilizes Unreal Engine 5 for high fidelity visualization, Diligent Engine for low fidelity visualization, and integrates with DoD M&S products AFSIM and NGTS.  The environment promotes modularity with simulation blocks, interface blocks, and a common scenario format.

lists.content:
• Improve and maintain existing Hivemind Forge Simulation Environment
  • Support packaging of final product to internal and external customers for training and testing
  • Driving technical design and integration of new simulated payloads as they become required for platform testing
  • Work on a team of 6-10 other software engineers on advancing features for the Forge simulation product
  • Support extensibility of simulation environment through well-defined interfaces provided by government and business customers

• Experience in a relevant DoD modeling and simulation environment 
  • Strong C/C++ development experience Comfortability within UNIX/Linux environments  
  • 10+ years of industry experience  
  • Experience working projects with 10+ contributors  
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience  
  • Demonstrated problem solving skills by applying a scientific approach  
  • Offer fast, efficient, effective problem-solving approaches  
  • Exceptional collaborator and communicator  
  • Hard-working, trustworthy teammate  
  • Exhibits holding themselves and others to high standard

• Experience using AFSIM or NGTS as a modeler or developer 
  • Integrating DoD M&S environments with a targeted platform (ex - F-16) 
  • Docker, Kubernetes, and/or containerized application development
  • MS or greater in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, and/or similar degree, or equivalent practical experience  
  • Understanding of robotics technologies related to autonomous behavior development e.g. task allocation or planning.  
  • Understanding/Experience with unmanned system technologies and accompanying algorithms (specifically air domain)

descriptionPlain: The Software Applications Engineer will provide technical expertise and support to customers during the implementation and use of Shield AI enterprise software products. This role involves working closely with customers to understand their requirements and ensuring successful product integration for AI & Autonomy development.
description: The Software Applications Engineer will provide technical expertise and support to customers during the implementation and use of Shield AI enterprise software products. This role involves working closely with customers to understand their requirements and ensuring successful product integration for AI & Autonomy development.

lists.content:
• Become an expert user of the Hivemind enterprise software stack. 
  • Provide technical support and training to customers. 
  • Develop AI & Autonomy applications using the Shield AI enterprise software development kit.
  • Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities, e.g., demos. 
  • Assist in post-sales deployment and integration of Shield AI enterprise software products. 
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation and training materials. 
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues. 
  • Help customers debug software/API integration issues. 
  • Collaborate with the engineering team to address customer feedback and improve products. 
  • Visit customers on site globally to support software integration and development activities.

• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. 
  • 7+ years of experience of industry experience
  • 3+ years of experience in an integration/applications engineering role 
  • 3+ years of experience working in a startup environment. 
  • Strong technical background in software engineering. 
  • Strong proficiency in writing modern C++ code. 
  • Intermediate proficiency in writing Python code. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Experience in the defense aviation or robotics industry. 
  • Experience building and running a small enterprise software applications/solutions engineering team.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


Job Description: 
Are you a deeply experienced and technically rigorous flight test engineer looking to lead groundbreaking work at the intersection of autonomy, aviation, and defense? Are you motivated by the opportunity to shape the test strategy of cutting-edge unmanned aerial systems in support of national security and real-world impact? Shield AI is seeking a Senior Staff Flight Test Engineer to lead high-consequence test programs across the full development lifecycle of our vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) UAVs.

As a Senior Staff Flight Test Engineer, you will define and drive system-level test strategies, ensure end-to-end integration of flight-critical systems, and lead multi-site, multi-phase flight test operations with technical excellence. Your leadership will directly influence product quality, safety, and performance in fast-paced prototyping and production environments.

Job Description:
Are you a deeply experienced and technically rigorous flight test engineer looking to lead groundbreaking work at the intersection of autonomy, aviation, and defense? Are you motivated by the opportunity to shape the test strategy of cutting-edge unmanned aerial systems in support of national security and real-world impact? Shield AI is seeking a Senior Staff Flight Test Engineer to lead high-consequence test programs across the full development lifecycle of our vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) UAVs.

As a Senior Staff Flight Test Engineer, you will define and drive system-level test strategies, ensure end-to-end integration of flight-critical systems, and lead multi-site, multi-phase flight test operations with technical excellence. Your leadership will directly influence product quality, safety, and performance in fast-paced prototyping and production environments.

lists.content:
• Own and execute the system-level test strategy for the V-BAT UAV across lab, ground, and flight environments.
  • Lead multi-disciplinary teams in the development, execution, and analysis of complex ground and flight test campaigns.
  • Serve as principal test conductor during critical operations, overseeing flight readiness reviews, risk assessments, pre- and post-flight briefs, and safety-critical decision-making.
  • Define and manage test configurations, including aircraft hardware, ground control systems, software baselines, and instrumentation assets.
  • Develop and enforce standard operating procedures, test documentation standards, and continuous improvement practices across the test organization.
  • Mentor junior and mid-level engineers on test engineering best practices, systems thinking, and root cause analysis.
  • Drive out-of-cycle investigative test efforts, coordinating directly with engineering and product teams to validate new capabilities or resolve emergent issues rapidly.
  • Lead qualification efforts, including Functional Acceptance Testing, test procedure development, and integration of hardware-in-the-loop and software-in-the-loop platforms.
  • Collaborate closely with systems engineering, software, mechanical, and avionics teams to ensure verification activities trace to requirements and mission objectives.
  • Author and present artifacts for safety reviews, regulatory submissions, and customer-facing technical documentation.

• Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, or a related STEM discipline.
  • 10+ years of experience in flight test engineering, with a proven track record of leading UAV or aircraft test programs from concept through validation.
  • Deep experience designing, planning, executing, and analyzing both developmental and qualification test events.
  • Demonstrated success working in cross-functional teams, especially in systems integration and root cause resolution.
  • Hands-on proficiency with flight test instrumentation, telemetry systems, test planning tools, and post-flight data analysis.
  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills, capable of influencing technical direction and driving execution in high-stakes environments.
  • Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive under pressure in a dynamic flight test environment.

• Experience with MATLAB, Python, or similar tools for test automation and data analysis.
  • Familiarity with MIL-STD-810 or other military environmental test protocols.
  • Prior experience with UAV operations, flight safety protocols, and FAA Part 107 operations.
  • Experience building or prototyping small aircraft or RC systems.
  • Proven background in leading R&D test programs in fast-paced or startup environments.

We are seeking an experienced Manufacturing Planner to help establish and optimize the planning organization for our new facility in India. This role will be responsible for developing and implementing production planning processes, training local planners, and ensuring seamless integration with our global supply chain. The ideal candidate has a strong background in manufacturing planning, ERP/MRP systems, and operational setup in new facilities.  

*This position requires 50% travel to India, all applicants must be amenable to this requirement.*

lists.content:
• Develop and implement production planning processes for the India facility, ensuring alignment with company standards.  
  • Train and mentor local planning staff on best practices, ERP/MRP systems, and workflow management.  
  • Establish key performance metrics and reporting structures to monitor and optimize production scheduling.  
  • Work closely with supply chain, production, and engineering teams to ensure material availability and schedule adherence.  
  • Identify and resolve planning bottlenecks, capacity constraints, and coordination issues as the facility ramps up.

• Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).  
  • 5+ years of experience in manufacturing planning, production scheduling, or supply chain management.  
  • Expertise in ERP/MRP systems for planning, scheduling, and inventory control.  
  • Experience training and developing planning teams in a manufacturing environment.  
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to work across time zones.

• Experience setting up planning functions in new manufacturing facilities, particularly in India.  
  • Background in aerospace, automotive, or other high-complexity manufacturing environments.  
  • Knowledge of lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methodologies.  
  • Familiarity with international supply chain coordination and vendor management.  
  • Ability to analyze data and develop strategies for improving scheduling efficiency.

Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Our Hivemind technology enables autonomous operations for aircraft and unmanned systems in complex, contested environments. As we expand our market presence, we are seeking a Pre-Sales & Partnerships Program Manager to drive technical engagement with potential customers, support key partnerships, and ensure the success of Hivemind adoption.

As a Partnerships Program Manager, you will be responsible for building and managing Shield AI’s partner ecosystem to drive the successful adoption of Hivemind. You will oversee partner onboarding, engagement, and integration efforts, ensuring strategic alignment between Shield AI and its technology and deployment partners. Your role will be critical in fostering strong relationships, optimizing partnership processes, and ensuring seamless partner integrations that support mission success.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

Shield AI is building the world’s best AI pilot. Our Hivemind technology enables autonomous operations for aircraft and unmanned systems in complex, contested environments. As we expand our market presence, we are seeking a Pre-Sales & Partnerships Program Manager to drive technical engagement with potential customers, support key partnerships, and ensure the success of Hivemind adoption.

As a Partnerships Program Manager, you will be responsible for building and managing Shield AI’s partner ecosystem to drive the successful adoption of Hivemind. You will oversee partner onboarding, engagement, and integration efforts, ensuring strategic alignment between Shield AI and its technology and deployment partners. Your role will be critical in fostering strong relationships, optimizing partnership processes, and ensuring seamless partner integrations that support mission success.

lists.content:
• Lead Pre-Sales Partner Engagements: Serve as the technical program manager for pre-sales efforts, ensuring potential partners understand and can evaluate Hivemind’s capabilities effectively.
  • Manage Key Partnerships: Oversee partner onboarding, engagement, and integration efforts, ensuring a streamlined collaboration between Shield AI and technology or deployment partners.
  • Drive Customer Success with Partners: Support proof-of-concept (POC) demonstrations, technical deep-dives, and pilot programs to validate Hivemind in customer environments.
  • Cross-Functional Coordination: Work closely with Engineering, Business Development, and Product teams to align partnerships strategy with technical capabilities and customer needs.
  • Process & Documentation Optimization: Develop and refine playbooks, best practices, and repeatable processes for partnership management.
  • Ensure Seamless Partner Integrations: Facilitate technical coordination for partners integrating Hivemind into their platforms, ensuring compatibility and mission success. 
  • Market & Competitive Analysis: Gather customer and partner feedback to inform Shield AI’s roadmap, enabling continuous improvements in Hivemind’s offerings.

• 8+ years of experience in partner program management, strategic partnerships, or business development within AI, autonomy, defense technology, or software development.
  • Proven track record in managing technology partnerships, integrations, and enablement programs.
  • Familiarity with autonomous systems, AI-driven software, and SDK/API integrations in real-world applications.
  • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, able to bridge technical and business discussions effectively. 
  • Proven ability to coordinate cross-functional teams in fast-paced environments, ensuring smooth execution of pre-sales and partnership initiatives. 
  • Experience in government, aerospace, or defense sectors is a strong plus.

• Experience with technical channel sales partnerships
  • Engineering background in addition business (ie MBA) acumen
  • Experience working in the defense or aerospace industry with knowledge of government customers and military use cases.
  • Familiarity with autonomous vehicle software, UAV systems, or robotic applications.
  • Certification in project management methodologies (e.g., PMP, Agile, or Scrum).

The Developer Experience Team strives to improve the development experience by optimizing workflows and guidelines, developing internal tools, and providing technical support to our customer, the Hivemind engineers. We identify areas of improvement by analyzing support requests, conducting interviews, and gathering feedback through surveys. Using these insights, in the role of DevEx Engineer - Tools, you'll collaborate with engineers to design, build, monitor, and maintain solutions to optimize the velocity, productivity, and efficiency of our engineers, while positively impacting software quality. If Developer Experience is new to you, read this!

The Developer Experience Team strives to improve the development experience by optimizing workflows and guidelines, developing internal tools, and providing technical support to our customer, the Hivemind engineers. We identify areas of improvement by analyzing support requests, conducting interviews, and gathering feedback through surveys. Using these insights, in the role of DevEx Engineer - Tools, you'll collaborate with engineers to design, build, monitor, and maintain solutions to optimize the velocity, productivity, and efficiency of our engineers, while positively impacting software quality. If Developer Experience is new to you, read this!

lists.content:
• Own internal tooling for Hivemind
  • Support and maintain our internal CLI tool ensuring it meets needs and its ease-of-use for developers.
  • Enhancing the productivity and efficiency of internal developers by creating, monitoring, and maintaining developer tools and workflows ensuring high reliability and performance.
  • Provide developers with technical support and help triage issues relating to tools the DevEx team supports.
  • Work closely with other team members and internal customers to understand and identify their needs to provide value.
  • Work with the rest of the DevEx team to support tool reusability between the inner and outer dev loop.
  • Help with the creation and interpretation of Developer Experience metrics & signals to identify and prioritize change.
  • Other DevEx duties as assigned.

• Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 9 years and a Master’s degree; or 7 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.
  • Experience with a compiled programming language (e.g. C, C++, Rust, Go) in a production environment.
  • Strong knowledge of scripting in Bash and Python.
  • Strong experience with Linux.
  • Familiarity with containers (e.g. Docker, Podman, etc.).
  • Strong desire to learn and grow on the job.

• Experience with Conan Package Manager (Conan 2 preferred)
  • Experience building production-ready developer tools from scratch 
  • Deep understanding of the C++ build ecosystem (CMake, make, vcpkg, Ninja)
  • Cloud experience with AWS/Azure

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


As a Senior Staff Software Engineer in our Hivemind Pilot organization, you will act as the technical conscience for our computer vision pipeline software, ensuring its architectural soundness, scalability, and alignment with our product vision. Your role will focus on architecting, implementing, and releasing state-of-the-art computer vision libraries (software, algorithms, and analytics) the form a core capability within the Hivemind Enterprise Software Development Kit (SDK). While this is not a people management role, it requires a seasoned technical leader who can guide the development of critical capabilities and set the standard for excellence in this domain. 
You will enable internal and external users of our software products to leverage, configure and extend these computer vision pipelines, empowering them to create custom capabilities for advanced autonomy applications across a variety of commercial and defense applications. Your expertise will directly enhance the ability of autonomous agents to perform complex video and image processing tasks.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

As a Senior Staff Software Engineer in our Hivemind Pilot organization, you will act as the technical conscience for our computer vision pipeline software, ensuring its architectural soundness, scalability, and alignment with our product vision. Your role will focus on architecting, implementing, and releasing state-of-the-art computer vision libraries (software, algorithms, and analytics) the form a core capability within the Hivemind Enterprise Software Development Kit (SDK). While this is not a people management role, it requires a seasoned technical leader who can guide the development of critical capabilities and set the standard for excellence in this domain. 
You will enable internal and external users of our software products to leverage, configure and extend these computer vision pipelines, empowering them to create custom capabilities for advanced autonomy applications across a variety of commercial and defense applications. Your expertise will directly enhance the ability of autonomous agents to perform complex video and image processing tasks.

lists.content:
• Serve as the technical authority for computer vision capabilities within our perception stack, driving technical decisions and ensuring robust design and implementation. 
  • Architect and develop core video and image processing C++ software libraries, released as part of our software products to external customers. 
  • Implement out-of-the-box computer vision capabilities for applications such as object detection, visual place recognition, visual odometry, and more. 
  • Advanced the state of the art in computer vision to enable advanced autonomy behaviors for commercial and defense applications 
  • Validate computer vision capabilities through various testing modalities (e.g., digitalsimulation, software-in-the-loop, hardware-in-the-loop, and flight testing) 
  • Collaborate with the product development team to shape the technical roadmap for perception  
  • Engage with internal and external customers to inform requirements for new features 
  • Enhance the performance of an exceptionally talented perception team by maintaininghigh standards of technical rigor, balancing development speed with product quality.   
  • Mentor and guide less experienced engineers, fostering technical excellence and sharing domain knowledge across the team.

• Typically requires a minimum of 10 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 9 years with a Master’s degree; or 7 years with a PhD; or equivalent work experience.

  • Demonstrated excellence in designing and developing scalable, extensible C++ video and image processing software for CPU and GPU systems in Linux environments, preferably for autonomous systems.

  • Extensive experience working with open-source video and image processing libraries, such as GStreamer and OpenCV.

  • Proven expertise in C++ software architecture design patterns and their practical implementation.

  • Strong knowledge of video encoding standards (e.g., H.264 and H.265) and their application.

  • Experience developing video or image processing algorithms for electro-optional sensors.

  • Strong Git and Linux development skills, along with modern software development practices (e.g., CI/CD, test-driven development).

  • A track record of technical leadership, with the ability to set and maintain high standards, guide teams through complex technical challenges, and collaborate effectively.

• Hands-on experience working with EO/IR sensor hardware used for defense applications 
  • Demonstrated excellence in designing and developing scalable, extensible C++ video and image processing software for CPU and GPU systems in Linux environments, preferably for autonomous systems. 
  • Extensive experience working with open-source video and image processing libraries, such as GStreamer and OpenCV. 
  • Strong knowledge of video encoding standards (e.g., H.264 and H.265) and their application.

• At Shield AI, you will work on cutting-edge technology that pushes the boundaries of autonomous systems. This role offers the opportunity to lead the technical direction of a critical component in our perception stack while collaborating with a team of talented engineers and researchers. Your work will have a direct impact on enabling advanced autonomy for defense and beyond.

This role will be responsible for developing procurement strategies, onboarding local suppliers, and ensuring a smooth flow of materials to support production. We are looking for an experienced Supply Chain Manager to help establish and optimize the supply chain operations for our new facility in India. This role will be responsible for developing procurement strategies, onboarding local suppliers, and ensuring a smooth flow of materials to support production. The ideal candidate has a strong background in supply chain management, international sourcing, and ERP/MRP systems. 

*This position requires 50% travel to India, all applicants must be amenable to this requirement*

lists.content:
• Develop and implement supply chain processes to support the India facility, ensuring alignment with global operations.  
  • Identify, qualify, and onboard local suppliers to improve lead times and reduce costs.  
  • Collaborate with production and planning teams to ensure material availability and minimize disruptions.  
  • Establish KPIs to monitor supplier performance, logistics efficiency, and inventory levels.  
  • Train and mentor the local supply chain team to build long-term operational capabilities.

• Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Business, Industrial Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).  
  • 5+ years of experience in supply chain management, procurement, or logistics.  
  • Experience working with ERP/MRP systems for purchasing, inventory, and supplier management.  
  • Strong negotiation skills with a proven track record of supplier development.  
  • Ability to work across time zones and collaborate with global teams.

• Experience setting up supply chain functions in new manufacturing facilities, particularly in India.  
  • Knowledge of aerospace, automotive, or other high-complexity manufacturing environments.  
  • Familiarity with lean supply chain principles and cost-reduction strategies.  
  • Understanding of import/export regulations and compliance requirements.  
  • Strong data analysis skills to drive decision-making and process improvements.

descriptionPlain:
Shield AI is a venture-backed defence technology company building intelligent autonomous systems for aircraft. Our mission is to protect service members and civilians through AI and autonomy.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI’s flagship autonomy software, Hivemind, powers aircraft, drones, and other platforms to perform complex missions with high reliability in contested environments. 

For more information, visit www.shield.ai and follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and Instagram.
description:
Shield AI is a venture-backed defence technology company building intelligent autonomous systems for aircraft. Our mission is to protect service members and civilians through AI and autonomy.

Founded in 2015, Shield AI’s flagship autonomy software, Hivemind, powers aircraft, drones, and other platforms to perform complex missions with high reliability in contested environments.

For more information, visit www.shield.ai and follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and Instagram.

lists.content:
• Design, develop, and deploy C++ software to support advanced autonomy and AI solutions for real-world missions.
  • Collaborate with engineers working on AI, computer vision, control systems and robotics integration.
  • Develop tooling, automation, and testing frameworks to support AI/robotics software development.
  • Work closely with Subject Matter Experts to translate complex mission needs into high-quality software solutions.
  • Develop and deploy software for edge compute (ARM), Linux, and Windows platforms.
  • Contribute to cross-platform development and integration, including hardware interfacing.
  • Work in an Agile Scrum environment, participating in sprints, reviews, and continuous improvement.
  • Contribute to .NET (C#) and JavaScript frameworks where relevant, with opportunities to broaden your tech stack.

• Recent, hands-on C++ software development experience.
  • Experience working in cross-platform environments, including Windows, Linux, and ARM-based systems.
  • Ability to work with hardware integration and complex system interfaces.
  • Strong problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills.
  • Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to take ownership of outcomes and deliverables.
  • Comfortable working from loose scopes and driving tasks to completion with autonomy.
  • Passion for solving complex technical challenges and working on impactful AI-based products.

• Experience with multi-threaded, runtime-critical systems and algorithmic computation.
  • System architecture design and development experience.
  • Client/partner collaboration skills - comfortable working with external engineering teams (occasional travel a plus).
  • Experience with automated build and testing tools (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
  • Background or interest in image/video processing, artificial intelligence, or computer vision technologies.

• Work on mission-critical AI and autonomy systems solving real-world defence and security challenges.
  • Join a high-performing, collaborative engineering team working at the cutting edge of technology.
  • Enjoy a flexible, supportive work environment - our office is located in Port Melbourne, close to Melbourne CBD.
  • Salary + equity for permanent roles, with flexible working options available.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    


The Planning and Controls (PAC) team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world.

As a member of PAC, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls. You will architect core systems, write high quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.
description:
Founded in 2015, Shield AI is a venture-backed defense technology company with the mission of protecting service members and civilians with intelligent, autonomous systems. Its products include Hivemind Enterprise—EdgeOS, Pilot, Commander, and Forge—as well as V-BAT and Sentient Vision Systems (wide-area motion imaging software). With offices in San Diego, Dallas, Washington, D.C., Abu Dhabi (UAE), Kyiv (Ukraine), and Melbourne (Australia), Shield AI’s technology actively supports U.S. and allied operations worldwide.  For more information, visit www.shield.ai. Follow Shield AI on LinkedIn, X and Instagram.    

The Planning and Controls (PAC) team is an agile group of engineers focused on researching and developing state-of-the-art algorithms that drive intelligent and confidence-inspiring flight behaviors while accounting for an uncertain and dynamic world.

As a member of PAC, you will work at the intersection of artificial intelligence, task & motion planning, and controls. You will architect core systems, write high quality software for core systems, set standards for software engineering, refine technical requirements, drive strategic technical improvements, and mentor other engineers.

lists.content:
• Research, design, and implement state-of-the-art planning algorithms, taking ideas from conception to field deployment
  • Optimize the planning stack on the CPU and GPU
  • Develop core systems that must be portable and scalable across different UAS platforms and compute architectures
  • Work with our Hivemind Design Software team to design and build infrastructure for the PAC team that both supports local development and scales into the cloud
  • Work with soft or hard real-time operating systems
  • Work with robotics middleware such as ROS and PX4
  • Work on algorithms, including graph search, sampling-based planning, etc.
  • Work with and deploy our AI stack to edge devices
  • Work in collaboration with our DevOps teams to architect and maintain our cloud infrastructure, working with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes; assist with cross-platform builds and test orchestration, working with build tools (e.g. CMake, Bazel, etc.) and compiler tool chains (e.g. gcc, llvm, etc.)

• Design and implement Mission Planning interfaces or Multi-agent coordination for Tasks given to heterogeneous teams.
  • Port PAC libraries, where applicable, to CUDA kernels
  • Port PAC libraries to EdgeOS, a Shield AI Middleware framework, that enables portability of PAC libraries to multiple platforms and compute architectures
  • Design and implement an analysis and simulation framework that: enables testing of various components in isolation or in a fully integrated manner; supports parameter sweeps; supports hardware-in-the-loop

• Typically requires a minimum of 2 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or a Master’s degree
  • Proficient with C++ 11, 14, or 17 in a production environment (e.g. support for both internal and external customers)
  • Experience in a collaborative development environment, focused on continuous integration/delivery & test-driven development
  • Strong knowledge of modern software engineering best practices
  • Demonstrated record of working hard, strong communication skills, being a trustworthy teammate, and being kind to others
  • Familiarity with writing thread-safe multi-threaded programs
  • Familiarity with common debugging and profiling tools (e.g. gdb, valgrind, etc.)
  • Familiarity with git, bash, Python

Job Description:
The Avionics Manufacturing Engineer will play a key role in the development and optimization of manufacturing processes for aerospace electronics. This position focuses on improving efficiency, ensuring high-quality production standards, and solving complex challenges related to PCB manufacturing, board bring-up, and testing in a fast-paced startup environment. The engineer will work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, production, and quality, to streamline avionics manufacturing, troubleshoot board-level issues, reduce costs, and ensure timely delivery of high-reliability electronics. This role is critical to supporting the scaling of avionics production as the company grows.

Job Description:
The Avionics Manufacturing Engineer will play a key role in the development and optimization of manufacturing processes for aerospace electronics. This position focuses on improving efficiency, ensuring high-quality production standards, and solving complex challenges related to PCB manufacturing, board bring-up, and testing in a fast-paced startup environment. The engineer will work closely with cross-functional teams, including design, production, and quality, to streamline avionics manufacturing, troubleshoot board-level issues, reduce costs, and ensure timely delivery of high-reliability electronics. This role is critical to supporting the scaling of avionics production as the company grows.

lists.content:
• Develop, implement, and optimize manufacturing processes for aerospace avionics and PCB assemblies.
  • Identify areas for efficiency improvements and cost reductions in board manufacturing and testing.
  • Collaborate with design and production teams to ensure manufacturability and testability of new avionics products.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve board bring-up issues, component failures, and manufacturing defects to improve yield and reliability.
  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance avionics production performance and support scalability.

• Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field, or relevant experience.
  • 5+ years of experience in manufacturing engineering, with a focus on avionics, PCB assembly, and board testing in rapid-growth environments.
  • Experience in scaling avionics production processes in a startup or high-growth setting.
  • Strong understanding of PCB manufacturing, board bring-up, circuit testing, and troubleshooting electronic assemblies.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment and adapt to changing priorities.

• Knowledge of quality standards, such as AS9100, ISO 9001, or IPC-A-610 for electronics manufacturing.  
  • Proficiency in PCB design and analysis tools (e.g., Altium, KiCad, or Mentor Graphics).  
  • Familiarity with advanced electronics manufacturing technologies, such as automated optical inspection (AOI), in-circuit testing (ICT), and X-ray inspection.  
  • Knowledge of ERP/MRP systems and data-driven decision-making in an electronics manufacturing context.  
  • Hands-on experience with board bring-up, test fixture design, and debugging electronic assemblies.  
  • Strong project management skills, including experience managing multiple priorities and deadlines in avionics production.

Job Description:
The Senior Manager of Manufacturing Engineering will lead a team responsible for developing, optimizing, and scaling manufacturing processes for aerospace production. This role requires strong technical expertise in manufacturing engineering, process improvement, and automation, with a focus on increasing efficiency, quality, and throughput. The ideal candidate will collaborate cross-functionally with design, production, and supply chain teams to ensure seamless integration of new technologies and processes. Additionally, they will drive continuous improvement initiatives, mentor engineers, and support the strategic growth of the manufacturing organization.
